original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni dngos po gang zhig go //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni dngos po gang zhig go //
translated: â€œWhateverâ€ refers to whatever thing.

original: gang dang ldan par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni yon tan gang dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang dang ldan par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni yon tan gang dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: â€œEndowed withâ€ refers to endowed with whatever quality.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po de ni'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po de ni'o //
translated: â€œThatâ€ refers to that thing.

original: de'i rgyu can yin par shes te zhes bya ba ni yon tan de'i rgyu dang ldan pa yin par grags pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu can yin par shes te zhes bya ba ni yon tan de'i rgyu dang ldan pa yin par grags pa'o //
translated: â€œIt is known to have that as its causeâ€ means it is known to have that quality as its cause.

original: de'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to illustrate that, he says:

original: dper na tsandan gyi zhogs ma dang gyo mo dang snod dang rgyan la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na tsandan gyi zhogs ma dang gyo mo dang snod dang rgyan la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, it is like the powder, the shards, the pot, the ornament, etc. of sandalwood.

original: dper na tsandan gyi zhogs ma dag kyang tsandan gyi rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i phyir de dag tsandan gyi rgyu can yin pa dang / kham pa'i gyo bo ngag kyang kham pa'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i phyir de dag kyang kham pa'i rgyu can yin pa dang /ğŸ”½khar ba'i snod la sogs pa yang khar @141a * //
analyzed: dper na tsandan gyi zhogs ma dag kyang tsandan gyi rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i phyir de dag tsandan gyi rgyu can yin pa dang / kham pa'i gyo bo ngag kyang kham pa'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i phyir de dag kyang kham pa'i rgyu can yin pa dang /ğŸ”½khar ba'i snod la sogs pa yang khar @141a * //
translated: For example, the powder of sandalwood is known to have sandalwood as its cause because it is endowed with the nature of sandalwood. The shards of a pot are known to have a pot as their cause because they are endowed with the nature of a pot.ğŸ”½The pot, etc. of a pot are known to have a pot as their cause because they are endowed with the nature of a pot.

original: ba'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i phyir de dag kyang khar ba'i rgyu can yin pa dang / gdu bu dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa gser gyi rgyan dag kyang gser gyi rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i phyir de dag kyang gser gyi rgyu can yin par shes pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ba'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i phyir de dag kyang khar ba'i rgyu can yin pa dang / gdu bu dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa gser gyi rgyan dag kyang gser gyi rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i phyir de dag kyang gser gyi rgyu can yin par shes pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because they have the nature of gold, and because the golden ornaments such as bracelets and necklaces are known to have gold as their cause, because they have the nature of gold.

original: de ni dpes mtshon pa'i don gyis mjug sdud par byed de /
analyzed: de ni dpes mtshon pa'i don gyis mjug sdud par byed de /
translated: He concludes by illustrating the meaning of the example:

original: de'i phyir de bzhin du nang gi bye brag rnams kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang gti mug dang ldan pas de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyis na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin du nang gi bye brag rnams kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang gti mug dang ldan pas de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyis na /
translated: Therefore, in the same way, the internal divisions are endowed with pleasure, pain, and delusion. Therefore, by the reason stated,

original: nang gi bye brag rnams kyi rgyu ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nang gi bye brag rnams kyi rgyu ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: the cause of the internal divisions is pleasure, pain, and delusion.

original: 'di ni rjes su 'gro ba'i gzhung gzugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rjes su 'gro ba'i gzhung gzugs pa'o //
translated: This is the formulation of the pervasion.

original: gzhung gzugs pa gzhan bzhi po tshad kyi gzhung gzugs pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gzhung gzugs pa dang / nus pa 'jug pa'i gzhung gzugs pa dang / rang bzhin sna tshogs kyi gzhung gzugs pa zhes bya ba dag ni 'dir ma bris te /
analyzed: gzhung gzugs pa gzhan bzhi po tshad kyi gzhung gzugs pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gzhung gzugs pa dang / nus pa 'jug pa'i gzhung gzugs pa dang / rang bzhin sna tshogs kyi gzhung gzugs pa zhes bya ba dag ni 'dir ma bris te /
translated: The other four types of formal argumentâ€”the formal argument of valid cognition, the formal argument of cause and effect, the formal argument of the operation of power, and the formal argument of the variety of naturesâ€”are not written about here.

original: gzhung gzugs pa lnga dang / gzhung gzugs pa med pa lnga po rnam par dbye ba de dag gis rtag tu nang gi bye brag rnams la rgyu lnga ni yod par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: gzhung gzugs pa lnga dang / gzhung gzugs pa med pa lnga po rnam par dbye ba de dag gis rtag tu nang gi bye brag rnams la rgyu lnga ni yod par sgrub par byed do //
translated: The five types of formal argument and the five types of non-formal argument are analyzed in this text. The five causes are always established in the various internal distinctions.

original: gal te sangs rgyas pa dag kho bo la phung po rnams snying stobs dang / rdul dang mun pa'i yon tan dang ldan par ma grub pas khyod kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub po zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas pa dag kho bo la phung po rnams snying stobs dang / rdul dang mun pa'i yon tan dang ldan par ma grub pas khyod kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub po zhes zer na /
translated: If the Buddhists say to us, â€œThe meaning of your reason is not established because the aggregates are not established as possessing the qualities of goodness, passion, and darkness,â€

original: de'i phyir grangs can dag rang nyid kyi dogs pa de sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir grangs can dag rang nyid kyi dogs pa de sgrub par byed do //
translated: then the SÄá¹ƒkhya would establish their own doubt.

original: gang gi phyir gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'am /
translated: Because the reason is not established for either party,

original: the tshom za ba'i tshig ni yang sgrub pa la ltos pa'i mtshan nyid yod pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i tshig ni yang sgrub pa la ltos pa'i mtshan nyid yod pas de'i phyir /
translated: The phrase â€œsubject to doubtâ€ has the characteristic of relying on proof.

original: gzugs dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po rnams kyang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gti mug gi ngo bo nyid yin pas gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po rnams kyang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gti mug gi ngo bo nyid yin pas gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the aggregates characterized as form, feeling, discernment, formation, and consciousness are to be apprehended as having the nature of pleasure, pain, and delusion,

original: phung po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are aggregates.

original: tshor ba'i phung po bzhin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po bzhin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since they are like the aggregate of feeling, therefore the meaning of the reason is not unestablished.

original: 'dir yang gzugs dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po rnams kyang zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: 'dir yang gzugs dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po rnams kyang zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /
translated: Here, the aggregates characterized as form, feeling, discernment, formation, and consciousness are the subject.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi ngo bo nyid yin par gzung bar bya ste zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi ngo bo nyid yin par gzung bar bya ste zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
translated: They are to be apprehended as having the nature of pleasure, pain, and delusion is the predicate to be proven.

original: phung po yin @141b ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
analyzed: phung po yin @141b ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
translated: The phrase â€œbecause they are aggregatesâ€ is the property to be established.

original: tshor ba'i phung po bzhin pas zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po bzhin pas zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin /
translated: The phrase â€œlike the aggregate of feelingâ€ is the example.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mjug bsdu ba yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mjug bsdu ba yin par sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the phrase â€œso the reason is not unestablishedâ€ is the conclusion.

original: 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po bzhi po dag kyang /
analyzed: 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po bzhi po dag kyang /
translated: The condensed meaning of this is as follows: The four aggregates of form and so on

original: snying stobs dang / rdul dang mun pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par gzung ste de dag phung po yin pa'i phyir tshor ba tshor ba'i phung po bzhin no //ğŸ”½dper na tshor ba ni phung po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snying stobs dang / rdul dang mun pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par gzung ste de dag phung po yin pa'i phyir tshor ba tshor ba'i phung po bzhin no // dper na tshor ba ni phung po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: are apprehended as having the nature of sattva, rajas, and tamas, because they are aggregates, like the aggregate of feeling.

original: tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi ngo bo nyid yin par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi ngo bo nyid yin par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: For example, feeling is apprehended as having the nature of pleasure, pain, and delusion, because it is an aggregate.

original: 'di ltar bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba zhes brjod pa dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: 'di ltar bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba zhes brjod pa dang 'dra bar /
translated: For example, it is said that the aggregate of feeling is the aggregate of feeling.ğŸ”½Similarly, the aggregate of form is apprehended as having the nature of sattva, rajas, and tamas, because it is an aggregate.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po bzhi po dag kyang phung po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po bzhi po dag kyang phung po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The four aggregates of form and so on are also aggregates.

original: de dag bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi ngo bo nyid yin par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de dag bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi ngo bo nyid yin par 'gyur bas /
translated: Therefore, since they possess pleasure, pain, and delusion, they would be the intrinsic reality of pleasure, pain, and delusion.

original: de'i phyir de dag dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ji skad smras pa de ma grub pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ji skad smras pa de ma grub pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, since they possess those, the reason â€œbecause they possess thatâ€ is not unestablished, as stated.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: the author of the commentary says:

original: de la 'dir tsandan la sogs don dam par ma grub pas dpe med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de la 'dir tsandan la sogs don dam par ma grub pas dpe med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Here, since sandalwood and so on are not ultimately established, there is no example.

original: de la 'dir zhes bya ba ni sgrub par snga ma de la 'dir 'grel pa byed pas sun dbyung ba smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dir zhes bya ba ni sgrub par snga ma de la 'dir 'grel pa byed pas sun dbyung ba smras pa yin no //
translated: Here means in the previous proof. Here the author of the commentary states the refutation.

original: tsandan la sogs pa don dam par ma grub pas dpe med do zhes bya ba ni kho bo'i phyogs la tsandan dang / gyo mo dang / snod dang / rgyan la sogs pa don dam par ma grub pas khyod kyi dpe med do //
analyzed: tsandan la sogs pa don dam par ma grub pas dpe med do zhes bya ba ni kho bo'i phyogs la tsandan dang / gyo mo dang / snod dang / rgyan la sogs pa don dam par ma grub pas khyod kyi dpe med do //
translated: â€œYour example does not existâ€ means that since sandalwood and so on are not ultimately established, your example does not exist in our position.

original: don dam par dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir tsandan la sogs pa don dam par ma grub bo //
analyzed: don dam par dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir tsandan la sogs pa don dam par ma grub bo //
translated: Since ultimately all things are not produced, sandalwood and so on are not ultimately established.

original: de'i phyir khyod kyi gtan tshigs de dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i dpe med pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod kyi gtan tshigs de dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i dpe med pas /
translated: Therefore, since your example does not exist, your argument â€œbecause it possesses thatâ€ is not established.

original: des na grangs can dag gi sgrub pa nang gi bye brag rnams kyi rgyu ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug yin par nges te de dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na grangs can dag gi sgrub pa nang gi bye brag rnams kyi rgyu ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug yin par nges te de dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore the SÄá¹ƒkhyaâ€™s proof that the cause of the internal divisions is definitely pleasure, pain, and delusion because it possesses that is not established.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na yang gang zhig gang dang ldan par 'gyur ba de ni de'i rgyu can yin par shes te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na yang gang zhig gang dang ldan par 'gyur ba de ni de'i rgyu can yin par shes te /
translated: Thus in the world, whatever possesses something is known to be caused by that.

original: dper na tsandan gyi zhogs ma dang / gyo mo dang / snod dang / rgyan la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa sgrub pa snga ma de yang dpe med pas gtan tshigs ma grub @142a * //
analyzed: dper na tsandan gyi zhogs ma dang / gyo mo dang / snod dang / rgyan la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa sgrub pa snga ma de yang dpe med pas gtan tshigs ma grub @142a * //
translated: This previous proof is also a nonestablished reason because the example does not exist.

original: ba'i phyir dam bcas pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: ba'i phyir dam bcas pa tsam du zad do //
translated: Therefore it is mere assertion.

original: sgrub pa gnyis pa la yang gang la gzugs dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po rnams kyang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi ngo bo nyid yin par gzung bar bya ste zhes sgrub pa de la yang tha snyad du yang dpe ma grub ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa gnyis pa la yang gang la gzugs dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po rnams kyang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi ngo bo nyid yin par gzung bar bya ste zhes sgrub pa de la yang tha snyad du yang dpe ma grub ste /
translated: Moreover, in the second proof, the statement, â€œThat which is the aggregates characterized by form, feeling, discernment, and consciousness should be apprehended as the nature of pleasure, pain, and delusion,â€ is also an unestablished example even conventionally.

original: de'i phyir tha snyad du yang gti mug ni 'du byed kyi phung por gtogs pas dpe ma grub bo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad du yang gti mug ni 'du byed kyi phung por gtogs pas dpe ma grub bo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said that the example is not established because delusion is included in the aggregate of formation even conventionally.

original: tshor ba la gti mug med pas de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba cha gcig gi dpes stong ste /
analyzed: tshor ba la gti mug med pas de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba cha gcig gi dpes stong ste /
translated: Since there is no delusion in feeling, therefore the probandum is empty of an example in part.

original: re zhig kun rdzob tu yang skyon de yod do //
analyzed: re zhig kun rdzob tu yang skyon de yod do //
translated: For a while, there is the fault that even conventionally,

original: don dam par ni tshor ba'i phung po ma skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par ni tshor ba'i phung po ma skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: but ultimately, because the feeling aggregate is not produced,

original: dpe'i chos can ma grub pa'i skyon yang yod do //
analyzed: dpe'i chos can ma grub pa'i skyon yang yod do //
translated: there is the fault that the example property is not established.

original: ci ste sbyor ba 'di lta bu byed de /
analyzed: ci ste sbyor ba 'di lta bu byed de /
translated: If one makes the argument in this way,

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i phung po rnams bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i phung po rnams bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: â€œThe aggregates called form, feeling, discernment, compositional factors, and consciousness are the nature of pleasure, pain, and delusion,

original: phung po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are aggregates,

original: 'du byed kyi phung po bzhin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po bzhin no zhes zer na /
translated: like the compositional factor aggregate,â€

original: de lta na yang 'du byed kyi phung po dper bzhag pa ni sgrub pa shin tu stong pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'du byed kyi phung po dper bzhag pa ni sgrub pa shin tu stong pa yin te /
translated: then in that case, the example of the compositional factor aggregate is a completely empty proof,

original: 'di ltar 'du byed kyi phung po de la gti mug yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du byed kyi phung po de la gti mug yod du zin kyang /
translated: because even though there is delusion in that compositional factor aggregate,

original: de la bde pa dang / sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bde pa dang / sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is neither pleasure nor pain in it.

original: ci ste sbyor ba 'di lta bu byed de /
analyzed: ci ste sbyor ba 'di lta bu byed de /
translated: If one makes the argument in this way,

original: gzugs dang / 'du shes dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po gsum po dag bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi ngo bo nyid yin te phung po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs dang / 'du shes dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po gsum po dag bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi ngo bo nyid yin te phung po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The three aggregates characterized as form, feeling, and consciousness are the nature of pleasure, pain, and delusion because they are aggregates.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du byed kyi phung po bzhin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du byed kyi phung po bzhin no zhes zer na /
translated: Like the aggregates of feeling and formation.

original: de lta na yang tshor ba'i phung po la bde ba dang sdug bsngal yod cing /
analyzed: de lta na yang tshor ba'i phung po la bde ba dang sdug bsngal yod cing /
translated: But in that case, the aggregate of feeling would have pleasure and pain,

original: 'du byed rnams la gti mug yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la gti mug yod du zin kyang /
translated: and formations would have delusion.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du byed gnyis las gang yang rung ba gcig ma nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du byed gnyis las gang yang rung ba gcig ma nges par 'gyur te /
translated: But since either feeling or formation is not ascertained,

original: ci re zhig tshor ba dang 'du byed kyi phung po gnyis bzhin du /
analyzed: ci re zhig tshor ba dang 'du byed kyi phung po gnyis bzhin du /
translated: is it that like the two aggregates of feeling and formation,ğŸ”½the three aggregates characterized as form, feeling, and consciousness have pleasure, pain, and delusion?

original: gzugs dang / 'du shes dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po gsum po dag kyang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug dang ldan par 'gyur pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs dang / 'du shes dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po gsum po dag kyang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug dang ldan par 'gyur pa'am /
translated: Or is it that like the three aggregates of form, feeling, and consciousness,ğŸ”½the aggregates of feeling and formation have pleasure, pain, and delusion?

original: 'on te gzugs dang / 'du shes dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po gsum po dag phung po yin pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½tshor ba'i phung po'am /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs dang / 'du shes dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po gsum po dag phung po yin pa'i phyir / tshor ba'i phung po'am /
translated: Or, because the three aggregates of form, feeling, and discrimination are aggregates,

original: 'du byed kyi phung po bzhin du /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po bzhin du /
translated: then like the aggregate of feeling or the aggregate of formation,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba'am gti mug las @142b gang yang rung ba gcig dang ldan par 'gyur ba ma nges so //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba'am gti mug las @142b gang yang rung ba gcig dang ldan par 'gyur ba ma nges so //
translated: they would definitely possess either pleasure or pain or delusion.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag las gzhan pa shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i chos rnams ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin par nges te gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag las gzhan pa shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i chos rnams ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin par nges te gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But it is certain that phenomena that are not pleasure or pain or consciousness do not have the nature of pleasure or pain, because they are objects of knowledge,

original: dper na shes pa bzhin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na shes pa bzhin pas de'i phyir /
translated: like consciousness.

analyzed: de la ci ste zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dbu ma pas rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa dag gi dogs pa bsu ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: The word â€œifâ€ is a statement that anticipates the objection of those who assert that intrinsic nature is a cause.

original: mi gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas sngar gtso bo ni chen po la sogs pa de kho na'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas sngar gtso bo ni chen po la sogs pa de kho na'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the reason â€œbecause it is not clearâ€ is this.ğŸ”½

original: mi gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the reason â€œbecause it is not manifestâ€ is the meaning of the reason â€œbecause it is not manifestâ€ that the Madhyamika previously stated when he said that prakriti is not the cause of mahat and so on.

original: gal te gsal ba'i sngon rol gyi gnas skabs la byan ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba'i sngon rol gyi gnas skabs la byan ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: If you say that it is the state prior to manifestation,

original: 'dir gsal ba zhes bya ba ni chen po ste /
analyzed: 'dir gsal ba zhes bya ba ni chen po ste /
translated: then the term manifestation refers to mahat.

original: chen po ni cung zad tsam dang 'gyur ba tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen po ni cung zad tsam dang 'gyur ba tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because mahat is a mere something and a mere transformation.

original: de'i sngon rol gyi gnas skabs zhes bya ba ni gtso bo ste /
analyzed: de'i sngon rol gyi gnas skabs zhes bya ba ni gtso bo ste /
translated: The state prior to that is prakriti.

original: gtso bo ni rtags med cing mi gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½de'i phyir gal te gtso bo mi gsal ba nyid gang yin pa de gtan tshigs nyid du brjod na ni /
analyzed: gtso bo ni rtags med cing mi gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir gal te gtso bo mi gsal ba nyid gang yin pa de gtan tshigs nyid du brjod na ni /
translated: Because prakriti is without signs and is not manifest.ğŸ”½Therefore, if you state that the very nonmanifestation of prakriti is the reason,

original: des na dpe sgrub pa'i chos dang mi ldan pa'i skyon du 'gyur la zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: des na dpe sgrub pa'i chos dang mi ldan pa'i skyon du 'gyur la zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: then you have the fault of stating a reason that does not prove the example.

original: dpe zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas sngar dper na skyes bu bzhin pas zhes smras pas te skyes bu yin no //
analyzed: dpe zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas sngar dper na skyes bu bzhin pas zhes smras pas te skyes bu yin no //
translated: The example is the statement by the Madhyamika, â€œFor example, like a person.â€

original: sgrub pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas sngar mi gsal ba'i phyir zhes smras pa ste /ğŸ”½gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas sngar mi gsal ba'i phyir zhes smras pa ste / gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The probandum is the statement by the Madhyamika, â€œBecause of being unclear.â€ğŸ”½The reason is the statement by the Madhyamika, â€œBecause of being unclear.â€

original: mi ldan pa'i skyon du 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gtso bo mi gsal ba nyid gang yin pa de skyes bu la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi ldan pa'i skyon du 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gtso bo mi gsal ba nyid gang yin pa de skyes bu la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fault of non-possession is as follows: since the unclearness of prakriti does not exist in a person,ğŸ”½If it is said to be the existence of consciousness,

original: gal te shes pa yod pa nyid la bya na ni zhes bya ba la shes pa yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni skyes bu'i rang bzhin te de yang rtags med cing mi gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te shes pa yod pa nyid la bya na ni zhes bya ba la shes pa yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni skyes bu'i rang bzhin te de yang rtags med cing mi gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the existence of consciousness is the nature of a person, and that is also without a reason and is unclear.

original: de'i phyir gal te shes pa yod pa nyid kyi mi gsal ba nyid gang yin pa gtan tshigs de nyid du brjod na ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te shes pa yod pa nyid kyi mi gsal ba nyid gang yin pa gtan tshigs de nyid du brjod na ni /
translated: Therefore, if the unclearness of the existence of consciousness is stated as the reason,

original: des na gtan tshigs kyi don mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs kyi don mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: then the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: gtan @144b tshigs kyi don zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtan @144b tshigs kyi don zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning of the syllogism is this:

original: dbu ma pas sngar mi gsal ba'i phyir zhes smras pa ste /
analyzed: dbu ma pas sngar mi gsal ba'i phyir zhes smras pa ste /
translated: The Madhyamika previously stated, â€œbecause it is not manifest.â€

original: gtso bo ni mi gsal ba'i phyir chen po la sogs pa de kho na'i rgyu ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: gtso bo ni mi gsal ba'i phyir chen po la sogs pa de kho na'i rgyu ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: The reason is that the great one and so on are not the cause of reality because the principal is not manifest.

original: de ni ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar shes pa yod pa nyid kyi mi gsal ba nyid gang yin pa de gtso bo la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar shes pa yod pa nyid kyi mi gsal ba nyid gang yin pa de gtso bo la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The response to that is, â€œThat is unestablished.â€ The reason is that whatever nonmanifestation there is of the existence of consciousness does not exist in the principal.

original: de ltar na dbu ma pa'i phyogs kyi chos de mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ltar na dbu ma pa'i phyogs kyi chos de mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus he says that the property of the position of the Madhyamika is not tenable.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good.

original: gtan tshigs spyir brjod pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: gtan tshigs spyir brjod pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because the reason is stated generally,

original: bye brag tu brjod na yang nye bar sbyar bas spyir gcig tu byed pa'i phyir ltag chod de ni ma grub pa ltar snang ba yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: bye brag tu brjod na yang nye bar sbyar bas spyir gcig tu byed pa'i phyir ltag chod de ni ma grub pa ltar snang ba yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: or because even if it is stated specifically, it is applied generally, that reductio is an apparent nonestablishment.

original: de la de ni bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grangs can gyis smras pa /ğŸ”½de ni dbu ma pa'i dpe sgrub pa'i chos dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de la de ni bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grangs can gyis smras pa / de ni dbu ma pa'i dpe sgrub pa'i chos dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin la /
translated: The reply to that is, â€œThat is not good.â€ğŸ”½That is not good because the SÄá¹ƒkhyaâ€™s example does not lack the property to be proven,

original: gtan tshigs kyi don mi 'grub pa yang ma yin pas bzang po ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don mi 'grub pa yang ma yin pas bzang po ma yin pa'o //
translated: and the meaning of the reason is not unestablished.

original: gtan tshigs spyir brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtan tshigs spyir brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because the reason is stated generally.

original: 'di ltar chos spyir bzung nas rjes su dpog par byed kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos spyir bzung nas rjes su dpog par byed kyi /
translated: In this way, one infers by apprehending a property in general.

original: de'i bye brag bzung nas rjes su dpog par mi byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i bye brag bzung nas rjes su dpog par mi byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: One does not infer by apprehending its instances.

original: dper na sgra dang bum pa'i mi rtag pa spyir brjod pa dang 'dra bar gtso bo dang skyes bu'i mi gsal ba spyir brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na sgra dang bum pa'i mi rtag pa spyir brjod pa dang 'dra bar gtso bo dang skyes bu'i mi gsal ba spyir brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, just as impermanence is stated generally in relation to sound and a pot, because unclarity is stated generally in relation to the primary nature and a person,

original: dpe sgrub pa'i chos dang mi ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dpe sgrub pa'i chos dang mi ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: the example does not lack the property to be proven.

original: bye brag tu brjod na yang nye bar sbyar bas spyir gcig tu byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bye brag tu brjod na yang nye bar sbyar bas spyir gcig tu byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even if it is stated in terms of a particular, because it is applied, it is made one in general.

original: gtso bo dang skyes bu mi gsal ba nyid so sor bye brag tu brjod du zin na yang don nye bar sbyar bas spyi gcig tu byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gtso bo dang skyes bu mi gsal ba nyid so sor bye brag tu brjod du zin na yang don nye bar sbyar bas spyi gcig tu byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Although the principal and the person are not clearly stated, they are made into a single universal by the application of the meaning.

original: dper na phyogs kyi chos spyod pa'i dus na /
analyzed: dper na phyogs kyi chos spyod pa'i dus na /
translated: For example, when the property of the subject is stated,

original: sgra ni lkog ma dang / rkan dang mchu la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyis byed pas /
analyzed: sgra ni lkog ma dang / rkan dang mchu la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyis byed pas /

original: de ltar sgra la byas pa nyid phyogs kyi chos bye brag tu brjod cing /
analyzed: de ltar sgra la byas pa nyid phyogs kyi chos bye brag tu brjod cing /
translated: Thus, the property of the subject, being produced, is stated with respect to sound.

original: bum pa ni 'jim pa dang dbyug gu dang 'khor lo la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyis byed pas /
analyzed: bum pa ni 'jim pa dang dbyug gu dang 'khor lo la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyis byed pas /
translated: A pot is produced by conditions such as clay, a stick, a wheel, and so on.ğŸ”½Thus, the property of the subject, being produced, is stated with respect to a pot. However, by the application of the meaning, the impermanence of sound and the impermanence of a pot are made into a single universal without distinction.

original: de ltar bum pa la byas pa nyid phyogs kyi chos bye brag tu brjod na yang don nye bar sbyar bas sgra dang bum pa'i mi rtag pa nyid spyir gsar du bye brag med par byed nus pa bzhin pas gtan tshigs kyi don mi 'grub pa yang ma
analyzed: de ltar bum pa la byas pa nyid phyogs kyi chos bye brag tu brjod na yang don nye bar sbyar bas sgra dang bum pa'i mi rtag pa nyid spyir gsar du bye brag med par byed nus pa bzhin pas gtan tshigs kyi don mi 'grub pa yang ma
translated: In the same way, the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: yin no // de ltar kho bo gtan tshigs mi gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de spyir brjod pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: yin no // de ltar kho bo gtan tshigs mi gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de spyir brjod pa de'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since the reason is unclear, you have stated a general point.

original: khyod kyi ltag chod de ni ma grub pa ltar snang ba yin no zhes mjug bsdu @145a * //
analyzed: khyod kyi ltag chod de ni ma grub pa ltar snang ba yin no zhes mjug bsdu @145a * //
translated: Therefore, this reductio of yours is not established and appears to be a mere sophistry.ğŸ”½This is the summary.

original: bar bya'o // de la ltag chod de ni zhes bya ba ni log thabs su smra ba de ste /ğŸ”½sngar rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa de dag na re /
analyzed: bar bya'o // de la ltag chod de ni zhes bya ba ni log thabs su smra ba de ste / sngar rang bzhin rgyur 'dod pa de dag na re /
translated: In this context, â€œthis reductioâ€ refers to the sophistry.ğŸ”½Those who previously asserted that essence is a cause say that the meaning of the reason â€œbecause it is unclearâ€ is as follows.

original: mi gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don gal te gsal ba'i sngon rol gyi gnas skabs la bya na ni /
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don gal te gsal ba'i sngon rol gyi gnas skabs la bya na ni /
translated: If it refers to the state prior to manifestation,

original: dpe sgrub pa'i chos dang mi ldan pa'i skyon du 'gyur la /
analyzed: dpe sgrub pa'i chos dang mi ldan pa'i skyon du 'gyur la /
translated: then the example is flawed in that it does not satisfy the requirement of being similar to the subject.

original: gal te shes pa yod pa nyid la bya na ni gtan tshigs kyi don mi 'grub bo zhes zer ba de'o //
analyzed: gal te shes pa yod pa nyid la bya na ni gtan tshigs kyi don mi 'grub bo zhes zer ba de'o //
translated: If it refers to the mere existence of consciousness, then the meaning of the reason is not established.ğŸ”½This is what they say.

original: ma grub pa ltar snang ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyod la kho bo'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyis gsal ba dang / de kho na med pas ma grub pa ltar snang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: ma grub pa ltar snang ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyod la kho bo'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyis gsal ba dang / de kho na med pas ma grub pa ltar snang ba yin gyi /
translated: â€œThe meaning of our reason is not establishedâ€ is a clear indication that you have not established the reason.

original: ma grub pa nyid ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: ma grub pa nyid ma yin pa ste /
translated: And â€œit appears as if it is not established because reality does not existâ€ is not a nonestablished reason.

original: kho bos gtan tshigs mi gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de spyir brjod pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: kho bos gtan tshigs mi gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de spyir brjod pa'i phyir ram /
translated: â€œOur reason is not clearâ€ is a general statement.

original: bye brag tu brjod na yang nye bar sbyar bas spyir gcig tu byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bye brag tu brjod na yang nye bar sbyar bas spyir gcig tu byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Or if it is a specific statement, it is a general statement because it is applied to one.

original: kho bos gtan tshigs kyi don ni gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bos gtan tshigs kyi don ni gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œThe meaning of our reason is clearâ€ is established.

original: rang bzhin dang dus dang sred med kyi du rgyur 'dod pa dag spyir dgag pa yang dbang phyug bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang dus dang sred med kyi du rgyur 'dod pa dag spyir dgag pa yang dbang phyug bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: The general refutation of the assertions that the cause of the world is nature, time, or IÅ›vara should be understood in the same way as the refutation of the creator.ğŸ”½This is explained in the following.

original: 'di ltar rgyu'i tshig gi don dgag par bya ba ji snyed pa de dag thams cad la dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dgag pa 'thad pa nyid sbyar du rung bas /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu'i tshig gi don dgag par bya ba ji snyed pa de dag thams cad la dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dgag pa 'thad pa nyid sbyar du rung bas /
translated: Thus, it is correct to apply the refutation of the assertion that ÄªÅ›vara is the cause of all things that are objects of negation, to the assertion that he is the cause of all things.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin dang dus dang sred med kyi bu rgyur 'dod pa dag spyir dgag pa yang dbang phyug bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin dang dus dang sred med kyi bu rgyur 'dod pa dag spyir dgag pa yang dbang phyug bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di smras so //
translated: Therefore, the refutation of the assertion that ÄªÅ›vara is the cause of things should be applied to the assertion that God is the cause of things.

original: de yang 'di ltar sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: This is how it should be applied.

original: sngar dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dgag pa'i skabs su de ni dam bcas pa tsam ste /ğŸ”½dbang phyug ni kun rdzob tu yang 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyur yin par mi rung ste /
analyzed: sngar dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa dgag pa'i skabs su de ni dam bcas pa tsam ste / dbang phyug ni kun rdzob tu yang 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyur yin par mi rung ste /
translated: In the context of the refutation of the assertion that ÄªÅ›vara is the cause of things, it was said that this is merely a thesis.

original: la la'i dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: la la'i dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not tenable that ÄªÅ›vara is the cause of the origination of the entire world even conventionally because he is the cause of the pleasure and pain of some.

original: dper na ba lang rdzi bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba lang rdzi bzhin no //
translated: For example, he is like a cowherd.

original: yang na 'gro ba ni rgyu byed pa po dbang phyug ces bya ba gcig dang ldan pa ma yin par nges te gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na 'gro ba ni rgyu byed pa po dbang phyug ces bya ba gcig dang ldan pa ma yin par nges te gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or else, going is definitely not possessed by a single creator, called ÄªÅ›vara, because it is an object of comprehension.

original: dper na dbang phyug bzhin pas kun rdzob tu yang dngos po rnams de las skye ba med do //
analyzed: dper na dbang phyug bzhin pas kun rdzob tu yang dngos po rnams de las skye ba med do //
translated: For example, like ÄªÅ›vara, things do not arise from him even conventionally.

original: dbang phyug rgyu yin na yang 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: dbang phyug rgyu yin na yang 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid dam /
translated: If ÄªÅ›vara were a cause, he would be the self-nature of the effect,

original: gzhan du gyur pa'am /ğŸ”½gnyi gar gyur pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa'am / gnyi gar gyur pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: or he would be transformed,ğŸ”½or he would be both.

original: de la 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid yin na ni /
translated: If he were the self-nature of the effect,

original: rgyu dbang phyug de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pas dbang phyug las dbang phyug @145b skye ba'am /
analyzed: rgyu dbang phyug de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pas dbang phyug las dbang phyug @145b skye ba'am /
translated: since ÄªÅ›vara, the cause, would be the self-nature of the effect, the three worlds, either ÄªÅ›vara would arise from ÄªÅ›vara,

original: 'jig rten gsum las 'jig rten gsum skye bar 'gyur bas de'i dgag pa ni don dam par dbang phyug bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las 'jig rten gsum skye bar 'gyur bas de'i dgag pa ni don dam par dbang phyug bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
translated: or the three worlds would arise from the three worlds. Therefore, the refutation of that is: ultimately, ÄªÅ›vara definitely does not arise from himself because he exists.

original: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the existence of consciousness itself.

original: don dam par 'jig rten gsum bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par 'jig rten gsum bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Ultimately, the three worlds are definitely not produced from God because they exist.

original: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, just like consciousness itself.

original: gzhan du gyur pa yin na yang rgyu dbang phyug de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum las gzhan du 'gyur ba yin pas /
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa yin na yang rgyu dbang phyug de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum las gzhan du 'gyur ba yin pas /
translated: If they were different, then God, the cause, would be different from the three worlds, the effect.

original: dbang phyug las 'jig rten gsum skye ba'am /
analyzed: dbang phyug las 'jig rten gsum skye ba'am /
translated: Either the three worlds would be produced from God,

original: dbang phyug 'jig rten gsum gyi rkyen yin par 'gyur bas de'i dgag pa ni don dam par 'jig rten gsum de dag gi rkyen dbang phyug gzhan las skye ba med de /
analyzed: dbang phyug 'jig rten gsum gyi rkyen yin par 'gyur bas de'i dgag pa ni don dam par 'jig rten gsum de dag gi rkyen dbang phyug gzhan las skye ba med de /
translated: or God would be the condition of the three worlds. Therefore, the refutation of that is this: Ultimately, the three worlds are not produced from another, God, as their condition.

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: Because they are different, like a vase.

original: don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa 'jig rten gsum 'grub par byed pa dbang phyug ma yin par nges te /
analyzed: don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa 'jig rten gsum 'grub par byed pa dbang phyug ma yin par nges te /
translated: Ultimately, it is certain that God is not the creator of the three worlds, which are asserted to be different from him.

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are different.

original: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the cause, such as the thread, and so on.

original: gnyi gar gyur pa yin na yang 'jig rten gsum gyi nus pa ni dbang phyug yin pas nus pa las skye ba ni bdag las skye ba yin pa /
analyzed: gnyi gar gyur pa yin na yang 'jig rten gsum gyi nus pa ni dbang phyug yin pas nus pa las skye ba ni bdag las skye ba yin pa /
translated: If it were both, since the potency of the three worlds is God, arising from potency would be arising from self.

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi gsal ba ni dbang phyug las gzhan yin pas gsal ba las skye ba ni gzhan las skye ba yin pas de'i dgag pa ni dbang phyug las 'jig rten gsum gyi nus pa skye ba med de yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi gsal ba ni dbang phyug las gzhan yin pas gsal ba las skye ba ni gzhan las skye ba yin pas de'i dgag pa ni dbang phyug las 'jig rten gsum gyi nus pa skye ba med de yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the manifestation of the three worlds is other than God, arising from manifestation would be arising from another. Therefore, the refutation of that is: The potency of the three worlds does not arise from God because it exists.

original: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is just like the existence of consciousness.

original: dbang phyug las 'jig rten gsum gyi gsal ba yang skye ba med de /
analyzed: dbang phyug las 'jig rten gsum gyi gsal ba yang skye ba med de /
translated: Also, the manifestation of the three worlds does not arise from God.

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is other, for example, like a pot.

original: don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa dbang phyug rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa dbang phyug rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Ultimately, God, who is asserted to be other, is ascertained not to be a condition because he is other.

original: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa bzhin du 'dir yang gtso bo ni kun rdzob tu yang 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin par mi rung ste /
analyzed: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bshad pa bzhin du 'dir yang gtso bo ni kun rdzob tu yang 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin par mi rung ste /
translated: In the same way, here also, the primal substance cannot be the cause of the origination of all beings even conventionally,

original: la la'i dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: la la'i dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is the cause of the pleasure and pain of some.

original: dper na ba lang rdzi bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba lang rdzi bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the cowherd.

original: yang na 'gro ba ni rgyu byed pa po gtso bo zhes bya nga gcig dang ldan pa ma yin par nges te /
analyzed: yang na 'gro ba ni rgyu byed pa po gtso bo zhes bya nga gcig dang ldan pa ma yin par nges te /
translated: Again, it is certain that beings are not endowed with a single primal substance, which is the cause and agent,

original: gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are objects of knowledge.

original: dper na gtso bo bzhin pas kun rdzob tu yang dngos po rnams de las skye ba med do //
analyzed: dper na gtso bo bzhin pas kun rdzob tu yang dngos po rnams de las skye ba med do //
translated: For example, like the primal substance. Therefore, even conventionally, things do not originate from that.

original: gtso bo rgyu yin na yang 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: gtso bo rgyu yin na yang 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid dam /
translated: If the primal substance were the cause, the effect would be either the self of the self or

original: gzhan du gyur pa'am /ğŸ”½gnyi gar gyur pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa'am / gnyi gar gyur pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: a transformation or

original: de la 'bras @146a * //
analyzed: de la 'bras @146a * //
translated: both.

original: bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid yin na ni /
translated: If it were the self of the self,

original: rgyu gtso bo de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pas gtso bo las gtso bo skye ba'am /
analyzed: rgyu gtso bo de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pas gtso bo las gtso bo skye ba'am /
translated: Since the primary cause is the nature of the three worlds, the effect, it follows that either the primary cause would arise from the primary cause or the three worlds would arise from the three worlds.

original: 'jig rten gsum las 'jig rten gsum skye bar 'gyur bas de'i dgag pa ni don dam par gtso bo bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las 'jig rten gsum skye bar 'gyur bas de'i dgag pa ni don dam par gtso bo bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in response to that, it is ascertained that ultimately arising from self is not tenable because it exists.

original: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is just like the existence of consciousness.

original: don dam par 'jig rten gsum bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par 'jig rten gsum bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
translated: It is ascertained that ultimately the three worlds do not arise from self because it exists.

original: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid yin no //ğŸ”½gzhan du gyur pa yin na yang gtso bo de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum las gzhan du 'gyur ba yin pas /ğŸ”½gtso bo las 'jig rten gsum skye ba'am /
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid yin no // gzhan du gyur pa yin na yang gtso bo de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum las gzhan du 'gyur ba yin pas / gtso bo las 'jig rten gsum skye ba'am /
translated: For example, it is just like the existence of consciousness.ğŸ”½If it were different, then the primary cause would be different from the effect, the three worlds.ğŸ”½Therefore, it follows that the three worlds would arise from the primary cause or the primary cause would be the condition of the world.

original: gtso bo 'jig rten gyi rkyen yin par 'gyur bas de'i dgag pa ni don dam par 'jig rten gsum de dag gi rkyen gtso bo gzhan las skye ba med de /
analyzed: gtso bo 'jig rten gyi rkyen yin par 'gyur bas de'i dgag pa ni don dam par 'jig rten gsum de dag gi rkyen gtso bo gzhan las skye ba med de /
translated: In response to that, it is ascertained that ultimately the three worlds do not arise from another, the primary cause, as their condition because it exists.

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is different, like a pot.

original: don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pas 'jig rten gsum 'grub par byed pa gtso bo ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pas 'jig rten gsum 'grub par byed pa gtso bo ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is asserted that the other is ultimate, it is ascertained that the principal is not the creator of the three worlds, because it is different, like the cause, such as the thread, and so on.

original: gnyi gar gyur pa yin na yang 'jig rten gsum gyi nus pa ni gtso bo yin pas nus pa las skye ba ni bdag las skye ba yin la /
analyzed: gnyi gar gyur pa yin na yang 'jig rten gsum gyi nus pa ni gtso bo yin pas nus pa las skye ba ni bdag las skye ba yin la /
translated: Even if it were both, the potency of the three worlds would be the principal, and that which arises from potency would arise from itself.

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi gsal ba ni gtso bo las gzhan yin pas gsal ba las skye ba ni gzhan las skye ba yin pas de'i dgag pa ni gtso bo las 'jig rten gsum gyi nus pa skye ba med de yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi gsal ba ni gtso bo las gzhan yin pas gsal ba las skye ba ni gzhan las skye ba yin pas de'i dgag pa ni gtso bo las 'jig rten gsum gyi nus pa skye ba med de yod pa'i phyir /
translated: And because the manifestation of the three worlds is different from the principal, that which arises from manifestation would arise from another. Therefore, the refutation of that is as follows: The potency of the three worlds does not arise from the principal, because it exists.

original: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is just like the existence of consciousness.

original: gtso bo las 'jig rten gsum gyi gsal ba yang skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gtso bo las 'jig rten gsum gyi gsal ba yang skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: The manifestation of the three worlds does not arise from the principal, because it is different, like a pot.

original: don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa gtso bo rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa gtso bo rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is certain that the primal substance is not the condition of the other, that is, of the effect, because it is other.

original: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the threads, etc., which are the cause of the cloth.

original: gzhan yang gtso bo skyes pa'am ma skyes pa zhig gis skyed par byed grang na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gtso bo skyes pa'am ma skyes pa zhig gis skyed par byed grang na /
translated: Moreover, is the primal substance that which generates the other, having arisen or not having arisen?

original: gal te skyes pa yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te skyes pa yod na ni /
translated: If it has arisen,

original: de ltar na gtso bo mi rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na gtso bo mi rtag pa yin te /
translated: then the primal substance is impermanent,

original: skye ba can yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: skye ba can yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: because it has arising, like a pot.

original: rjes su dpag pa la phyir gnod par gyur pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la phyir gnod par gyur pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: And because it is contradicted by inference.

original: 'on te gtso bo ma skyes pa yin na ni de ltar na gtso bo med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te gtso bo ma skyes pa yin na ni de ltar na gtso bo med pa yin te /
translated: But if the primal substance has not arisen, then the primal substance does not exist,

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: like the sky flower.

original: de bzhin du dus rgyur 'dod pa dag kyang 'gro ba skye ba'i @146b rgyu ni dus yin par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du dus rgyur 'dod pa dag kyang 'gro ba skye ba'i @146b rgyu ni dus yin par rtog par byed do //
translated: In the same way, those who assert time as the cause imagine that time is the cause of the arising of the world.

original: de dag na re /
analyzed: de dag na re /
translated: They say:

original: dus kyis 'byung ba rnams 'byin cing //
analyzed: dus kyis 'byung ba rnams 'byin cing //

original: dus kyis skye dgu rnams sdud byed //
analyzed: dus kyis skye dgu rnams sdud byed //
translated: Time brings about the end of all things.ğŸ”½Time makes the sleeping wake,

original: dus kyis gnyid log sad byed pas //
analyzed: dus kyis gnyid log sad byed pas //
translated: and time makes the waking sleep.

original: dus ni 'da' bar dka' ba yin //
analyzed: dus ni 'da' bar dka' ba yin //
translated: Time is hard to transgress.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

analyzed: srung gsum brtsegs 'obs ni rgya mtsho dang // dmag mi srin po nor ni nor sbyin sbyor //
translated: the three protections, the ramparts and moats, the ocean, the army, the rÄká¹£asas, and the wealth are compared to Kubera.

original: gang gis bstan bcos pa sangs tshad mnyam pa //
analyzed: gang gis bstan bcos pa sangs tshad mnyam pa //
translated: The one who was equal to the sage PaÅ›umÄn

original: sgra sgrogs bu de'ang dus kyi dbang gis nyams //ğŸ”½de bzhin nor lha gang gi zhang yin zhing //
analyzed: sgra sgrogs bu de'ang dus kyi dbang gis nyams // de bzhin nor lha gang gi zhang yin zhing //
translated: was also destroyed by the power of time.ğŸ”½The one who was the maternal uncle of Kubera

original: nor rgyal gang gi pha yin pa //
analyzed: nor rgyal gang gi pha yin pa //
translated: and the father of the king of wealth

original: 'jigs med khro bo'ang bsad gyur pas //
analyzed: 'jigs med khro bo'ang bsad gyur pas //
translated: was also killed by the wrathful one,

original: dus ni 'da' bar dka' ba yin //
analyzed: dus ni 'da' bar dka' ba yin //
translated: and time is hard to transgress.

original: de bzhin du mig la sogs pa dang / shing ljon pa la sogs pa'i rgyu khu chu dang khrag dang la bon dang sa la sogs pa de dag yod kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig la sogs pa dang / shing ljon pa la sogs pa'i rgyu khu chu dang khrag dang la bon dang sa la sogs pa de dag yod kyang /
translated: In the same way, although the causes of the eye, etc., and of trees, etc., such as semen, blood, clay, and so on, exist,

original: 'di la dus med par dngos po rnams mi skye'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di la dus med par dngos po rnams mi skye'o zhes zer ro //
translated: things do not arise without time.

original: de bas na de dgag pa'i phyir dus rgyur 'dod pa dag spyir dgag pa yang dbang phyug bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de bas na de dgag pa'i phyir dus rgyur 'dod pa dag spyir dgag pa yang dbang phyug bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, in order to refute that, the general refutation of those who assert time as a cause should be viewed like the refutation of IÅ›vara.

original: 'dir yang dus ni kun rdzob tu yang 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin par mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang dus ni kun rdzob tu yang 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin par mi rung ste /
translated: Here, time is not suitable as the cause of the production of the entire world even conventionally,

original: la la'i dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na ba lang rdzi bzhin no //
analyzed: la la'i dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na ba lang rdzi bzhin no //
translated: because it is the cause of the pleasure and pain of some, like a cowherd.

original: yang na 'gro ba ni rgyu byed pa po dus zhes bya ba gcig dang ldan pa ma yin par nges te gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na 'gro ba ni rgyu byed pa po dus zhes bya ba gcig dang ldan pa ma yin par nges te gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, it is certain that the world is not endowed with a single cause, called time, because it is an object of comprehension,

original: dper na bum pa bzhin pas kun rdzob tu yang dngos po rnams de las skye ba med do //
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin pas kun rdzob tu yang dngos po rnams de las skye ba med do //
translated: like a pot. Therefore, even conventionally, things do not arise from that.

original: dus rgyu yin na yang 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid dam /ğŸ”½gzhan du gyur pa'am /
analyzed: dus rgyu yin na yang 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid dam / gzhan du gyur pa'am /
translated: If time is a cause, it would be the nature of the effect,ğŸ”½or it would be transformed into something else,

original: gnyi gar gyur pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gnyi gar gyur pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: or it would be both.

original: de la 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid yin na ni /
translated: If it is the nature of the effect,

original: rgyu dus de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pas dus las dus skye ba'am /
analyzed: rgyu dus de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pas dus las dus skye ba'am /
translated: Since the cause at the time of the cause is the nature of the three worlds, it is the arising of time from time.ğŸ”½

original: 'jig rten gsum las 'jig rten gsum skye bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las 'jig rten gsum skye bar 'gyur bas /
translated: Since the cause, time, is the nature of the three worlds, the effect, time would arise from time, or the three worlds would arise from the three worlds.

original: de'i dgag pa ni don dam par dus bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i dgag pa ni don dam par dus bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
translated: The refutation of that is: ultimately, time is ascertained not to arise from itself because it exists.

original: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is just like the existence of consciousness.

original: don dam par 'jig rten gsum dus las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par 'jig rten gsum dus las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Ultimately, the three worlds are ascertained not to arise from time because they exist.

original: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //ğŸ”½gzhan du gyur pa yin na yang rgyu dus de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum las gzhan du gyur pa yin pas dus las 'jig rten gsum skye ba'am /
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no // gzhan du gyur pa yin na yang rgyu dus de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum las gzhan du gyur pa yin pas dus las 'jig rten gsum skye ba'am /
translated: For example, it is just like the existence of consciousness.

original: dus 'jig rten gsum gyi rkyen yin par 'gyur bas @147a * //
analyzed: dus 'jig rten gsum gyi rkyen yin par 'gyur bas @147a * //
translated: If they were different, since the cause, time, would be different from the effect, the three worlds, the three worlds would arise from time, or time would be the condition of the three worlds.

original: de'i dgag pa ni don dam par 'jig rten gsum de dag gi rkyen dus gzhan las skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i dgag pa ni don dam par 'jig rten gsum de dag gi rkyen dus gzhan las skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: The refutation of that is: ultimately, the three worlds are not arisen from a different condition, time, because they are different, like a pot.

original: don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa 'jig rten gsum 'grub par byed pa dus ma yin par nges te /ğŸ”½gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa 'jig rten gsum 'grub par byed pa dus ma yin par nges te / gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is definitely not the case that the three worlds are produced from time, because time is other.

original: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the case of the cause, the thread and so on.

original: gnyi gar gyur pa yin na yang 'jig rten gsum gyi nus pa ni dus yin pas nus pa las skye ba ni /
analyzed: gnyi gar gyur pa yin na yang 'jig rten gsum gyi nus pa ni dus yin pas nus pa las skye ba ni /
translated: If the three worlds are both, then the potency of the three worlds is time, and that which is produced from potency

original: bdag las skye ba yin la /
analyzed: bdag las skye ba yin la /
translated: is produced from itself.

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi gsal ba ni dus las gzhan yin pas gsal ba las skye ba ni gzhan las skye ba yin pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi gsal ba ni dus las gzhan yin pas gsal ba las skye ba ni gzhan las skye ba yin pas /
translated: The manifestation of the three worlds is other than time, and that which is produced from manifestation is produced from other.

original: da'i dgag pa ni dus las 'jig rten gsum gyi nus pa skye ba med de yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da'i dgag pa ni dus las 'jig rten gsum gyi nus pa skye ba med de yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the refutation of that is that the potency of the three worlds is not produced from time because it exists.

original: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the case of the existence of consciousness.

original: dus las 'jig rten gsum gyi gsal ba yang skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dus las 'jig rten gsum gyi gsal ba yang skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, the manifestation of the three worlds is not produced from time because it is other.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the case of a pot.

original: don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa dus rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa dus rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is definitely not the case that time is the condition of the three worlds, because time is other.

original: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the cause of a cloth.

original: gzhan yang dus skyes pa'am ma skyes pa zhig gis skyed par byed grang na /
analyzed: gzhan yang dus skyes pa'am ma skyes pa zhig gis skyed par byed grang na /
translated: Moreover, is time that which is arisen or that which is non-arisen that generates?

original: gal te skyes pa yin na ni de lta na dus mi rtag pa yin te skye ba can yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gal te skyes pa yin na ni de lta na dus mi rtag pa yin te skye ba can yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: If it is arisen, then in that case time is impermanent because it has arising, for example, like a pot.

original: rjes su dpag pa la phyir gnod par gyur pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la phyir gnod par gyur pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: And because it is contradicted by inference.

original: 'on te dus ma skyes pa yin na ni de lta na dus med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te dus ma skyes pa yin na ni de lta na dus med pa yin te /
translated: But if time is non-arisen, then in that case time does not exist,

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: for example, like a sky flower.

original: de bzhin du sred med kyi bu rgyur 'dod pa dag kyang 'gro ba skye ba'i rgyu ni sred med kyi bu yin par rtog par byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du sred med kyi bu rgyur 'dod pa dag kyang 'gro ba skye ba'i rgyu ni sred med kyi bu yin par rtog par byed de /
translated: Similarly, those who assert that Narayana is the cause imagine that Narayana is the cause of the arising of the world.

original: de dag na re /
analyzed: de dag na re /
translated: They say:

original: de nyid kyis ji skad du /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: nga ni sbyin byed za ba po //
analyzed: nga ni sbyin byed za ba po //
translated: I am the giver, I am the eater,ğŸ”½I am the lord of food and beings,

original: nga ni zas dang skye dgu'i bdag / nga ni bram ze'i lus gnas na //
analyzed: nga ni zas dang skye dgu'i bdag / nga ni bram ze'i lus gnas na //
translated: I am the one who abides in the body of the brahmin,

original: za bar byed cing sbyin par byed //
analyzed: za bar byed cing sbyin par byed //
translated: I am the one who eats and gives.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /

original: dad ldan brtson par byed pa dag / de dag nga la kun ti'i bu //ğŸ”½byas pa sngon du 'gro bas brten //
analyzed: dad ldan brtson par byed pa dag / de dag nga la kun ti'i bu // byas pa sngon du 'gro bas brten //

analyzed: zhes smras pa lta bu dang / gang gi phyir phyi rol gyi 'byung ba 'jig pa'i tshe drang srong mar kan de yang khyab 'jug gi ltor zhugs pas /

analyzed: 'gro ba gnas pa dang / rgyu ba 'di dag mthong ba de'i phyir sred med kyi bu de nyid 'gro ba skye ba'i rgyu yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin du ba ra ta'i gtam rgyud chen po'i lung las kyang /
translated: Likewise, the great story of the Bharata says:

analyzed: @147b khyab 'jug gzugs sna tshogs ston pa dag gi tshe na /
translated: When Vishnu displays various forms,

original: srid sgrub la sogs pas 'jig rten ma lus pa 'di khyab 'jug gi lus kyi khongs su gtogs par mthong ngo zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir sred med kyi bu de nyid 'gro ba skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: srid sgrub la sogs pas 'jig rten ma lus pa 'di khyab 'jug gi lus kyi khongs su gtogs par mthong ngo zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir sred med kyi bu de nyid 'gro ba skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is said that Narayana is the cause of the world's creation, because it is said that Narayana, the son of Aditi, is the cause of the world's creation, and because it is said that Bhima, the son of Pritha, saw that all the worlds were included in the body of Vishnu, and so on.

original: de bas na de dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de dgag pa'i phyir /

analyzed: sred med kyi bu rgyur 'dod pa dag spyir dgag pa yang dbang phyug bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said that the refutation of the assertion that Narayana is the cause should be understood in general in the same way as the refutation of Ishvara.

original: 'dir yang sred med kyi bu ni kun rdzob tu yang 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin par mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang sred med kyi bu ni kun rdzob tu yang 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu yin par mi rung ste /
translated: Here also, Narayana is not suitable as the cause of the creation of the entire world even conventionally,

original: la la'i dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: la la'i dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba'i phyir /
translated: because of the pleasure and pain of some.

original: dper na ba lang rdzi bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba lang rdzi bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a cowherd.

original: yang na 'gro ba ni rgyu byed pa po sred med kyi bu zhes bya ba gcig dang ldan pa ma yin par nges te gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na 'gro ba ni rgyu byed pa po sred med kyi bu zhes bya ba gcig dang ldan pa ma yin par nges te gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, it is certain that the world is not possessed by a single creator Narayana, because it is an object of knowledge.

original: dper na sred med kyi bu bzhin pas /
analyzed: dper na sred med kyi bu bzhin pas /
translated: For example, like Narayana.

original: kun rdzob tu yang dngos po rnams de las skye ba med do //ğŸ”½sred med kyi bu rgyu yin na yang 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid dang gzhan du gyur pa'am /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang dngos po rnams de las skye ba med do // sred med kyi bu rgyu yin na yang 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid dang gzhan du gyur pa'am /

original: gnyi gar gyur pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gnyi gar gyur pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: If the cause were Narayana, the effect would be either the self-nature of Narayana or the transformation of Narayana or both.

original: de la 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid yin na ni /ğŸ”½rgyu sred med kyi bu de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag nyid yin par sred med kyi bu las sred med kyi bu skye ba'am /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu'i bdag gi bdag nyid yin na ni / rgyu sred med kyi bu de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag nyid yin par sred med kyi bu las sred med kyi bu skye ba'am /
translated: If the effect were the self-nature of Narayana,ğŸ”½then the cause, Narayana, would be born from Narayana, or the three worlds would be born from the three worlds.

original: 'jig rten gsum las 'jig rten gsum skye bar 'gyur bas de'i dgag pa ni don dam par sred med kyi bu bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las 'jig rten gsum skye bar 'gyur bas de'i dgag pa ni don dam par sred med kyi bu bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the refutation of that is: ultimately, Narayana is definitely not born from itself because it exists.

original: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is just like the existence of consciousness.

original: don dam par 'jig rten gsum bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par 'jig rten gsum bdag las skye ba med par nges te yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Ultimately, the three worlds are definitely not born from themselves because they exist.

original: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is just like the existence of consciousness.

original: gzhan du gyur pa yin na yang rgyu sred med kyi bu de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum las /ğŸ”½gzhan du gyur pa yin pas /ğŸ”½sred med kyi bu las 'jig rten gsum skye ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa yin na yang rgyu sred med kyi bu de 'bras bu 'jig rten gsum las / gzhan du gyur pa yin pas / sred med kyi bu las 'jig rten gsum skye ba'am /
translated: If it were a transformation, then the cause, NÄrÄyaá¹‡a, would be a transformation of the effect, the three worlds.ğŸ”½Therefore, the three worlds would arise from NÄrÄyaá¹‡a, or NÄrÄyaá¹‡a would be the condition of the three worlds.

original: sred med kyi bu 'jig rten gsum gyi rkyen yin par 'gyur bas de'i dgag pa ni don dam par 'jig rten gsum de dag gi rkyen sred med kyi bu gzhan las skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sred med kyi bu 'jig rten gsum gyi rkyen yin par 'gyur bas de'i dgag pa ni don dam par 'jig rten gsum de dag gi rkyen sred med kyi bu gzhan las skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The refutation of that is, ultimately, the three worlds do not arise from a different NÄrÄyaá¹‡a because they are different.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, this is like a vase.

original: don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa 'jig rten gsum 'grub par byed pa sred med kyi bu ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa 'jig rten gsum 'grub par byed pa sred med kyi bu ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Ultimately, it is certain that the three worlds are not produced by NÄrÄyaá¹‡a, who is asserted to be different because they are different.

original: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //ğŸ”½gnyi gar gyur pa yin na yang 'jig rten gsum gyi nus pa ni sred @148a * //
analyzed: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no // gnyi gar gyur pa yin na yang 'jig rten gsum gyi nus pa ni sred @148a * //
translated: For example, this is like the cause, such as thread, and so on.

original: med kyi bu yin pas nus pa las skye ba ni bdag las skye ba yin la /
analyzed: med kyi bu yin pas nus pa las skye ba ni bdag las skye ba yin la /
translated: If it were both, then the potency of the three worlds is NÄrÄyaá¹‡a. Therefore arising from potency is arising from itself.

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi gsal ba ni sred med kyi bu las gzhan yin pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi gsal ba ni sred med kyi bu las gzhan yin pas /
translated: The illumination of the three worlds is other than Narayana.

original: gsal ba las skye ba ni gzhan las skye ba yin pas de'i dgag pa ni /
analyzed: gsal ba las skye ba ni gzhan las skye ba yin pas de'i dgag pa ni /
translated: Since arising from illumination is arising from another, the refutation of that is:

original: sred med kyi bu las 'jig rten gsum gyi nus pa skye ba med de yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sred med kyi bu las 'jig rten gsum gyi nus pa skye ba med de yod pa'i phyir /

original: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dper na shes pa yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: For example, consciousness exists.

original: sred med kyi bu las 'jig rten gsum gyi gsal ba yang skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sred med kyi bu las 'jig rten gsum gyi gsal ba yang skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, the illumination of the three worlds does not arise from Narayana because it is other.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a pot.

original: don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa sred med kyi bu rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa sred med kyi bu rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Ultimately, Narayana, who is asserted to be other, is not a condition because he is other.

original: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like thread and so on, which are causes.

original: gzhan yang sred med kyi bu skyes pa'am ma skyes pa zhig gis skyed par byed grang na /
analyzed: gzhan yang sred med kyi bu skyes pa'am ma skyes pa zhig gis skyed par byed grang na /
translated: Moreover, is Narayana a cause that has arisen or a cause that has not arisen?

original: gal te skyes pa yin na ni de ltar na sred med kyi bu mi rtag pa yin te skye ba can yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gal te skyes pa yin na ni de ltar na sred med kyi bu mi rtag pa yin te skye ba can yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: If he is born, then Narayana is impermanent because he is born, like a pot.

original: rjes su dpag pa la phyir gnod par 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la phyir gnod par 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro //
translated: And because it is contradicted by inference.

original: 'on te sred med kyi bu ma skyes pa yin na ni de ltar na sred med kyi bu med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te sred med kyi bu ma skyes pa yin na ni de ltar na sred med kyi bu med pa yin te /

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: like a sky flower.

original: gzhan yang 'gro ba yod pa'am med pa zhig sred med kyi bu las skye bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'gro ba yod pa'am med pa zhig sred med kyi bu las skye bar 'gyur grang na /

original: de yang / med na gang gi rkyen zhes bya //
analyzed: de yang / med na gang gi rkyen zhes bya //

analyzed: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
