original: zhes 'og nas 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'og nas 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

original: gzhan yang 'gro ba bskyed pa'i rgyu ni bdag nyid chen po zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'gro ba bskyed pa'i rgyu ni bdag nyid chen po zhig yin grang na /

analyzed: de'i phyir de gal te bdag nyid chen po yin na ji ltar na /
translated: then in that case, if he is a great being, how could he

original: des snying rje med par /
analyzed: des snying rje med par /

original: na ra ka dang / skra ldan dang / stobs mchog la sogs pa srog dang nor bdag dang bral bar byas /
analyzed: na ra ka dang / skra ldan dang / stobs mchog la sogs pa srog dang nor bdag dang bral bar byas /
translated: He has deprived Naraka, Åšravaá¹‡a, Bala, and others of their lives and their wealth.

original: 'on te des skye dgu bsrung ba'i don dang / chos bsrung ba'i don du lha dang bram ze'i tsher mar gyur pa sdig pa can chos 'jig par byed pa'i lha ma yin dag la rjes su ston pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te des skye dgu bsrung ba'i don dang / chos bsrung ba'i don du lha dang bram ze'i tsher mar gyur pa sdig pa can chos 'jig par byed pa'i lha ma yin dag la rjes su ston pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But perhaps he is a teacher to the asuras who are enemies of the Dharma, who are wicked, and who are thorns in the side of the gods and brahmins, in order to protect living beings and to protect the Dharma.

original: de tshar na yang des bdag rang dang lha ma yin rnams kyi sgyu dang / g-yo ba dang / khro ba dang / 'dod pa dang / gti mug la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa chos ma yin pa skyed par byed pa rnam pa sna tshogs dag gzhig par bya ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: de tshar na yang des bdag rang dang lha ma yin rnams kyi sgyu dang / g-yo ba dang / khro ba dang / 'dod pa dang / gti mug la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa chos ma yin pa skyed par byed pa rnam pa sna tshogs dag gzhig par bya ba'i rigs so //
translated: But when he is destroyed, it is right that he should be destroyed, since he generates various non-Dharmas such as deceit, dishonesty, anger, desire, and delusion, which are the enemies of himself and the asuras.

original: gzhan yang de 'jig rten gsum skyong par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang de 'jig rten gsum skyong par byed pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if he is the protector of the three worlds,

original: ci sred pas byed dam /
analyzed: ci sred pas byed dam /
translated: is he motivated by desire

original: 'on te snying rjes byed /
analyzed: 'on te snying rjes byed /
translated: or by compassion?

original: gal te sred pas byed na ni /
analyzed: gal te sred pas byed na ni /
translated: If he is motivated by desire,

original: de sred pas @148b 'khol ba yin pa'i phyir mi bal pa dang 'dra bas ji ltar 'byin pa por rung /
analyzed: de sred pas @148b 'khol ba yin pa'i phyir mi bal pa dang 'dra bas ji ltar 'byin pa por rung /
translated: How could he be a creator, since he is like a piece of cotton wool, being tossed about by craving?

original: 'on te snying rjes byed na ni /
analyzed: 'on te snying rjes byed na ni /
translated: But if he acts out of compassion,

original: ci'i phyir lha ma yin skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal ma bcom pa dag la snying rje mi skye /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lha ma yin skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal ma bcom pa dag la snying rje mi skye /
translated: why does he not generate compassion for the asuras who are not liberated from the suffering of birth, aging, sickness, and death?

original: gzhan yang bdag nyid chen po ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag nyid chen po ni /
translated: Moreover, a great being

original: dgra bo dang mdza' bshes dag la byams sdang gi 'du shes dang bral ba yin na de'i phyir de lha ma yin dag la dgrar 'du shes pa yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dgra bo dang mdza' bshes dag la byams sdang gi 'du shes dang bral ba yin na de'i phyir de lha ma yin dag la dgrar 'du shes pa yang mi rung ngo //
translated: is free from the conception of love and hatred toward enemies and friends. Therefore, it is not reasonable that he would conceive of the asuras as enemies.

original: de gzhan gyi nor dang gzhan gyi chung ma 'phrog pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa dag kyang dmigs pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de gzhan gyi nor dang gzhan gyi chung ma 'phrog pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa dag kyang dmigs pas de'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, since it is observed that they engage in such actions as stealing the wealth and wives of others,

original: de'i g-yos 'gro ba 'di rmongs par gyur te 'khor bar bying zhing 'dug pa des na /
analyzed: de'i g-yos 'gro ba 'di rmongs par gyur te 'khor bar bying zhing 'dug pa des na /
translated: this world is confused by his power and sinks and remains in cyclic existence.

original: de skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa'i spyod pa dang ldan par brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: de skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa'i spyod pa dang ldan par brjod par bya'i /
translated: Therefore, he should be described as having the conduct of an ignoble person.

original: de skyes bu dam pa zhes ni brjod par mi bya'o //ğŸ”½'on te phyogs 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i dug gis sun phyung ba'i yid dang ldan pa dag gis rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i skyon bcab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de skyes bu dam pa zhes ni brjod par mi bya'o // 'on te phyogs 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i dug gis sun phyung ba'i yid dang ldan pa dag gis rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i skyon bcab pa'i phyir /
translated: But that is not called â€œa holy being.â€

original: khyab 'jug gi lus de ni rtag pa dang zhi ba dang zhi bar gyur pa gzhan kho na zhig yin par rtog cing lus de yang yod par gyur pa yang ma yin /ğŸ”½med par gyur pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: khyab 'jug gi lus de ni rtag pa dang zhi ba dang zhi bar gyur pa gzhan kho na zhig yin par rtog cing lus de yang yod par gyur pa yang ma yin / med par gyur pa yang ma yin /
translated: Or, if those with minds corrupted by the poison of attachment to partisanship imagine that the body of Viá¹£á¹‡u is permanent, peaceful, and is a different state, and that body is not something that comes to exist,ğŸ”½is not something that comes to not exist,

original: yod med du gyur pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: yod med du gyur pa yang ma yin la /
translated: is not something that comes to exist and not exist,

original: rnam pa thams cad kyis brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyis brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: and is not something to be expressed in any way,

original: rnal 'byor pas de mthong na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas de mthong na /
translated: and if yogins see it,

original: yang srid pa med par 'gro'o zhe na /
analyzed: yang srid pa med par 'gro'o zhe na /
translated: they go to a state without further rebirth.

original: de lta na yang de gal te nya dang rus sbal dang phag rgod la sogs pa'i lus dag las gzhan pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang de gal te nya dang rus sbal dang phag rgod la sogs pa'i lus dag las gzhan pa zhig yin na ni /
translated: If that is so, then if it is something other than the bodies of fish, turtles, boars, and so on,

original: de lta na rtag pa dang zhi ba dang zhi bar gyur pa ma yin te de las gzhan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na rtag pa dang zhi ba dang zhi bar gyur pa ma yin te de las gzhan pa'i phyir /
translated: In that case, it is not permanent, peaceful, and of the nature of peace, because it is other than that.

original: dper na skye bo phal pa dag gi lus bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na skye bo phal pa dag gi lus bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the bodies of ordinary people.

original: 'on te nya dang rus sbal dang phag rgod la sogs pa'i lus dag las gzhan ma yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te nya dang rus sbal dang phag rgod la sogs pa'i lus dag las gzhan ma yin na ni /
translated: But if it is not other than the bodies of fish, turtles, boars, and so on,

original: de lta na yang rtag pa dang zhi ba dang zhi bar gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang rtag pa dang zhi ba dang zhi bar gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: in that case, it is not permanent, peaceful, and of the nature of peace,

original: dper na nya dang rus sbal dang phag rgod la sogs pa'i lus de dag kho na bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nya dang rus sbal dang phag rgod la sogs pa'i lus de dag kho na bzhin no //
translated: because it is just like the bodies of fish, turtles, boars, and so on.

original: 'on te yang de la lus gsum yod de /
analyzed: 'on te yang de la lus gsum yod de /
translated: But if you say that it exists in three bodies,

original: zhi ba dang ma zhi ba dang gnyi ga'o zhes rjod par byed na /
analyzed: zhi ba dang ma zhi ba dang gnyi ga'o zhes rjod par byed na /
translated: peaceful, not peaceful, and both,

original: de lta na yang de bud med 'phyon ma bzhin du phyi rol gyi rnam pas ni zhi ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: de lta na yang de bud med 'phyon ma bzhin du phyi rol gyi rnam pas ni zhi ba nyid yin la /
translated: in that case, like a prostitute, it is peaceful in appearance,

original: don dam par ni ma zhi ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma zhi ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: but in reality, it is not peaceful.

original: gzhan yang de'i lus rtag par yongs su brtag pa gang yin pa de gal te dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang de'i lus rtag par yongs su brtag pa gang yin pa de gal te dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin na ni /
translated: Moreover, if that eternal self is the characteristic of an entity,

original: de'i phyir @149a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir @149a * //
translated: then

original: mi rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yin te /
translated: it is impermanent,

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is an entity, like a pot.

original: 'on te dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni de'i phyir med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni de'i phyir med pa kho na yin te /
translated: But if it is the characteristic of a non-entity, then it is non-existent,

original: dngos po med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: because it is a non-entity, like the sky flower.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin par yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin par yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is also not tenable that it is the characteristic of both an entity and a non-entity,

original: dgag pa mi mthun pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /

analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po yod pa dang med pa ni nang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //

original: brjod du med pa nyid ces bya ba yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: brjod du med pa nyid ces bya ba yang mi rung ste /

original: rtag pa dang zhi ba zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dbang po nye bar bsdus nas aom zhes bya ba brjod cing sred med kyi bu rjes su dran pa la brtson par byed na /

original: grol bas 'gyur zhes zer ba gang yin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: grol bas 'gyur zhes zer ba gang yin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /

original: dper na bu dang chung ma rjes su dran pa la brtson par byed pa dag grol bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na bu dang chung ma rjes su dran pa la brtson par byed pa dag grol bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /

analyzed: sred med kyi bu rjes su dran pa la brtson par byed pa yang grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: so too those who strive in the recollection of NÄrÄyaá¹‡a are not liberated.

original: gzhan yang tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / gtso bo dang / dus la sogs pa 'byin pa po yin par so so nas yongs su rtog par byed pa de la yang gang gi tshig bden zhing gang gi tshig mi bden par gzung bar bya /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / gtso bo dang / dus la sogs pa 'byin pa po yin par so so nas yongs su rtog par byed pa de la yang gang gi tshig bden zhing gang gi tshig mi bden par gzung bar bya /
translated: Moreover, BrahmÄ, Viá¹£á¹‡u, MaheÅ›vara, PrajÄpati, time, and so on are each imagined to be the creator. In that regard, whose words should be accepted as true and whose words should be rejected as false?

original: gzhan yang tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po rnams kyi lus zhi ba dam pa yin par yongs su brtag pa gang yin pa de yang ci ste skyes pa zhig yin nam /ğŸ”½'on te ma skyes pa zhig yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po rnams kyi lus zhi ba dam pa yin par yongs su brtag pa gang yin pa de yang ci ste skyes pa zhig yin nam / 'on te ma skyes pa zhig yin /
translated: Moreover, whatever is imagined to be the highest, peaceful body of Brahma, Vishnu, or MaheÅ›vara, is that body born or not?

original: gal te skyes pa zhig yin na ni mi rtag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te skyes pa zhig yin na ni mi rtag par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is born, it is impermanent,

analyzed: skye ba can yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //

original: 'on te ma skyes pa zhig yin na ni med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'on te ma skyes pa zhig yin na ni med pa kho na yin te /
translated: If it is not born, it is nonexistent,

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: because it is not born, like a sky flower, for example.

original: zhar la bshad pas chog go //
analyzed: zhar la bshad pas chog go //
translated: This is enough of this digression.

original: des na de ltar dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba med do zhes bya ba ni de ltar dngos po'i ngo bo dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo las kyang skye ba bkag pa des na de ltar /
analyzed: des na de ltar dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba med do zhes bya ba ni de ltar dngos po'i ngo bo dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo las kyang skye ba bkag pa des na de ltar /
translated: Therefore, since it has beenğŸ”½refuted that things arise from themselves and from others, things do not arise

original: dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba med do /ğŸ”½// / bam po bcu drug pa /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba med do / // / bam po bcu drug pa /
translated: without causes.

original: grangs can dag las kha cig na re /
analyzed: grangs can dag las kha cig na re /
translated: Some SÄá¹ƒkhyas say:

original: bdag @149b las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag @149b las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Things do not arise from self, nor from other,

analyzed: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min // dngos po gang dag gang na yang // skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: Nor from both, nor without cause.ğŸ”½There is never anywhereğŸ”½The arising of any existent thing.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa gang yin pa de ma skyes pa ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa gang yin pa de ma skyes pa ni bden mod kyi /
translated: This is true: nothing arises.

original: 'on kyang gsal bar byed do zhes zer ro zhes bya ba 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni grangs can dag las gsal bar smra ba dag dbu ma pa la tshig brgyud pas grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon gyis sgro 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: 'on kyang gsal bar byed do zhes zer ro zhes bya ba 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni grangs can dag las gsal bar smra ba dag dbu ma pa la tshig brgyud pas grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon gyis sgro 'dogs par byed de /
translated: The meaning of this passage is that the SÄá¹ƒkhya proponents of manifestation impute the error of proving what is established to the Followers of the Middle Way through a series of statements.

original: 'di la khyod kyis med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa de dag gis skye ba med kyi yod pa nyid gsal bar byed do zhes smras pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'di la khyod kyis med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa de dag gis skye ba med kyi yod pa nyid gsal bar byed do zhes smras pa yin pas /
translated: â€œ In this case, you say that what does not exist is not produced in those ways, but that what does exist is made manifest.â€ğŸ”½â€œ That is established in our scriptures as well, so you are proving what is already established.â€

original: de ni nged kyi gzhung las kyang grub pa yin pas khyod grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes tshig brgyud pas skyon 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni nged kyi gzhung las kyang grub pa yin pas khyod grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes tshig brgyud pas skyon 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: In this way they impute the error of a series of statements.ğŸ”½Some SÄá¹ƒkhyas sayâ€¦

original: de la grangs can dag las kha cig dag na re zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag la grub pa'i mtha' smra ba mang du yod pa las gsal bar smra ba dag na re /
analyzed: de la grangs can dag las kha cig dag na re zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag la grub pa'i mtha' smra ba mang du yod pa las gsal bar smra ba dag na re /
translated: This is how the SÄá¹ƒkhyas who are proponents of manifestation speak.

original: 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase â€œit is saidâ€ is supplied.

original: smras pa gang yin pa de zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas sngar smras pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa gang yin pa de zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pas sngar smras pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: â€œWhat was saidâ€ refers to what the Madhyamika said earlier.

original: ma skyes pa ni bden mod kyi zhes bya ba ni snga na med pa gang yin pa de ni bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis dang rgyu med pa'i rnam pa de dag gis skye ba med pa ni /

analyzed: kho bo cag gi grub pa'i mtha' las kyang smras pas bden no zhes tshig brgyud pas smra ba yin no //
translated: â€œIt is trueâ€ means that this is also our philosophical position, and the passage continues.

original: 'on kyang gsal bar byed do zhes bya ba ni snga na yong pa nyid rkyen gyis gsal bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang gsal bar byed do zhes bya ba ni snga na yong pa nyid rkyen gyis gsal bar byed pa ste /
translated: â€œBut it is made manifestâ€ means that the thing that existed previously is made manifest by conditions.

original: des na dbu ma pa khyod kyis med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa de dag gis skye ba med kyi /
analyzed: des na dbu ma pa khyod kyis med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa de dag gis skye ba med kyi /

analyzed: yod pa nyid gsal bar byed do zhes smras pa yin pas /
translated: but that what does exist is made manifest.

original: de ni nged kyi gzhung la yang grub pa yin pas khyed grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes tshig brgyud pas skyon 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni nged kyi gzhung la yang grub pa yin pas khyed grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes tshig brgyud pas skyon 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: Since that is also established in our scriptures, you are proving what is already established for us.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says,

analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de dag la 'di skad ces dri bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te grangs can gsal bar smra ba de dag la 'di skad ces dri bar bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Here, one should ask them, What is that? and so on. One should connect it with one should ask those Enumerators who propound manifestation in this way.

analyzed: de la gang dag gcig gsal bar byed ces bya ba ni dngos po gang dag gcig gsal bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Among those, What is manifested? means What things are manifested?

original: ji ltar gsal bar byed ces bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis gsal bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //ğŸ”½gal te dper na mar mes bum pa la sogs pa @150a * //
analyzed: ji ltar gsal bar byed ces bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis gsal bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // gal te dper na mar mes bum pa la sogs pa @150a * //
translated: How is it manifested? means By what mode is it manifested?

original: bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te de dag na re /
analyzed: bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te de dag na re /
translated: If they say, For example, like a pot and so on by a lamp, one should say, If they say,

analyzed: dper na mar mes mun pa'i gnas skabs kyi bum pa la sogs pa gsal bar byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, a butterlamp illuminates a pot, etc., which exist at the time of darkness.

original: rkyen rnams kyis kyang chen po la sogs pa'i byed brag snga nas dus thams cad du yod pa dag gsal bar byed do zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: rkyen rnams kyis kyang chen po la sogs pa'i byed brag snga nas dus thams cad du yod pa dag gsal bar byed do zhes zer na'o //
translated: Likewise, conditions also illuminate the pot, etc., which exist from the beginning as different things.

original: de skad ces zer na /
analyzed: de skad ces zer na /
translated: If you say that,

analyzed: de dag la 'di skad ces dri bar bya ste /
translated: then you should be asked this:

analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ma skyes pa dag mar me ma skyes pas ji ltar gsal bar byed ces bya ba smras te /

analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / khyod kyis ji ltar gsal bar bya ba dang gsal bar byed pas gsal ba sgrub pa'i dpe bum pa la sogs pa dang mar me las blangs pa gang yin pa de kho bo'i phyogs la don dam par ma skyes pa yin pas bum pa la sogs pa ma
translated: This is what is being said:ğŸ”½The example of a pot, etc., which is to be illuminated and a butterlamp, which illuminates, that you have taken to prove illumination, in my system is not ultimately arisen.

analyzed: skyes pa dag mar mi ma skyes pas ji ltar gsal bar byed de mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, how can a butterlamp which is not arisen illuminate a pot, etc., which are not arisen? It cannot!

analyzed: de'i phyir rta'i rva ma skyes pa ni nam yang gsal bar byar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, the non-arising of a rabbitâ€™s horns is never suitable to be clarified.

original: dper na rta'i rva ma skyes pa ni nam yang gsal bar byar mi rung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rta'i rva ma skyes pa ni nam yang gsal bar byar mi rung ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as the non-arising of a rabbitâ€™s horns is never suitable to be clarified,

analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ma skyes pa yang nam yang gsal bar byar mi rung ste /
translated: in the same way, the non-arising of a pot and so on is never suitable to be clarified.

original: de ltar re zhig don dam par gsal ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig don dam par gsal ba med do //
translated: Thus, first, clarification does not exist ultimately.

original: tha snyad kyi bden pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir de dag yod par khas blangs na yad smra bar bya ste zhes bya bas ni /

translated: In order to present the system of conventional truth, it is said, â€œIf you accept that they exist, then you should speak.â€

analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa dang mar me de dag yod par khas blangs na yang /
translated: In order to present the system of conventional truth, if you accept that those pots and so on and lamps exist,ğŸ”½then you should speak.

original: kun rdzob tu yang mar mes bum pa la sogs pa snga na yod pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin pas gsal bar bya ba dang / gsal bar byed pas gsal ba sgrub pa'i dpe mi 'grub pas gsal ba med par ston to //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang mar mes bum pa la sogs pa snga na yod pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin pas gsal bar bya ba dang / gsal bar byed pas gsal ba sgrub pa'i dpe mi 'grub pas gsal ba med par ston to //
translated: Since a lamp does not illuminate a pot, etc. that exist previously, even conventionally, the example of illumination does not establish illumination. Therefore, illumination does not exist.

original: de la tha snyad kyi bden pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i lugs bum pa dang mar me la sogs pa'i chos gnas pa nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la tha snyad kyi bden pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i lugs bum pa dang mar me la sogs pa'i chos gnas pa nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œIn order to present the system of conventional truthâ€ means in order to present the system of conventional truth, the way things are, such as pots, lamps, etc.

original: de dag yod par khas blangs na yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag yod par khas blangs na yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œEven though they are accepted as existingâ€ means

original: bum pa dang mar me me la sogs pa de dag yod par khas blangs na yang ste /
analyzed: bum pa dang mar me me la sogs pa de dag yod par khas blangs na yang ste /
translated: even though those such as pots, lamps, etc. are accepted as existing.

original: 'di ltar kun rdzob tu bum pa la sogs pa dang mar me la sogs pa de dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar kun rdzob tu bum pa la sogs pa dang mar me la sogs pa de dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this way, since those such as pots, etc. and lamps, etc. exist conventionally,

original: smra bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar kun rdzob tu gsal bar bya ba dang / gsal @150b par byed pas gsal bar sgrub pa'i dpe bum pa la sogs pa khas blangs pa yang ji ltar kun rdzob tu dngos po snga na yod pa rkyen gyis gsal bar byed pa med pa de ltar smra bar bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: smra bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar kun rdzob tu gsal bar bya ba dang / gsal @150b par byed pas gsal bar sgrub pa'i dpe bum pa la sogs pa khas blangs pa yang ji ltar kun rdzob tu dngos po snga na yod pa rkyen gyis gsal bar byed pa med pa de ltar smra bar bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: â€œWe sayâ€ connects this passage to the statement that the example of a pot, which is accepted as something that is clarified by a clarifying agent, is clarified by a clarifying agent in the same way that an existent entity is clarified by conditions in the relative sense.

original: mar mes bum pa la ci zhig byed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: mar mes bum pa la ci zhig byed ces bya ba ni /
translated: What does the butterlamp do for the pot?

original: pha rol la dri ba'i tshig yin te /ğŸ”½mar mes bum pa la sogs pa snga na yod pa gsal bar mi byed kyi /
analyzed: pha rol la dri ba'i tshig yin te / mar mes bum pa la sogs pa snga na yod pa gsal bar mi byed kyi /
translated: This is a question that is asked of the opponent.ğŸ”½The butterlamp does not clarify a pot that already exists.

original: sngon med pa 'byung bar byed pas gsal bar byed pa ma yin par ston pa yin no //ğŸ”½gal te gzung bar byed na ni zhes bya ba ni /ğŸ”½de skad ces dris pa ni gal te de dag na re /
analyzed: sngon med pa 'byung bar byed pas gsal bar byed pa ma yin par ston pa yin no // gal te gzung bar byed na ni zhes bya ba ni / de skad ces dris pa ni gal te de dag na re /
translated: The butterlamp does not clarify it because it does not bring into existence what did not exist previously.ğŸ”½If it illuminates it,ğŸ”½If the opponent responds to the question, â€œWhat does the butterlamp do for the pot?â€

original: mar mes bum pa gzung ba nyid du byed pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: mar mes bum pa gzung ba nyid du byed pas de'i phyir /
translated: by saying, â€œThe butterlamp illuminates the pot,â€ğŸ”½then the response is, â€œThe butterlamp does not illuminate the pot because it is not obscured.â€

original: bum pa snga na yod pa gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: bum pa snga na yod pa gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes zer na'o //
translated: If you say that the lamp illuminates the pot that existed previously.

original: de'i lan du de sngon med pas de nyid byed pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i lan du de sngon med pas de nyid byed pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that, it is said that since it did not exist previously, it makes that exist.

original: de sngon med pa zhes bya ba ni gzung ba de mar me'i snga rol na med pas so //
analyzed: de sngon med pa zhes bya ba ni gzung ba de mar me'i snga rol na med pas so //
translated: Since that did not exist previously means that the object apprehended did not exist prior to the lamp.

original: de nyid byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It makes that exist means

original: da ltar gzung ba de mar me'i snga rol na med la /
analyzed: da ltar gzung ba de mar me'i snga rol na med la /
translated: that the object apprehended now did not exist prior to the lamp.

original: mar me byung bas gzung bar byed na'o na ni mar mes gzung ba snga na med pa nyid byed pa yin pas /ğŸ”½de lta na mar mes gzung ba snga na med pa 'byung bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mar me byung bas gzung bar byed na'o na ni mar mes gzung ba snga na med pa nyid byed pa yin pas / de lta na mar mes gzung ba snga na med pa 'byung bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: If the lamp makes the object apprehended exist, then since the lamp makes the nonexistence of the object apprehended prior to it exist,

original: snga na yod pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snga na yod pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: in that case the lamp makes the nonexistence of the object apprehended prior to it exist, but it does not illuminate that which existed previously.

original: 'on te mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba nyid du byed na ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'on te mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba nyid du byed na ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: But if it makes the object apprehended by eye consciousness exist, then.

original: gal te de dag na re /
analyzed: gal te de dag na re /
translated: If they say,

original: mar mes bum pa mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba'i yul nyid du byed pas /
analyzed: mar mes bum pa mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba'i yul nyid du byed pas /
translated: the lamp makes the pot the object apprehended by eye consciousness,

original: de'i phyir snga na yod pa gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir snga na yod pa gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes zer na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the manifestation of what existed previously.

original: de'i lan du mun pa dang bcas pa na sngon med de nyid byed pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i lan du mun pa dang bcas pa na sngon med de nyid byed pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that, it is said that when there is darkness, it makes what did not exist previously.

original: mun pa dang bcas pa na sngon med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mun pa dang bcas pa na sngon med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When there is darkness, what did not exist previously

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba nyid gar yin pa de mun pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na sngon med pas so //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba nyid gar yin pa de mun pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na sngon med pas so //
translated: means that when there is darkness, what is to be apprehended by eye consciousness did not exist previously.

original: de nyid byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It makes what did not exist previously means

original: de ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba nyid gang yin pa de mun pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na sngon med la /
analyzed: de ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba nyid gang yin pa de mun pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na sngon med la /
translated: that what is to be apprehended by eye consciousness did not exist previously when there was darkness.

original: mar me byung bas mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba nyid du byed na /
analyzed: mar me byung bas mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba nyid du byed na /
translated: When a lamp arises, it makes what is to be apprehended by eye consciousness.

original: 'o na ni mar mes mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba nyid snga na med pa de nyid byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'o na ni mar mes mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba nyid snga na med pa de nyid byed pa yin pas /
translated: If that is so, since a lamp makes what is to be apprehended by eye consciousness that did not exist previously,ğŸ”½then a lamp makes what did not exist previously.

original: de ltar na yang mar mes mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba nyid snga na med pa 'byung bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na yang mar mes mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba nyid snga na med pa 'byung bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, a lamp acts to generate the object of apprehension of eye consciousness that did not exist previously.

original: snga na yod pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //ğŸ”½ci ste @151a * //
analyzed: snga na yod pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin no // ci ste @151a * //
translated: It does not clarify what existed previously.ğŸ”½If you say, â€œIt is like a lamp,â€

original: bum pa gzung ba la bar chad byed pa'i mun pa sel bar byed pa na yang zhes bya ba ni /ğŸ”½gal te de dag na re /
analyzed: bum pa gzung ba la bar chad byed pa'i mun pa sel bar byed pa na yang zhes bya ba ni / gal te de dag na re /
translated: then it is like the removal of darkness that obstructs the apprehension of a pot.

original: mar mes bum pa gzung ba la bar chad byed pa'i mun pa sel bar byed pas de'i phyir snga na yod pa gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes zer na yang ngo //ğŸ”½de'i lan du /
analyzed: mar mes bum pa gzung ba la bar chad byed pa'i mun pa sel bar byed pas de'i phyir snga na yod pa gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes zer na yang ngo // de'i lan du /
translated: If you say, â€œA lamp clarifies what existed previously because it removes the darkness that obstructs the apprehension of a pot,â€

original: de nyid byed pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de nyid byed pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: then in response to that, it is said, â€œIt is like that.â€ğŸ”½â€œIt is like thatâ€ means that when a lamp is present, the darkness that obstructs the apprehension of a pot is removed.

original: de nyid byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mar me med pa na bum pa gzung ba la bar chad byed pa'i mun pa sel ba gang yin pa de yang sngon med la /
analyzed: de nyid byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mar me med pa na bum pa gzung ba la bar chad byed pa'i mun pa sel ba gang yin pa de yang sngon med la /
translated: That which removes the darkness that obstructs the apprehension of a pot when a lamp is present did not exist previously.

original: mar me byung bas bum pa gzung ba la bar chad byed pa'i mun pa sel bar byed na /
analyzed: mar me byung bas bum pa gzung ba la bar chad byed pa'i mun pa sel bar byed na /
translated: When a lamp is present, it removes the darkness that obstructs the apprehension of a pot.

original: 'o na ni mar mes bum pa gzung bal bar chad byed pa'i mun pa sel ba snga na med pa de nyid byed pa yin pas de lta na yang mar mes bum pa gzung ba la bar chad byed pa'i mun pa sel ba snga na med pa 'byung
analyzed: 'o na ni mar mes bum pa gzung bal bar chad byed pa'i mun pa sel ba snga na med pa de nyid byed pa yin pas de lta na yang mar mes bum pa gzung ba la bar chad byed pa'i mun pa sel ba snga na med pa 'byung
translated: But if the non-arisen is the object of the action, then the lamp would illuminate the non-arisen darkness that obstructs the apprehension of the pot.

original: bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: In that case, the lamp would generate the non-arisen illumination that removes the darkness that obstructs the apprehension of the pot.

original: snga na yod pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snga na yod pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: But it does not illuminate what already exists.

original: 'on te pha rol po 'di skad ces blta bar bya ba dang / reg par byed pa'i rdzas la reg par bya ba ni mun pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na yang yod pas de'i phyir de'i 'og tu snang bar gyur pa ni gsal ba yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'on te pha rol po 'di skad ces blta bar bya ba dang / reg par byed pa'i rdzas la reg par bya ba ni mun pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na yang yod pas de'i phyir de'i 'og tu snang bar gyur pa ni gsal ba yin no zhes zer na /
translated: But if the opponent says that the object to be seen and the object to be touched exist even when the substance is in darkness, then the illumination that occurs later is the illumination,

original: de'i lan du 'on te gzung ba yin na ni /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'on te gzung ba yin na ni /
translated: in response to that, it is said: But if it is apprehended,

original: de nyid snang ba yin pas yang mar mes ci zhig bya zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de nyid snang ba yin pas yang mar mes ci zhig bya zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: then since that itself is illumination, what would the lamp do?

original: de la 'on te gzung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'on te gzung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In that regard, if it is apprehended,

original: reg par yang bya ba'i rdzas de mun pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na gzung ba nyid du yod pa yin na ni'o //
analyzed: reg par yang bya ba'i rdzas de mun pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na gzung ba nyid du yod pa yin na ni'o //
translated: If the substance that is to be touched exists as something that is apprehended when it is in a state of being associated with darkness,

original: de nyid snang ba yin pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid snang ba yin pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: then that very thing is illuminated.

original: de ltar reg par bya ba'i rdzas mun pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na gzung ba nyid du yod pa de nyid snang ba yin pas so //
analyzed: de ltar reg par bya ba'i rdzas mun pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na gzung ba nyid du yod pa de nyid snang ba yin pas so //
translated: The substance that is to be touched exists as something that is apprehended when it is in a state of being associated with darkness, then that very thing is illuminated.

original: yang mar mes ci zhig bya zhes bya ba ni snga na snang ba yin na de la yang mar mes gsal bar bya mi dgos pas /
analyzed: yang mar mes ci zhig bya zhes bya ba ni snga na snang ba yin na de la yang mar mes gsal bar bya mi dgos pas /
translated: What would a lamp do? If it existed prior to illumination, then it would not need to illuminate that which already exists.

original: de lta na yang mar me gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang mar me gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: In this way, a lamp does not illuminate.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: 'di la sngon ma gsung ba phyis 'dzin par byed pa gang yin pa de la gsal ba zhes bya ba na /
analyzed: 'di la sngon ma gsung ba phyis 'dzin par byed pa gang yin pa de la gsal ba zhes bya ba na /
translated: That which is not previously stated but is apprehended later is called â€œillumination.â€

original: reg par bya ba'i rdzas de mun pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na gzung ba nyid du yod pa yin na /
analyzed: reg par bya ba'i rdzas de mun pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na gzung ba nyid du yod pa yin na /
translated: If the substance that is to be touched exists as something that is apprehended when it is in a state of being associated with darkness,ğŸ”½then that very thing is illuminated.

original: de nyid blta bar bya ba'i rdzas su snang ba yin pas de la yang mar mes snang bar bya mi dgos pas de lta na yang mar mes gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid blta bar bya ba'i rdzas su snang ba yin pas de la yang mar mes snang bar bya mi dgos pas de lta na yang mar mes gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is a substance that appears as the object of seeing, it does not need to be illuminated by the butterlamp. Thus, the butterlamp does not illuminate it.

original: 'on te reg par bya ba'i rdzas de mun pa @151b dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na gzung ba nyid du med pa las phyis mar mes snang bar byed na ni /
analyzed: 'on te reg par bya ba'i rdzas de mun pa @151b dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na gzung ba nyid du med pa las phyis mar mes snang bar byed na ni /
translated: But if the tangible object exists in a place that is together with darkness and is not apprehended, later it is illuminated by the butterlamp,

original: de lta na yang mar mes snga na med pa skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta na yang mar mes snga na med pa skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: in that case, the butterlamp generates what did not exist previously.

original: snga na yod pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snga na yod pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: But it does not illuminate what existed previously.

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la bum pa zhes bya ba yang 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la bum pa zhes bya ba yang 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs yin te /
translated: In our system, what is called a â€œpotâ€ is a collection of the primary elements and derivative form.

original: mar me phyung bar na snang ba dang lhan cig tu skye bas de'i phyir tha snyad du yang dngos po rang gi rgyu las rgyun gyis 'byung ba'i byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin te /
analyzed: mar me phyung bar na snang ba dang lhan cig tu skye bas de'i phyir tha snyad du yang dngos po rang gi rgyu las rgyun gyis 'byung ba'i byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin te /
translated: Since the light is generated together with the butterlamp, therefore, conventionally, the butterlamp is the cause of the arising of the object through the continuum of its cause.

original: snang ba dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snang ba dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the cause that arises simultaneously with the appearance,ğŸ”½it is thought that the lamp illuminates it.

original: gsal bar byed pa nyid yin par bsams so zhes bya bas ni dbu ma pas phyogs la bum pa zhes bya ba yang 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs skad cig pa yin te /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa nyid yin par bsams so zhes bya bas ni dbu ma pas phyogs la bum pa zhes bya ba yang 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs skad cig pa yin te /
translated: The Madhyamikas think that the so-called pot is a collection of moments of the primary elements and the derivative form.

original: de mun pa'i gnas skabs na 'dug pa mar mes snang bar byed pa na bum pa'i skad cig ma snga ma dang / mun pa'i skad cig ni mnyam du 'gag la /
analyzed: de mun pa'i gnas skabs na 'dug pa mar mes snang bar byed pa na bum pa'i skad cig ma snga ma dang / mun pa'i skad cig ni mnyam du 'gag la /
translated: When the lamp illuminates it while it is in a state of darkness, the previous moment of the pot and the moment of darkness cease simultaneously.

original: bum pa'i skad cig phye ma dang snang ba'i skad cig kyang lhan cig tu skye bas de'i phyir mar me ni kun rdzob tu yang bum pa'i dngos po rang gi rgyu las rgyun gyis 'byung ba'i byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i sgo nas gsal bar byed pa nyid yinğŸ”½par bsams kyi /
analyzed: bum pa'i skad cig phye ma dang snang ba'i skad cig kyang lhan cig tu skye bas de'i phyir mar me ni kun rdzob tu yang bum pa'i dngos po rang gi rgyu las rgyun gyis 'byung ba'i byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i sgo nas gsal bar byed pa nyid yinğŸ”½par bsams kyi /
translated: The moment of the pot and the moment of the light arise simultaneously. Therefore, the lamp is thought to be the illuminating cause of the pot in the sense that it is the active cause that arises in a continuum from its own cause, even conventionally.

original: bum pa'i skad cig mun pa'i gnas skabs su sngar 'gags pa phyis snang bar mi byed pas gsal bar byed pa zhes ni mi bya ste /
analyzed: bum pa'i skad cig mun pa'i gnas skabs su sngar 'gags pa phyis snang bar mi byed pas gsal bar byed pa zhes ni mi bya ste /
translated: Since the moment of the vase does not illuminate what was previously ceased in the darkness, it is not called illumination.

original: bum pa'i skad cig snga ma 'gags pa mar mes snang bar ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: bum pa'i skad cig snga ma 'gags pa mar mes snang bar ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: This is because the previous moment of the vase is not illuminated by the butter lamp.

original: de la kho bo cag gi phyogs la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la kho bo cag gi phyogs la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In our system,

original: kho bo cag sangs rgyas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' la'o //ğŸ”½bum pa zhes bya ba yang zhes bya ba ni bum pa zhes bya ba'i ming can nam /
analyzed: kho bo cag sangs rgyas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' la'o // bum pa zhes bya ba yang zhes bya ba ni bum pa zhes bya ba'i ming can nam /
translated: our system is the Buddhist philosophical tenet system.ğŸ”½The so-called vase

original: bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod pa'i dngos po'o //ğŸ”½'byung ba zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag go //ğŸ”½'byung ba las byung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams te /
analyzed: bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod pa'i dngos po'o // 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag go // 'byung ba las byung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams te /
translated: is the entity that is called a vase or is expressed by the term vase.ğŸ”½The so-called elements are the four great elements such as earth.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag las gyur pa'o //
translated: The so-called derivative form is derivative form, which is derived from the four great elements.

original: tshogs yin te zhes bya ba ni de dag gi rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i tshogs yin pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs yin te zhes bya ba ni de dag gi rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i tshogs yin pa ste /
translated: â€œThey are collectionsâ€ means that they are collections of the aggregation of atoms.

original: de dag kyang skad cig ma'i tshogs yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang skad cig ma'i tshogs yin no //
translated: And those are collections of moments.

original: mar me byung ba na snang ba dang lhan cig tu skye bas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mar me byung ba na snang ba dang lhan cig tu skye bas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œWhen the lamp arises, the light arises together with itâ€

original: skad cig ma nyid yin pas mar mes bum pa snga na yod pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid yin pas mar mes bum pa snga na yod pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin par ston to //
translated: shows that the lamp does not illuminate a pot that exists previously, because it is momentary.

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs kyis bum pa ni @152a * //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs kyis bum pa ni @152a * //
translated: The pot is a collection of the primary elements and derivative form.

original: skad cig ma nyid yin pas bum pa'i skad cig mi mthun pa snga ma 'gags pa'i 'og tu skad cig ma mi mthun pa phyi ma gzhan 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid yin pas bum pa'i skad cig mi mthun pa snga ma 'gags pa'i 'og tu skad cig ma mi mthun pa phyi ma gzhan 'byung ngo //
translated: Since it is momentary, after the cessation of the previous moment of the pot, another different subsequent moment arises.

original: de'i phyir gal te 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i skad cig mun pa'i gnas skabs na snga na yod pa gang yin pa de nyid mar me'i gnas skabs kyi dus su yang 'byung bar 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i skad cig mun pa'i gnas skabs na snga na yod pa gang yin pa de nyid mar me'i gnas skabs kyi dus su yang 'byung bar 'gyur na ni /
translated: Therefore, if the primary elements and derivative form that exist in the state of darkness were to arise again in the state of the lamp,

original: des na mar mes dngos po snga na yod pa gsal bar byed do zhes byar yang rung grang na /
analyzed: des na mar mes dngos po snga na yod pa gsal bar byed do zhes byar yang rung grang na /
translated: Therefore, it is suitable to say that a lamp illuminates an object that exists previously.

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs kyi bum pa ni skad cig gi rgyun gyis 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs kyi bum pa ni skad cig gi rgyun gyis 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But a pot, which is a collection of the primary elements and derivative form, arises through the continuum of moments.

original: bum pa'i skad cig snga ma gzhan ni mun pa dang lhan cig tu 'gag la /
analyzed: bum pa'i skad cig snga ma gzhan ni mun pa dang lhan cig tu 'gag la /
translated: Therefore, the previous moment of the pot ceases together with darkness,

original: bum pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma gzhan ni mar me byung ba na snang ba dang lhan cig tu skye bas de'i phyir mar mes dngos po snga na yod pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa'i skad cig ma phyi ma gzhan ni mar me byung ba na snang ba dang lhan cig tu skye bas de'i phyir mar mes dngos po snga na yod pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: and the later moment of the pot arises together with light when the lamp arises. Therefore, a lamp does not illuminate an object that exists previously.

original: de'i phyir tha snyad du yang dngos po rang gi rgyu las rgyun gyis 'byung ba'i byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad du yang dngos po rang gi rgyu las rgyun gyis 'byung ba'i byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, even conventionally, an entity is the cause of its continuum because it arises from its own cause.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: de'i phyir kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang mar me ni bum pa'i dngos po rang gi rgyu 'jim pa la sogs pa las skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis 'byung ba la bar du gcod par mi byed pas rgyu yin pa'i sgo nas gsal bar byed pa nyid yinğŸ”½par brjod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang mar me ni bum pa'i dngos po rang gi rgyu 'jim pa la sogs pa las skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis 'byung ba la bar du gcod par mi byed pas rgyu yin pa'i sgo nas gsal bar byed pa nyid yin par brjod kyi /
translated: Therefore, even conventionally, a lamp is said to illuminate a vase by being its cause, since it does not obstruct the arising of the vase from its own causes, such as clay, through a continuum of instants.ğŸ”½But it is not said to illuminate it because it does not illuminate a vase that has previously ceased in a state of darkness later.

original: bum pa'i skad cig mun pa'i gnas skabs su sngar 'gags pa phyis snang bar mi byed pas gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir gsal bar byed pa zhes ni mi bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: bum pa'i skad cig mun pa'i gnas skabs su sngar 'gags pa phyis snang bar mi byed pas gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir gsal bar byed pa zhes ni mi bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: This is taught by the following.

original: 'di la rgyu rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of causes:

original: byed pa'i rgyu dang gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu dang gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: active causes and illuminating causes.

original: de la byed pa'i rgyu ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs kyi mtshan nyid skye bar 'dod pa'i skad cig ma snga ma ste /
analyzed: de la byed pa'i rgyu ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs kyi mtshan nyid skye bar 'dod pa'i skad cig ma snga ma ste /
translated: An active cause is the previous moment that is asserted to be the cause of the arising of a collection of primary elements and derivative form.

original: byed pa'i rgyu de las dngos po rang gi rgyu las rgyun 'dra ba'i rgyun gyis 'byung ba thams cad gang du snang bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu de las dngos po rang gi rgyu las rgyun 'dra ba'i rgyun gyis 'byung ba thams cad gang du snang bar gyur pa na /
translated: When all things arise from their own causes through a continuum that is similar to its cause, and they appear,

original: snang ba de skye ba la bgegs mi byed pas de'i phyir snang ba yang bum pa la sogs pa'i byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin no //
analyzed: snang ba de skye ba la bgegs mi byed pas de'i phyir snang ba yang bum pa la sogs pa'i byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin no //
translated: since the light does not obstruct their appearance, therefore light is the active cause of the pot, etc.

original: gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu ni grangs can dag gis dngos po snga na yod pa'i sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs su brtags pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu ni grangs can dag gis dngos po snga na yod pa'i sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs su brtags pa tsam du zad de /
translated: The illuminating cause is merely imagined by the SÄá¹ƒkhyas as the proof that things exist prior to their manifestation.

original: de ni kun rdzob tu yang med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob tu yang med par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it does not exist even conventionally.

original: ji ltar na mar me de tha snyad du yang dngos po rang gi rgyu las rgyun gyis 'byung ba'i byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mar me de tha snyad du yang dngos po rang gi rgyu las rgyun gyis 'byung ba'i byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that light is the active cause of things that arise through a continuum from their own causes even conventionally?

original: de'i phyir snang ba @152b dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir snang ba @152b dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it was said, â€œbecause it is the coemergent cause of light.â€

original: kun rdzob tu bum pa de snang ba dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i rgyu mar me yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu bum pa de snang ba dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i rgyu mar me yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conventional cause of the appearance of the pot is the lamp.

original: gsal bar byed pa nyid yin par bsams so zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa nyid yin par bsams so zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: The phrase â€œit is thought that it illuminatesâ€ is the conclusion.

original: de ltar bum pa snang ba dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu mar me yin pa'i phyir mar me ni kun rdzob tu yang bum pa'i dngos po rang gi rgyu las rgyun gyis 'byung ba'i byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i sgo nas gsal bar byed pa nyid yin par bsamsğŸ”½kyi / bum pa'i skad cig mun pa'i gnas skabs su sngar 'gags pa phyis snang bar mi byed pas gsal bar byed pa zhes ni mi bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar bum pa snang ba dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu mar me yin pa'i phyir mar me ni kun rdzob tu yang bum pa'i dngos po rang gi rgyu las rgyun gyis 'byung ba'i byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i sgo nas gsal bar byed pa nyid yin par bsams kyi / bum pa'i skad cig mun pa'i gnas skabs su sngar 'gags pa phyis snang bar mi byed pas gsal bar byed pa zhes ni mi bya ste /
translated: Thus, because the lamp is the conventional cause of the appearance of the pot, the lamp is thought to be the illuminating cause of the pot in the sense that it is the cause of the continuum of the pot arising from its own cause.ğŸ”½But it is not called the illuminator because the previous moment of the pot that has ceased in the darkness does not illuminate it later.

original: bum pa'i skad cig ma snga ma 'gags pa mar mes snang bar ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bum pa'i skad cig ma snga ma 'gags pa mar mes snang bar ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is because the previous moment of the pot does not illuminate it because the lamp does not illuminate it.

original: don dam par ni skye ba dgag pa bzhin du gsal ba dgag pa yang mtshungs te zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: don dam par ni skye ba dgag pa bzhin du gsal ba dgag pa yang mtshungs te zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: â€œIn the ultimate sense, the refutation of manifestation is similar to the refutation of production.â€

original: dngos po rnams bdag gis gsal bar byed dam /
analyzed: dngos po rnams bdag gis gsal bar byed dam /
translated: If one asks whether things are manifested by themselves,

original: gzhan gyis gsal bar byed dam /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gsal bar byed dam /
translated: by another,ğŸ”½by both,

original: gnyis kyis gsal bar byed dam /ğŸ”½rgyu med pa las gsal bar byed grang na /
analyzed: gnyis kyis gsal bar byed dam / rgyu med pa las gsal bar byed grang na /
translated: or without a cause,

original: don dam par ni skye ba dgag pa bzhin du gsal ba dgag pa yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: don dam par ni skye ba dgag pa bzhin du gsal ba dgag pa yang mtshungs te /
translated: in the ultimate sense, the refutation of manifestation is similar to the refutation of production.

original: ji ltar don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med par nges te /
analyzed: ji ltar don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams bdag las skye ba med par nges te /
translated: Just as it is certain that in the ultimate sense the internal sense bases are not produced from themselves,

original: yod pa'i phyir dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: because they exist, like the existence of consciousness.

original: don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med do //
analyzed: don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med do //
translated: In the ultimate sense, the internal sense bases are not produced from other conditions,

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: because they are other, like a pot.

original: yang na don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or else, ultimately, the internal sources such as the eyes, which are asserted to be other, are not conditions because they are other.

original: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the material cause such as the thread and so on.

original: don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga las skye ba med de /
analyzed: don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga las skye ba med de /
translated: Ultimately, the internal sources are not produced from self, other, or both.

original: phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i sgrub pa dag gis gtad khongs su chud par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gnyis las skye bar ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i sgrub pa dag gis gtad khongs su chud par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gnyis las skye bar ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Because they are included in the two positions that have been refuted, and because there is no inference that demonstrates production from both.

original: don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams rgyu med pa las skye ba med de /
analyzed: don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams rgyu med pa las skye ba med de /
translated: Ultimately, the internal sources are not produced without a cause.

original: de ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i skyon yod pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya bar dgongs @153a * //
analyzed: de ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i skyon yod pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya bar dgongs @153a * //
translated: Because there is no inference that demonstrates that, and because there is the fault of contradicting the inference that is renowned.

original: so zhes bstan pa bzhin du /
analyzed: so zhes bstan pa bzhin du /
translated: As it was explained in the case of the lamp.

original: 'dir yang don dam par dngos po rnams bdag gis gsal bar mi byed par nges te gsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir yang don dam par dngos po rnams bdag gis gsal bar mi byed par nges te gsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, it is certain that ultimately things are not illuminated by themselves, because they are illuminated.

original: dper na gsal ba gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gsal ba gzhan bzhin no //
translated: For example, like something else that is illuminated.

original: don dam par dngos po rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag gis gsal bar mi byed de //
analyzed: don dam par dngos po rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag gis gsal bar mi byed de //
translated: Ultimately, things are not illuminated by other conditions,

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are other.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a pot.

original: yang na don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa bum pa la sogs pa dngos po gsal bar byed pa dag rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa bum pa la sogs pa dngos po gsal bar byed pa dag rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, ultimately, it is certain that things that are asserted to be other, such as a pot, are not conditions that illuminate things, because they are other.

original: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the threads that are the cause of a cloth.

original: don dam par dngos po rnams gnyi gas gsal bar mi byed de /
analyzed: don dam par dngos po rnams gnyi gas gsal bar mi byed de /
translated: Ultimately, things are not illuminated by both,ğŸ”½because they are other.

original: phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i sgrub pa dag gis gtad khongs su chud par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gnyi ga gsal bar ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i sgrub pa dag gis gtad khongs su chud par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gnyi ga gsal bar ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because the two sides are included in the two, and because there is no inference that reveals both.

original: don dam par dngos po rnams rgyu med pas gsal bar mi byed de /
analyzed: don dam par dngos po rnams rgyu med pas gsal bar mi byed de /
translated: In the ultimate, things are not illuminated without a cause,

original: de ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa dang grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i skyon yod pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa dang grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i skyon yod pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because there is no inference that reveals that, and because there is the fault of the contradiction of inference and what is commonly acknowledged.

original: gzhan yang mun pa yang gsal bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang mun pa yang gsal bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Moreover, darkness would be illuminated.

original: pha rol po dag na re mi gsal ba gsal bar byed do zhes gdon mi za bar zer bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: pha rol po dag na re mi gsal ba gsal bar byed do zhes gdon mi za bar zer bar 'gyur bas /

analyzed: de'i phyir mi gsal ba ni gsal bar mi byed de zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the non-illuminated does not illuminate.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chen po la sogs pa mi gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: chen po la sogs pa mi gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because the great one and so on are not manifest.

original: chen po dang nga rgyal dang / 'byung ba dang / dbang po dang / de tsam zhes bya ba de kho na'i tshogs rnams mi gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen po dang nga rgyal dang / 'byung ba dang / dbang po dang / de tsam zhes bya ba de kho na'i tshogs rnams mi gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The great one, the I-maker, the elements, the senses, and the mere thisâ€”these collections of reality are not manifest.

analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya bas ni de'i dpe bstan pa yin no //

original: des na de ltar gsal ba yang bzang po ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: des na de ltar gsal ba yang bzang po ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: The phrase â€œthus, manifestation is not goodâ€ is the conclusion.

original: sngar grangs can dag na re /
analyzed: sngar grangs can dag na re /

original: ma skyes pa ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni bden mod kyi /
translated: â€œAlthough it is not produced,

original: 'on kyang gsal bar byed do zhes zer zhing ;ğŸ”½dngos po rnams yod par sgrub pa gsal ba zhes bya ba yin par dam bcas pa de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gsal bar byed do zhes zer zhing ; dngos po rnams yod par sgrub pa gsal ba zhes bya ba yin par dam bcas pa de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: nevertheless, it manifests.â€ğŸ”½The assertion that â€œmanifestationâ€ establishes the existence of things is not good.

original: 'di ltar ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa des na gsal ba de dngos po yod par sgrub pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa des na gsal ba de dngos po yod par sgrub pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, as explained above, manifestation does not establish the existence of things.

original: 'di la gzhan ni dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba med de /
analyzed: 'di la gzhan ni dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba med de /
translated: Here, the opponent explains that things do not arise causelessly.ğŸ”½Because it would follow that everything would arise from everything at all times.

original: dus @153b thams cad du thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad pa byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye ba med par sgrub pa'i skabs 'di la 'grel pa byed
analyzed: dus @153b thams cad du thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad pa byed do zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye ba med par sgrub pa'i skabs 'di la 'grel pa byed
translated: This is the context of proving that things do not arise causelessly.

original: pa / slob dpon buddha p'a li ta ni 'di skad du rnam par bshad pa byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pa / slob dpon buddha p'a li ta ni 'di skad du rnam par bshad pa byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The master BuddhapÄlita explains this as follows.

original: de la 'di la zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye ba med par sgrub pa'i skabs 'di la'o //
analyzed: de la 'di la zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye ba med par sgrub pa'i skabs 'di la'o //
translated: Here means in this context of proving that things do not arise causelessly.

original: gzhan ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bstan bcos 'di'i 'grel pa byed pa mang ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bstan bcos 'di'i 'grel pa byed pa mang ste /
translated: The word â€œothersâ€ indicates that there are many commentators on this treatise.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas dang / gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta dang / tsandra k'i rti dang / de ba shar ma dang / gu na shr'i dang / gu na ma ti dang / sthi ra ma ti dang / slob dpon legs ldan byed nyid la thug pa'i bar dag yod pa las de dag phal las gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas dang / gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta dang / tsandra k'i rti dang / de ba shar ma dang / gu na shr'i dang / gu na ma ti dang / sthi ra ma ti dang / slob dpon legs ldan byed nyid la thug pa'i bar dag yod pa las de dag phal las gzhan pa ste /
translated: and the teacher himself, up to the master BhÄviveka.ğŸ”½Among them, the one other than most,

original: gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta dang sbyar ro //ğŸ”½gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta ni dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba med do /
analyzed: gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta dang sbyar ro // gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta ni dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba med do /
translated: the elder Buddha PÄlita,

original: dus thams cad du thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad pa byed do //
analyzed: dus thams cad du thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad pa byed do //
translated: the elder Buddha PÄlita explains: Things do not arise from self, because it would follow that everything would always arise from everything, and so on.

original: de la dngos po rnams zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: de la dngos po rnams zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi skye mched rnams so //
translated: Here, â€œthingsâ€ refers to the inner and outer sense bases.

original: rgyu med pa las kyang zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa dang rgyu mi mthun pa las kyang ngo //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las kyang zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa dang rgyu mi mthun pa las kyang ngo //
translated: â€œAlso from no causeâ€ means also from no cause or from a cause that is not concordant.

original: skye ba med do zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med do zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'o //
translated: â€œNon-productionâ€ is the ultimate.

original: ci'i phyir dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba med ce na /ğŸ”½gal te rgyu med pa las skye bar gyur na dus thams cad du skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba med ce na / gal te rgyu med pa las skye bar gyur na dus thams cad du skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Why is it that things are not produced causelessly?ğŸ”½If things were produced causelessly, it follows that they would be produced at all times.

original: gal te dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye bar gyur na dus tshigs dang dus med par yang dus thams cad du skye ba kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye bar gyur na dus tshigs dang dus med par yang dus thams cad du skye ba kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If things were produced causelessly, it follows that they would be produced at all times, regardless of the time or season.

original: gzhan yang thams cad las skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /ğŸ”½gal te dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan yang thams cad las skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te / gal te dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: Moreover, it follows that anything could be produced from anything.

original: rgyu rigs mi mthun pa thams cad las kyang skye ba kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro//
analyzed: rgyu rigs mi mthun pa thams cad las kyang skye ba kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro//
translated: If things were produced causelessly, it follows that anything could be produced from anything.

original: gzhan yang thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan yang thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, it follows that everything would be produced at all times.

original: gal te dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: If things were produced causelessly, it follows that everything would be produced at all times.

original: 'bras bu rigs mi mthun pa thams cad kyang skye ba kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu rigs mi mthun pa thams cad kyang skye ba kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and it would follow, absurdly, that all things of a dissimilar type would arise from all things.

original: sogs pa zhes bya bas ni rtsom pa thams cad don med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro zhes @154a * //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya bas ni rtsom pa thams cad don med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro zhes @154a * //
translated: The phrase and so forth includes the fault that all endeavors would be pointless.

original: rnam par bshad pa dag bsdu'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa dag bsdu'o //
translated: This is how the commentary explains it.

original: de ltar dus thams cad du skye ba dang / thams cad las skye ba dang / thams cad skye ba dang / rtsom pa thams cad don med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba de lta bu yang med pas de'i phyir dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba med do zhes 'gog par byed do zhes rnam par bshad pa byed do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar dus thams cad du skye ba dang / thams cad las skye ba dang / thams cad skye ba dang / rtsom pa thams cad don med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba de lta bu yang med pas de'i phyir dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba med do zhes 'gog par byed do zhes rnam par bshad pa byed do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Since there is no such thing as arising at all times, arising from all, arising from everything, or all endeavors being pointless, therefore things do not arise causelessly.

original: gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta ni dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye ba med par sgrub pa'i gnas skabs 'dir de skad ces rnam par bshad pa byed do //
analyzed: gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta ni dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye ba med par sgrub pa'i gnas skabs 'dir de skad ces rnam par bshad pa byed do //
translated: This is how the elder Buddhapalita explains it in this context, where he is proving that things do not arise causelessly.

original: de la yang glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la yang glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, too, he uses the term and so forth because it is a phrase that can be applied to other contexts.

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa bzlog pa'i tshig gi don mngon par 'dod na des 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa bzlog pa'i tshig gi don mngon par 'dod na des 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: If you accept the reversal of the probandum and the proof, then this is what you have taught:

original: dngos po rnams rgyu las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / lan 'ga' kha cig skye bar 'gyur ba dang / rtsom pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid du gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rgyu las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / lan 'ga' kha cig skye bar 'gyur ba dang / rtsom pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid du gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Things arise from causes, some things arise at some times, and undertakings are fruitful.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is not correct,

original: sngar smras pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar smras pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the previously stated error would ensue.

original: ci ste gzhan du na yang don 'brel pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan du na yang don 'brel pa med pa yin te /
translated: If you say that the meaning of the words is not related in any other way,

original: snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: then it is as before. This is the commentary itself.

original: gnas brtan buddha p'a li tas rnam par bshad pa de rigs pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: gnas brtan buddha p'a li tas rnam par bshad pa de rigs pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The elder Buddhapalita's explanation is not correct.

original: de la de la yang zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan buddha p'a li tas rnam par bshad pa de la yang ste /
analyzed: de la de la yang zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan buddha p'a li tas rnam par bshad pa de la yang ste /
translated: In that regard, in that refers to the elder Buddhapalita's explanation.

original: de la yang 'grel pa byed pa 'dis skyon 'di mthong ngo //
analyzed: de la yang 'grel pa byed pa 'dis skyon 'di mthong ngo //
translated: This commentator sees this error in that.

original: glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan buddha p'a li tas rnam par bshad pa de ni rgol ba gzhan gyi klan ka'i glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan buddha p'a li tas rnam par bshad pa de ni rgol ba gzhan gyi klan ka'i glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: â€œBecause it is a statement that provides an opportunity for refutationâ€ means that the explanation of the elder BuddhapaÌ„lita is not correct, because it is a statement that provides an opportunity for refutation by other opponents.

original: ji ltar glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
