translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:ğŸ”½A homogeneous cause is similar.

original: chos 'dra ba rnams ni 'dra ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: chos 'dra ba rnams ni 'dra ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Similar phenomena are homogeneous causes of similar phenomena.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dge ba'i phung po lnga po dag ni phan tshun du dge ba rnams kyi skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: dge ba'i phung po lnga po dag ni phan tshun du dge ba rnams kyi skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: The five virtuous aggregates are homogeneous causes of virtuous phenomena.

original: nyon mongs pa can rnams kyang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can rnams kyang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: Also, afflicted phenomena are homogeneous causes of afflicted phenomena and neutral phenomena are homogeneous causes of neutral phenomena.

original: ci 'dra ba thams cad 'dra ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba thams cad 'dra ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are all similar phenomena homogeneous causes of similar phenomena?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: They are not.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /ğŸ”½chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na / chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las /
translated: What then?

original: rang ris sa pa'o zhes bshad pa ste /
analyzed: rang ris sa pa'o zhes bshad pa ste /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:ğŸ”½They are of the same type and level.

original: rang gi ris dang / rang gi sa pa'i chos 'dra ba rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: rang gi ris dang / rang gi sa pa'i chos 'dra ba rnams kyi ste /
translated: Similar phenomena of the same type and level are homogeneous causes.

original: ris ni lnga ste /
analyzed: ris ni lnga ste /
translated: Type nikÄya is of five types:

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas /
translated: those to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering,ğŸ”½those to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: and those to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: sa ni dgu ste 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa brgyad do //
analyzed: sa ni dgu ste 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa brgyad do //
translated: There are nine levels: the desire realm and the eight levels of absorption and formless states.

original: de la sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan dag gi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan dag gi ni ma yin no //
translated: Those objects abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering are homogeneous causes of those objects abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, but not of others.

original: de bzhin du bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du yang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan dag gi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du yang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan dag gi ni ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, those objects abandoned by the path of meditation are homogeneous causes of those objects abandoned by the path of meditation, but not of others.

original: de dag kyang 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Those that are objects to be abandoned by the desire realm are homogeneous causes of those that are objects to be abandoned by the desire realm,

original: gzhan dag gi ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi ni ma yin la /
translated: but not of others.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa rnams kyang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan dag gi ni ma yin pas na /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa rnams kyang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan dag gi ni ma yin pas na /
translated: Those that are objects to be abandoned by the first absorption are homogeneous causes of those that are objects to be abandoned by the first absorption, but not of others.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa'i bar dag kyang de'i sa pa rnams kho na'i skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan dag gi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa'i bar dag kyang de'i sa pa rnams kho na'i skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan dag gi ni ma yin no //
translated: Also, those of the summit of existence are homogeneous causes of those of the same level alone, but not of others.

original: de dag kyang thams cad ni rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang thams cad ni rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Not all are homogeneous causes.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /ğŸ”½chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na / chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las /
translated: What are they?

original: sngar skyes pa rnams zhes bshad pa ste /
analyzed: sngar skyes pa rnams zhes bshad pa ste /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:

original: sngar skyes pa rnams ni phyi ma bskyed pa dang @158a * //
analyzed: sngar skyes pa rnams ni phyi ma bskyed pa dang @158a * //
translated: Those previously arisen

original: ma skyes pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: ma skyes pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: are homogeneous causes of those later arisenğŸ”½and of those not yet arisen.

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Future states are not homogeneous causes.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las /ğŸ”½mtshungs ldan rgyu ni sems dag dang // sems las byung ba'o zhes bshad pa ste /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las / mtshungs ldan rgyu ni sems dag dang // sems las byung ba'o zhes bshad pa ste /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:ğŸ”½Corresponding causes are minds and mental factors.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
translated: Corresponding causes are minds citta and mental factors caitta.

original: de lta na dus tha dad pa dang / rgyu tha dad pa dang / dmigs pa tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams kyang phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na dus tha dad pa dang / rgyu tha dad pa dang / dmigs pa tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams kyang phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that were so, then it would follow that those arisen from different times, different causes, and different focal objects would also be reciprocally concomitant causes.

original: de rnam par gcad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnam par gcad pa'i phyir /
translated: To eliminate that fault,

original: chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las /
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las /
translated: the treatise on Abhidharma declares:

original: rten mnyam rnams zhes bshad pa ste /
analyzed: rten mnyam rnams zhes bshad pa ste /
translated: Those with the same support.

original: gang dag rten mnyam pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba de dag ni phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gang dag rten mnyam pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba de dag ni phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Those minds and mental factors that have the same support are reciprocally concomitant causes.

original: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa ste /
analyzed: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa ste /
translated: Sameness means undifferentiated.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten mig gi dbang po'i skad cig ma gang yin pa de nyid de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yang yin pa lta bu dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten yid kyi dbang po'i skad cig gang yin pa de nyid kyang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshungs par ldan pa rnams rgyu yin pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten mig gi dbang po'i skad cig ma gang yin pa de nyid de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yang yin pa lta bu dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten yid kyi dbang po'i skad cig gang yin pa de nyid kyang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshungs par ldan pa rnams rgyu yin pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The mind sense faculty that is the basis of mental consciousness is also the basis of the feeling and so on concomitant with it.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yang yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yang yin te /
translated: Any cause that is a coemergent cause is also a concomitant cause,

original: rten dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / dus dang / rdzas mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / dus dang / rdzas mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are similar in being the same basis, object field, aspect, time and substance.

original: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las //
translated: The AbhidharmakoÅ›a declares,

original: kun 'gro zhes bya rang gi sar //
analyzed: kun 'gro zhes bya rang gi sar //
translated: Pervaders are so called in relation to their own level.

original: nyon mongs can gyi sngar kun 'gro //ğŸ”½zhes bshad pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs can gyi sngar kun 'gro // zhes bshad pa ste /
translated: Afflicted states are prior pervasive states.

original: rang gi sa pa'i kun du 'gro ba'i chos sngar byung ba rnams ni nyon mongs pa can chos phyi ma rnams kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i kun du 'gro ba'i chos sngar byung ba rnams ni nyon mongs pa can chos phyi ma rnams kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Pervasive states of one's level that arise prior to afflicted states are the pervasive cause of later afflicted states.

original: de dag kyang sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i lta ba lnga dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i lta ba gnyis dang / sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i the tshom gnyis dang / ma rig pa ma 'dres pa gcig dang /
analyzed: de dag kyang sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i lta ba lnga dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i lta ba gnyis dang / sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i the tshom gnyis dang / ma rig pa ma 'dres pa gcig dang /
translated: Those are the five views abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, the two views abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, the two doubts abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin, and the single unmixed ignorance.

original: ma rig pa mtshungs par ldan pa gcig ste /ğŸ”½phra rgyas bcu gcig po de dag ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa mtshungs par ldan pa gcig ste / phra rgyas bcu gcig po de dag ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu zhes bya ste /
translated: There is also ignorance concomitant with those.

original: rang gi khams la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½rnam @158b par smin pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi khams la dmigs pa'i phyir ro // rnam @158b par smin pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: These eleven negative tendencies are called pervasive causes because they focus on the same realm.

original: chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las /
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is stated in the treatise on Abhidharma:

original: rnam smin rgyu ni mi dge dang // dge ba zag bcas rnams kho na //ğŸ”½zhes bshad pa ste /
analyzed: rnam smin rgyu ni mi dge dang // dge ba zag bcas rnams kho na // zhes bshad pa ste /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is only nonvirtue and contaminated virtue.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni mi dge ba rnams dang / dge ba'i chos zag pa dang bcas pa rnams te /ğŸ”½rnam par smin pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni mi dge ba rnams dang / dge ba'i chos zag pa dang bcas pa rnams te / rnam par smin pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is only nonvirtuous and contaminated virtuous dharmas because they possess karmic maturation.

original: ci'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams rnam par smin pa 'grub par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams rnam par smin pa 'grub par mi byed ce na /
translated: Why do neutral dharmas not generate karmic maturation?

original: stobs chung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: stobs chung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are weak,

original: sa bon rul pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sa bon rul pa bzhin no //
translated: like rotten seeds.

original: ci'i phyir zag pa med pa rnams ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zag pa med pa rnams ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why do uncontaminated dharmas not generate karmic maturation?

original: sred pas mngon par ma brlan pa de'i phyir te /
analyzed: sred pas mngon par ma brlan pa de'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are not moistened by craving,

original: mngon par ma brlan pa'i sa bon drungs po bzhin no //ğŸ”½ldan pa ma yin pa rnams kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon par ma brlan pa'i sa bon drungs po bzhin no // ldan pa ma yin pa rnams kyang ma yin te /
translated: like seeds that are not moistened.ğŸ”½They do not generate karmic maturation because they are not moistened by craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.

original: de dag ni khams gang dang ldan pa'i rnam par smin pa yang mngon par sgrub par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni khams gang dang ldan pa'i rnam par smin pa yang mngon par sgrub par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes to craving.ğŸ”½They are not moistened by craving because they are antidotes

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni chos thams cad do zhes bya ba ni ci rigs par sbyar te /ğŸ”½'di lta ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni chos thams cad do zhes bya ba ni ci rigs par sbyar te / 'di lta ste /
translated: is any object that is suitable.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen ni gzugs yin la /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen ni gzugs yin la /
translated: The objective condition of eye consciousness and its concomitant states is form.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen ni sgra yin /ğŸ”½sna'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs pa dang ldan pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen ni dri yin /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen ni sgra yin / sna'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs pa dang ldan pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen ni dri yin /
translated: The objective condition of ear consciousness and its concomitant states is sound.ğŸ”½The objective condition of nose consciousness and its concomitant states is smell.

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen ni ro yin /
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen ni ro yin /
translated: The objective condition of tongue consciousness and its concomitant states is taste.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen ni reg bya yin /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen ni reg bya yin /
translated: The objective condition of body consciousness and its concomitant states is tactility.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen ni chos thams cad yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen ni chos thams cad yin te /
translated: The objective condition of mental consciousness and its concomitant states is all phenomena.

original: chos gang chos gang gi dmigs pa yin pa de ni nam yang de'i dmigs pa ma yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos gang chos gang gi dmigs pa yin pa de ni nam yang de'i dmigs pa ma yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: No dharma that is the object of a dharma ever ceases to be its object.

original: lan 'ga' dmigs par mi byed du zin kyang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lan 'ga' dmigs par mi byed du zin kyang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Even though it is not always the object of attention, it is called an object because it has the characteristic of being an object.

original: dper na sreg par mi byed kyang bud shing zhes bya ba bzhin no //ğŸ”½de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni sems dang sems las byung ba skyes pa rnams las tha ma ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /ğŸ”½sems dang sems las byung ba 'gag pa la phyogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni ma 'ongs pa skye bar 'dod pa'i phyogs kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dper na sreg par mi byed kyang bud shing zhes bya ba bzhin no // de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni sems dang sems las byung ba skyes pa rnams las tha ma ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te / sems dang sems las byung ba 'gag pa la phyogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni ma 'ongs pa skye bar 'dod pa'i phyogs kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o //
translated: For example, even though it does not burn, it is called fuel.ğŸ”½The condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is the immediately past mind and mental activities, with the exception of the last.ğŸ”½The last mind and mental activities of an Arhat are excluded.

original: tha ma ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las @159a * //ğŸ”½byung ba'i skad cig tha ma ni ma gtogs te /
analyzed: tha ma ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las @159a * //ğŸ”½byung ba'i skad cig tha ma ni ma gtogs te /
translated: The last mind and mental activities of an Arhat are excluded, because they are not followed by similar and immediately antecedent dharmas.

original: dgra bcom pa sems kyi skad cig gang la gnas nas mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa'i tshogs ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin te yang 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½de ma thag pa'i rkyen 'di ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa yang yin la /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa sems kyi skad cig gang la gnas nas mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa'i tshogs ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin te yang 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro // de ma thag pa'i rkyen 'di ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa yang yin la /
translated: The collection of factors that cause the arhat to attain nirvana in the moment of mind in which he or she attains nirvana is not an immediately preceding condition because it does not occur again.ğŸ”½This immediately preceding condition is a similar immediately preceding condition and it is a condition.

original: rkyen kyang yin pas mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rkyen kyang yin pas mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called a similar immediately preceding condition.

original: des na gzugs ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin te mi 'dra bar skye ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½'di ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs kyi mjug thogs su lan 'ga' ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs skye bar 'gyur la /ğŸ”½lan 'ga' ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na gzugs ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin te mi 'dra bar skye ba'i phyir ro // 'di ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs kyi mjug thogs su lan 'ga' ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs skye bar 'gyur la / lan 'ga' ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs skye bar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore form is not a similar immediately preceding condition because it arises dissimilarly.ğŸ”½Thus, for example, form of the desire realm sometimes arises immediately after form of the desire realm, such as when indicative form arises.ğŸ”½Sometimes form of the desire realm arises immediately after form of the desire realm, such as when nonindicative form arises.

original: lan 'ga' ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs zag pa dang bcas pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs zag pa dang bcas pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Sometimes form of the desire realm arises immediately after form of the desire realm that is contaminated.

original: gzugs mngon sum du 'gyur ba ni 'dren ma yin la /
analyzed: gzugs mngon sum du 'gyur ba ni 'dren ma yin la /
translated: The form that is the object of the first moment of visual consciousness is not the homogeneous cause of the second moment of visual consciousness.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni 'dren ma ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni 'dren ma ma yin no //

analyzed: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no zhes 'bras bu dang rkyen phyogs su byas pa las sbyor ba'i tshig gnyis bstan pa bzhin du /
translated: These two syllogisms were taught from the perspective of the effect and the condition.

original: 'dir yang skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa'i dpe ni bum pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir yang skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med pa'i dpe ni bum pa yin la /
translated: Here, a pot is the example of the nonexistence of the arising of the sense bases from other conditions.

original: rkyen rnams rkyen ma yin pa'i dpe ni rgyu spun la sogs pa yin par mngon pas 'bras bu skye mched dang rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa phyogs su byas pa las sbyor ba'i tshig gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkyen rnams rkyen ma yin pa'i dpe ni rgyu spun la sogs pa yin par mngon pas 'bras bu skye mched dang rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa phyogs su byas pa las sbyor ba'i tshig gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is clear that the example of conditions that are not conditions is the cause, such as the threads and so on, the two syllogistic statements are made from the perspective of the effect, the sense bases, and the conditions, such as the oval shape.

original: don dam par mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa rkyen rnams las skye ba med de /
analyzed: don dam par mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa rkyen rnams las skye ba med de /
translated: Ultimately, the sense bases such as the eyes do not arise from conditions such as semen and blood,

original: de dag la med pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'bras @162b bu phyogs su byas pa la sbyor ba'i tshig gcig yin no //
analyzed: de dag la med pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'bras @162b bu phyogs su byas pa la sbyor ba'i tshig gcig yin no //
translated: because they do not exist in them, just like a pot. This is one syllogistic statement made from the perspective of the effect.ğŸ”½Here,

original: 'dir yang / mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams //
analyzed: 'dir yang / mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams //
translated: the sense bases such as the eyes

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /
translated: is the subject.

original: khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa rkyen rnams las skye ba med de zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
analyzed: khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa rkyen rnams las skye ba med de zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
translated: The predicate of the probandum is â€œnot arising from conditions such as semen and blood.â€

original: de dag la med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin //
analyzed: de dag la med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin //
translated: The reason is â€œbecause they do not exist in those.â€

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar te /ğŸ”½dper na bum pa ni mer mer po la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar te / dper na bum pa ni mer mer po la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir /
translated: The example is â€œfor example, like a pot.â€ğŸ”½For example, because a pot does not exist in a glob of clay, it does not arise from a glob of clay.

original: mer mer po la sogs pa las skye ba med pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams kyang rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mer mer po la sogs pa las skye ba med pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams kyang rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, because the sense sources such as the eyes do not exist in conditions such as a glob of clay,

original: de dag kyang don dam par rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa las skye ba med do //
analyzed: de dag kyang don dam par rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa las skye ba med do //
translated: they also do not arise from conditions such as a glob of clay ultimately.

original: de bzhin du don dam par khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa rkyen rnams mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa ma yin te de dag gis stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa rkyen rnams mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa ma yin te de dag gis stong pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, ultimately semen, blood, and so on are not producers of the sense sources such as the eyes because they are empty of them.

original: dper na thag zangs la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni rkyen phyogs su byas pa las sbyor ba'i tshig gnyis pa yin no ;
analyzed: dper na thag zangs la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni rkyen phyogs su byas pa las sbyor ba'i tshig gnyis pa yin no ;
translated: This is the second syllogistic statement, where the conditions are taken as the subject.

original: /'dir yang khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa rkyen rnams zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la //
analyzed: /'dir yang khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa rkyen rnams zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la //
translated: Here, â€œsemen, blood, and so on are the conditionsâ€ is the subject,

original: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
translated: â€œdo not produce the faculties such as the eyesâ€ is the predicate,

original: de dag gis stong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin //
analyzed: de dag gis stong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin //
translated: â€œbecause they are devoid of thoseâ€ is the reason,

original: dper na thag zangs la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar te /
analyzed: dper na thag zangs la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar te /
translated: and â€œjust like a woolen cloth and so onâ€ is the example.

original: dper na thag zangs la sogs pa ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched de dag gis stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na thag zangs la sogs pa ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched de dag gis stong pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, a woolen cloth and so on are devoid of the faculties such as the eyes,

original: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mer mer po la sogs pa rkyen rnams kyang mig la sogs pa skye mched de dag gis stong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mer mer po la sogs pa rkyen rnams kyang mig la sogs pa skye mched de dag gis stong ba'i phyir /
translated: Just as the elements do not produce the sense bases such as the eyes, likewise the conditions such as the kalala do not produce the sense bases such as the eyes because they are empty of those sense bases.ğŸ”½

original: de dag kyang don dam par mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang don dam par mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as the conditions such as the father and mother are not producers of the eyes and so on, in the same way, the conditions such as the kalala are not producers of the eyes and so on, because they are empty of the eyes and so on.ğŸ”½Therefore, the Blessed One has stated that ultimately things are not produced from the four conditions such as the cause.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par dngos po rnams rgyu la sogs pa'i rkyen bzhi po dag las skye ba med par bka' stsal par shes par bya'o zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par dngos po rnams rgyu la sogs pa'i rkyen bzhi po dag las skye ba med par bka' stsal par shes par bya'o zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught by the phrase â€œone should understand that the Blessed One has stated that ultimately things are not produced from the four conditions such as the cause.â€

original: sbyor ba'i tshig de gnyis kyis brtags pa des na /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i tshig de gnyis kyis brtags pa des na /
translated: By these two statements of application,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par dngos po rnams rgyu la sogs pa'i rkyen bzhi po dag las skye ba med par bka' stsal par shes par bya'o zhes mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam par dngos po rnams rgyu la sogs pa'i rkyen bzhi po dag las skye ba med par bka' stsal par shes par bya'o zhes mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: one should understand that the Blessed One has stated that ultimately things are not produced from the four conditions such as the cause. This is the summary.

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis rkyen bzhi po dag ci'i phyir bka' stsal ce na /ğŸ”½de'i phyir rgyu med pa dang rgyu mi mthun par smra bas blo gros @163a * //
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis rkyen bzhi po dag ci'i phyir bka' stsal ce na / de'i phyir rgyu med pa dang rgyu mi mthun par smra bas blo gros @163a * //
translated: Well, why did the Bhagavat state the four conditions?ğŸ”½Therefore, in order to teach the conventional truth just as it is, out ofğŸ”½compassion for people whose minds are confused by the doctrines of

original: dkrugs pa'i skye bo la rjes su thugs brtse bas tha snyad kyi bden pa ji ltar gnas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dkrugs pa'i skye bo la rjes su thugs brtse bas tha snyad kyi bden pa ji ltar gnas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: nihilism and unsuited causes,

original: rgyu dang dmigs pa dang de ma thag pa dang bdag po'i rkyen rnams bka' stsal par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang dmigs pa dang de ma thag pa dang bdag po'i rkyen rnams bka' stsal par shes par bya ste /
translated: it should be understood that the causal condition, the objective condition,ğŸ”½the immediately preceding condition, and the dominant condition were

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: taught.

original: rgyu med par smra bas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i grub pa'i mtha' smra bas so //
analyzed: rgyu med par smra bas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i grub pa'i mtha' smra bas so //
translated: The doctrine of nihilism is the doctrine of the Lokayatas.ğŸ”½The doctrine of unsuited causes is the doctrine of Kapila, Ishvara, and so

original: rgyu mi mthun par smra bas zhes bya ba ni sred med kyi bu dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i grub pa'i mtha' smra bas so //
analyzed: rgyu mi mthun par smra bas zhes bya ba ni sred med kyi bu dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i grub pa'i mtha' smra bas so //
translated: forth.

original: blo gros dkrugs pa'i skye bo zhes bya ba ni skye bo gang gi blo gros zhes bya ba shes rab rgyu med pa dang rgyu mi mthun par smra bas dkrugs shing rmongs par byas par gang yin pa de ni rgyu med pa dang rgyu mi mthun par smra
analyzed: blo gros dkrugs pa'i skye bo zhes bya ba ni skye bo gang gi blo gros zhes bya ba shes rab rgyu med pa dang rgyu mi mthun par smra bas dkrugs shing rmongs par byas par gang yin pa de ni rgyu med pa dang rgyu mi mthun par smra
translated: The one called â€œa person whose mind is disturbedâ€ is a person whose mind, called â€œwisdom,â€ is disturbed and confused by the assertion of causelessness and discordant causes.

original: bas blo gros dkrugs pa'i skye bo zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½rjes su thugs brtse bas zhes bya ba ni skye bo de la bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa rjes su thugs brtse zhing ngan song du 'gro ba las 'dren pa mdzad pa ni rgyu med pa dang rgyu mi mthun par smra bas blo gros dkrugs pa'i skye bo
analyzed: bas blo gros dkrugs pa'i skye bo zhes bya'o // rjes su thugs brtse bas zhes bya ba ni skye bo de la bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa rjes su thugs brtse zhing ngan song du 'gro ba las 'dren pa mdzad pa ni rgyu med pa dang rgyu mi mthun par smra bas blo gros dkrugs pa'i skye bo
translated: He is called â€œa person whose mind is disturbedâ€ because of asserting causelessness and discordant causes.ğŸ”½â€œCompassionâ€ means that the Blessed One ÅšÄkyamuni has compassion for that person and leads them away from going to the lower realms.

original: la rjes su thugs brtse ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: la rjes su thugs brtse ba zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called â€œcompassionateâ€ because of having compassion for a person whose mind is disturbed by asserting causelessness and discordant causes.

original: tha snyad kyi bden pa ji ltar gnas pa bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas kun rdzob kyi bden pa phyi rol dang / nang gi rkyen sa bon dang mer mer po la sogs pa dag las myu gu dang mig la sogs pa skye bar grags pa'i tha snyad ji ltar gnas pa de bstan cing gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi bden pa ji ltar gnas pa bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas kun rdzob kyi bden pa phyi rol dang / nang gi rkyen sa bon dang mer mer po la sogs pa dag las myu gu dang mig la sogs pa skye bar grags pa'i tha snyad ji ltar gnas pa de bstan cing gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to teach the conventional truth as it is, means in order to teach and clarify the conventional truth as it is known from beginningless time, that sprouts and eyes and so on arise from external and internal conditions such as seeds and embryonic stages.

original: rgyu dang dmigs pa dang de ma thag pa dang bdag po'i rkyen rnams bka' stsal par shes par bya ste zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las /
analyzed: rgyu dang dmigs pa dang de ma thag pa dang bdag po'i rkyen rnams bka' stsal par shes par bya ste zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos las /
translated: The causes, objects, immediate conditions, and dominant conditions should be understood as stated, means that they should be understood as stated in the treatise on Abhidharma:

original: bzhi yis sems dang sems byung rnams //
analyzed: bzhi yis sems dang sems byung rnams //
translated: The mind and mental factors arise from four conditions.

original: gsum gyis snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis //
analyzed: gsum gyis snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis //
translated: The two meditative states arise from three.

original: gzhan ni gnyis po dag las skye //
analyzed: gzhan ni gnyis po dag las skye //
translated: The others arise from two.

original: dbang phyug sogs min rim sogs phyir //ğŸ”½zhes bshad pa lta bur shes par bya ste //
analyzed: dbang phyug sogs min rim sogs phyir //ğŸ”½zhes bshad pa lta bur shes par bya ste //
translated: Not from God, etc., because of sequence, etc.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni rgyu'i rkyen dang dmigs pa'i rkyen dang de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang bdag po'i rkyen bzhis skyed par byed do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni rgyu'i rkyen dang dmigs pa'i rkyen dang de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang bdag po'i rkyen bzhis skyed par byed do //
translated: Mind and mental factors are produced by four conditions: causal condition, object condition, immediately preceding condition, and dominant condition.

original: de la 'di dag gi rgyu'i rkyen ni rgyu lnga po thams cad do //
analyzed: de la 'di dag gi rgyu'i rkyen ni rgyu lnga po thams cad do //
translated: Among them, the causal condition is all five causes.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni ci rigs par yul lnga po dag dang chos thams cad do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni ci rigs par yul lnga po dag dang chos thams cad do //
translated: The object condition is the five objects and all dharmas, as appropriate.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni sems dang sems las byung ba snga ma gzhan dag gis bar du mchod pa rnams so //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni sems dang sems las byung ba snga ma gzhan dag gis bar du mchod pa rnams so //
translated: The immediately preceding condition is the former minds and mental factors that are not separated by other minds and mental factors.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad do //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad do //
translated: The dominant condition is all dharmas except for its own nature.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis ni rgyu'i rkyen dang de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang bdag po'i rkyen gsum gyis skyed par byed do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis ni rgyu'i rkyen dang de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang bdag po'i rkyen gsum gyis skyed par byed do //
translated: The two meditative attainmentsâ€”the meditative attainment of cessation and the meditative attainment of nonperceptionâ€”are produced by three conditions: causal condition, immediately preceding condition, and dominant condition.

original: 'di gnyis la dmigs pa'i rkyen @163b ni med de de gnyis ni dmigs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di gnyis la dmigs pa'i rkyen @163b ni med de de gnyis ni dmigs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Neither has an objective condition, because they do not grasp an object.

original: de gnyis kyi rgyu'i rkyen ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis te lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni skye ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi rgyu'i rkyen ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis te lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni skye ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The causal condition of these two is twofold: the coemergent cause is origination, etc.;

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ni sa mtshungs pa'i dge ba'i chos sngar byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ni sa mtshungs pa'i dge ba'i chos sngar byung ba rnams so //
translated: the homogeneous cause is previously arisen virtuous phenomena of the same level.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The immediately preceding condition is the meditative attainment and its concomitant states.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad do //ğŸ”½snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag ni sems kyi mngon par 'du bya ba las skye ba'i phyir sems kyi de ma thag pa dag ni yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad do // snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag ni sems kyi mngon par 'du bya ba las skye ba'i phyir sems kyi de ma thag pa dag ni yin gyi /
translated: The dominant condition is all phenomena except for its own nature.ğŸ”½Since these meditative attainments arise from the manifest karma of the mind, they are immediately preceding the mind.

original: sems skye ba la bgegs byed pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems skye ba la bgegs byed pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not equivalent immediately preceding conditions because they obstruct the arising of the mind.

original: gzhan ldan pa ma yin pa rnams dang gzugs can rnams ni rgyu'i rkyen dang bdag po'i rkyen gnyis las skye'o //
analyzed: gzhan ldan pa ma yin pa rnams dang gzugs can rnams ni rgyu'i rkyen dang bdag po'i rkyen gnyis las skye'o //
translated: and those that are not conjoined and those that are physical arise from two conditions: the causal condition and the dominant condition.

original: dngos po rnams ni ji skad bshad pa'i rgyu dang rkyen rnams kho na las skye ba'i 'gro ba thams cad ni rgyu gcig po dbang phyug dang skyes bu dang gtso bo la sogs pa ni med de /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni ji skad bshad pa'i rgyu dang rkyen rnams kho na las skye ba'i 'gro ba thams cad ni rgyu gcig po dbang phyug dang skyes bu dang gtso bo la sogs pa ni med de /
translated: Things arise from causes and conditions as they have been explained, but there is no single cause of the entire world, such as a divine creator, a person, or primal matter.

original: gal te dbang phyug gam gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug gam gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: If a divine creator or any other single cause were the cause of the world,

original: rgyu gcig pu kho na zhig yin na 'gro ba thams cad cig car du 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na dngos po rnams ni rim gyis 'byung ba la sogs par snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu gcig pu kho na zhig yin na 'gro ba thams cad cig car du 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na dngos po rnams ni rim gyis 'byung ba la sogs par snang ba'i phyir /
translated: then the entire world would arise simultaneously. But things are seen to arise in sequence.

original: rgyu dbang phyug la sogs pa gcig pu ni med do zhes bka' stsal par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dbang phyug la sogs pa gcig pu ni med do zhes bka' stsal par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that the Buddha has stated that there is no single cause of the world, such as a divine creator.

original: de'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa gang yin pa de nyid 'dir yang sbyang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa gang yin pa de nyid 'dir yang sbyang bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the objection that we have stated earlier does not apply to our position.

original: gal te kun rdzob tu rkyen rnams bka' stsal par khas blangs nas kun rdzob nyid du 'gog par byed na ni des na khas blangs pa la gnod par yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob tu rkyen rnams bka' stsal par khas blangs nas kun rdzob nyid du 'gog par byed na ni des na khas blangs pa la gnod par yang 'gyur la /
translated: If you accept that conditions are stated conventionally and then refute them conventionally, then you would undermine your own assertions.

original: de bzhin du don dam par skye bar khas blangs nas don dam pa nyid du skye ba med par sgrub par byed na /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par skye bar khas blangs nas don dam pa nyid du skye ba med par sgrub par byed na /
translated: Similarly, if you accept that arising exists ultimately and then prove that ultimately there is no arising,

original: de lta na yang khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de lta na yang khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then you would undermine your own assertions.

original: kho bos ni kun rdzob tu rkyen rnams bka' stsal pa la don dam par dgag pa dang kun rdzob tu skye ba yod la /
analyzed: kho bos ni kun rdzob tu rkyen rnams bka' stsal pa la don dam par dgag pa dang kun rdzob tu skye ba yod la /
translated: But we state that conditions are stated conventionally and refute them ultimately, and we accept that arising exists conventionally and that ultimately there is no arising.

original: don dam par skye ba med par khas blangs pas de'i phyir khas blangs pa'i gnod pa dang / grags pa'i gnod pa dang / mngon sum gyi gnod pa dang / rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa dang / rang gi tshig gi gnod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam par skye ba med par khas blangs pas de'i phyir khas blangs pa'i gnod pa dang / grags pa'i gnod pa dang / mngon sum gyi gnod pa dang / rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa dang / rang gi tshig gi gnod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore we do not undermine our own assertions, nor do we undermine what is renowned, nor do we undermine direct perception, nor do we undermine inference, nor do we undermine our own words.

original: yang na gzhan du rnam par brtag ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na gzhan du rnam par brtag ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or else, it should be analyzed in another way.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
translated: The nature of things

original: rkyen la sogs pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: rkyen la sogs pa yod ma yin //
translated: does not exist in conditions, etc.

original: bdag gi dngos po yod min na //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po yod min na //
translated: If its own nature does not exist,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po yod ma yin //
translated: the nature of another does not exist.

translated: Those that are imputed by other schools and those imputed by the VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas and so on are different due to having different names, but they are included within those just mentioned due to their characteristics.ğŸ”½Therefore it is said, â€œA fifth condition does not exist.â€

translated: Some Buddhists imagine that the object is produced in front of the mind, and some imagine that it exists or does not exist, and so on. The VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas imagine that the object is the conjunction of two, three, or four subtle particles.

analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas ni de dag la tha dad pa med pas de'i phyir de dag kyang rkyen bzhi po de dag nyid du 'dus so //

original: ji ltar zhes 'dri na de'i phyir //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes 'dri na de'i phyir //
translated: then in response to that,ğŸ”½the root text says,

analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul ltar nus pa rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag nyid do zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo nyid do //

translated: â€œThe collection of common and uncommon causes and cooperative conditionsâ€ means the collection of uncommon and common causes and conditions.

translated: â€œIn othersâ€ means in Narayana, Ishvara, Prajapati, and so on.ğŸ”½â€œIt does not existâ€ means it does not exist.

original: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams kyi ngo bo nyid cha phra ba dang rags pa yongs su btsal na mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams kyi ngo bo nyid cha phra ba dang rags pa yongs su btsal na mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of â€œit is not reasonableâ€ is that it is not reasonable to seek the subtle and gross natures of the faculties such as the eye and so on in the individual conditions and in their collection, in the collection of common and uncommon causes and cooperative conditions, and in others.

analyzed: gang gi tshe ji ltar zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po na re /

translated: The two aspects of the question are: â€œHow is it that it does not exist?â€

analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad dang don dam par ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, he says, â€œIn terms of conventional usage and in terms of the ultimate.â€

translated: This is explained as follows: The subtle aspect of the intrinsic reality of the sense bases does not arise in individual conditions or in their assembly.

analyzed: de'i tshe rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa dag ji ltar gzhan nyid ces brjod par 'gyur te mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: At that time, how could the conditions such as the oval-shaped embryo be called other?

analyzed: ji ltar rkyen rnams la gzhan gyi dngos po gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin zhe na /

analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: de ltar mig la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rkyen rnams kyi gzhan nyid kyi rgyu mtshan dang byed rgyu dang rgyu yin te /

analyzed: de la ltos nas rkyen rnams gzhan du brjod pa'i phyir /

translated: But since the intrinsic reality of the sense spheres does not exist, the reason for saying â€œconditions are otherâ€ does not exist. Therefore conditions are not said to be other.

analyzed: rkyen rnams la gzhan gyi dngos po nyid med pa gang yin pa de ni bden na /

original: 'on kyang mig la sogs pa mer mer po la sogs pa dag las phyis skye bar 'dod pa gang dag yin pa de dag snying la bzhag ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang mig la sogs pa mer mer po la sogs pa dag las phyis skye bar 'dod pa gang dag yin pa de dag snying la bzhag ste /

original: de la ltos nas rkyen rnams gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba dang / bye brag pa dag kyang 'di skad ces mig la sogs pa med kyang gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i yon tan dang ldan pas rkyen rnams kyang gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de gnyis kyi lan du 'dir 'grel pa byedğŸ”½pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de la ltos nas rkyen rnams gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba dang / bye brag pa dag kyang 'di skad ces mig la sogs pa med kyang gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i yon tan dang ldan pas rkyen rnams kyang gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de gnyis kyi lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to those two former positions, the author of the commentary here says:

analyzed: ci ste dngos po skye bar 'dod pa blo la rnam par bzhag nas rkyen de dag gzhan du gyur pa yin te / ltos pa'i dbang gis so zhe'am /
translated: â€œIf you assert that things arise and posit them in the mind, those conditions are different

original: gzhan nyid dang ldan pas so zhes snyad 'dogs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: gzhan nyid dang ldan pas so zhes snyad 'dogs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //

translated: But if you assert that things arise,

original: ce ste chos mngon pa pa dag na re /
analyzed: ce ste chos mngon pa pa dag na re /
translated: If you say, â€œThe Abhidharma masters say that

translated: However, we assert that later, after the eye and so on arise from the kalala and so on, they are different from the conditions that give rise to them,â€ğŸ”½then you are just making up a theory.ğŸ”½If you say, â€œThey are different because they possess difference,â€

translated: the VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas say that even though the eye and so on do not exist, the self exists.

translated: In that regard, the phrase â€œthey possess the quality called â€˜differenceâ€™â€ refers to the quality called â€œdifferenceâ€ among the qualities that are mentioned in the VaiÅ›eá¹£ika philosophical schoolâ€™s doctrine of six categories.

analyzed: rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / bye brag dang / 'du ba'o //

original: rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu ste /

analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus dang / phyogs dang / bdag dang / yid do //

analyzed: yon tan gang zhe na /

analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi ste /

translated: form, sound, smell, taste, tangible object, number, extension, separateness, conjunction, action, possession, space, time, direction, part, whole, otherness, non-otherness, visual cognition,

analyzed: rna ba'i blo dang / sna'i blo dang / lce'i blo dang / lus kyi blo dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / 'dod pa dang / sdang ba dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / byas pa'i shugs dang /
translated: auditory cognition, olfactory cognition, gustatory cognition, tactile cognition, pleasure, pain, desire, hatred, effort, virtue, non-virtue, speed,ğŸ”½and exertion.

original: 'bad pa'o // las gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'bad pa'o // las gang zhe na /
translated: What is action?

original: rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: It is fivefold:

original: 'degs pa dang / 'jog pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang pa dang / 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'degs pa dang / 'jog pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang pa dang / 'gro ba'o //
translated: lifting, lowering, contraction, expansion, and motion.

original: spyi gang zhe na /
analyzed: spyi gang zhe na /

original: yod pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa ste /
translated: It is existence.

original: spyi chen po dang / nyi tshe'i spyi'o //
analyzed: spyi chen po dang / nyi tshe'i spyi'o //

original: bye brag gang zhe na /
analyzed: bye brag gang zhe na /

analyzed: de las bye brag tu dbye ba'o //

original: 'du ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du ba gang zhe na /

original: 'di dang 'dir 'du ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dang 'dir 'du ba'o //
translated: It is the collection of these and those.

original: de ltar bye brag pa'i tshig gi don drug po de dag las /
analyzed: de ltar bye brag pa'i tshig gi don drug po de dag las /
translated: Thus, from among the six categories of the VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas,

analyzed: yon tan nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i nang nas gzhan zhes bya ba de dang ldan pas rkyen rnams kyang gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro zhes snyad 'dogs na'o //
translated: since it is endowed with the other, the conditions are also other.

original: de ni tha snyad tsam du zad de /
analyzed: de ni tha snyad tsam du zad de /
translated: That is mere convention.ğŸ”½Since they do not have an intrinsic reality that is other than those,

analyzed: de dag las gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid med pas zhes bya ba ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: this is what is taught:

analyzed: 'di ltar skye mched kyi ngo bo nyid rkyen rnams las phyis skye bar 'dod pa snying la gzhag ste /
translated: Thus, one should keep in mind that the intrinsic reality of the sense bases is asserted to arise later from the conditions.

analyzed: gal te de la ltos nas rkyen rnams gzhan du 'dod pa dang / bdag nyid ces bya ba'i yon tan dang ldan pas rkyen rnams gzhan dud @166a * //
translated: If one asserts that the conditions are other in reliance on that, and if one asserts that the conditions are other because they are endowed with the quality called self,

analyzed: 'dod na / de lta na de dag gi gzhan nyid ni ltos pas byas pa yin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin pas de ni tha snyad tsam du zad do //
translated: then in that case, their otherness is created by reliance, and since it does not exist by its own intrinsic reality, that is mere convention.

analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni gang ci la yang mi ltos pa ste /
translated: â€œIntrinsic realityâ€ means that which does not depend on anything else.

original: dper na me'i tsha ba nyid lta bu yin pas de'i phyir gal te skye mched phyis skye bar 'dod pa rnams dang gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i yon tan la ma ltos par rkyen rnams la gzhan zhes bya ba yod par gyur na ni des na rkyen de dag
analyzed: dper na me'i tsha ba nyid lta bu yin pas de'i phyir gal te skye mched phyis skye bar 'dod pa rnams dang gzhan nyid ces bya ba'i yon tan la ma ltos par rkyen rnams la gzhan zhes bya ba yod par gyur na ni des na rkyen de dag
translated: For example, it is like the heat of fire. Therefore, if you assert that the sense bases arise later and that conditions have a different intrinsic reality that does not depend on the quality called difference, then those conditions

analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis gzhan yin no zhes bya bar gzung du yang rung ba zhig na /

original: rkyen de dag ngo bo nyid kyis gzhan gyi dngos po nyid med pas des na rkyen rnams la gzhan gyi dngos po yod par gzung du mi rung ngo //

translated: But since those conditions do not have a different intrinsic reality, it is not tenable to apprehend them as having a different intrinsic reality.ğŸ”½You should not cling to this.

original: 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir rkyen rnams la gzhan gyi dngos po yod par 'dod pa'i phyogs 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir rkyen rnams la gzhan gyi dngos po yod par 'dod pa'i phyogs 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: You should not cling to this position that asserts that conditions have a different intrinsic reality.

original: ci ste 'dir pha rol po na re /
analyzed: ci ste 'dir pha rol po na re /
translated: Here, an opponent might say,

analyzed: khyod kyis tha snyad du rkyen rnams gzhan nyid du khas blangs pas de'i phyir rkyen rnams gzhan nyid du grub pas gzhan las skye ba yang grub po zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: The author of the commentary here responds to this former opponentâ€™s position from within:

original: tha snyad du gzhan nyid yod du zin kyang don dam par de las skye ba med par sngar bstan to zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: tha snyad du gzhan nyid yod du zin kyang don dam par de las skye ba med par sngar bstan to zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: â€œEven if difference existed conventionally, arising from other does not exist ultimately. This was taught earlier.â€

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught by the following.

original: 'di ltar kho bo la kun rdzob tu skye mched rnams dang ; rkyen rnams phan tshun gzhan nyid yod du zin kyang don dam par rkyen de dag las mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams skye ba med par sngar gzhan las skye ba med par sgrub pa'i skabs su bstan zin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo la kun rdzob tu skye mched rnams dang ; rkyen rnams phan tshun gzhan nyid yod du zin kyang don dam par rkyen de dag las mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams skye ba med par sngar gzhan las skye ba med par sgrub pa'i skabs su bstan zin te /
translated: Thus, although in conventional terms the sense sources and the conditions do exist as different from each other, in ultimate truth the sense sources such as the eyes do not arise from those conditions. This was taught earlier in the section that proves that arising from other does not exist.

original: don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med de /
analyzed: don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med de /
translated: Ultimately, the internal sense sources do not arise from other conditions because

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: they are different, like a vase.

original: yang na don dam par gzhan brjod pa 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na don dam par gzhan brjod pa 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, ultimately, those who assert that the internal sense sources such as the eyes are produced from other conditions are definitely not conditions because they are different.

original: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: For example, this is like the conditions of thread and so on that are the causes of cloth.

original: grangs can dag phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: grangs can dag phyir zlog par byed de /
translated: The SÄá¹ƒkhyas respond:

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ni rkyen rnams la cha phra pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na yin na de yang phyis gsal bar byed par khas blangs pas /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ni rkyen rnams la cha phra pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho na yin na de yang phyis gsal bar byed par khas blangs pas /
translated: The nature of things exists in a subtle form in the conditions themselves, and we assert that it is later made clear.

original: 'bras bu gsal bar ma gyur kyang rkyen rnams gzhan nyid du grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu gsal bar ma gyur kyang rkyen rnams gzhan nyid du grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though the result is not yet clear, the conditions are established as other.

original: de ni mi gnod do zhe na /
analyzed: de ni mi gnod do zhe na /
translated: Therefore this is not a fault.

original: zhes bya ba 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni sngar dbu ma pas rkyen rnams la mig la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid cha phra mo yang med @166b pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni sngar dbu ma pas rkyen rnams la mig la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid cha phra mo yang med @166b pas /
translated: The meaning of this verse is as follows: Previously, the Madhyamika said that since the conditions have not even the slightest intrinsic reality of eyes and so on,

original: des na gzhan nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na gzhan nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: therefore, since they are not different,

original: gzhan las skye ba yang med do //
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba yang med do //
translated: there is no arising from other.

original: zhes smras pa nye bar thos nas /
analyzed: zhes smras pa nye bar thos nas /
translated: Having heard this,

original: 'dir grangs can dag las /
analyzed: 'dir grangs can dag las /
translated: here the SÄá¹ƒkhya

original: gsal bar smra ba dag phyir rgol ba nyid du gnas par byed de /
analyzed: gsal bar smra ba dag phyir rgol ba nyid du gnas par byed de /
translated: remain as opponents.

original: gang dag gi phyogs la ngo bo nyid cha phra ba yang med pa de dag gi phyogs la ni sun dbyung ba 'di rigs kyi /
analyzed: gang dag gi phyogs la ngo bo nyid cha phra ba yang med pa de dag gi phyogs la ni sun dbyung ba 'di rigs kyi /
translated: For those who have no position of even the slightest intrinsic reality, this refutation is appropriate.

original: kho bo ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa la cha phra ba'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho nar khas len te /
analyzed: kho bo ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa la cha phra ba'i bdag nyid du yod pa kho nar khas len te /
translated: But we accept that the intrinsic reality of things exists in the subtle nature of the conditions such as the sprout.

original: dper na shing n+ya gro dha'i sa bon gyi nang na yang rtsa ba dang / sdong bo dang / yal ga dang / yal ga phra mo skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa yod pa lta bu yin la /
analyzed: dper na shing n+ya gro dha'i sa bon gyi nang na yang rtsa ba dang / sdong bo dang / yal ga dang / yal ga phra mo skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa yod pa lta bu yin la /
translated: For example, it is like the fact that even within the seed of a banyan tree, the root, trunk, branches, leaves, and so on are present.

original: de yang phyis gsal bar byed par kho bos khas blangs pas /
analyzed: de yang phyis gsal bar byed par kho bos khas blangs pas /
translated: And since I accept that they are later made evident,

original: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa 'bras bu re zhig gsal bar ma gyur du zin kyang de dag gi ngo bo nyid cha phra ba'i bdag nyid du snga na yod pa de la ltos nas rkyen rnams la gzhan nyid yod pas de'i phyir kho bo cag gsal bar
analyzed: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa 'bras bu re zhig gsal bar ma gyur du zin kyang de dag gi ngo bo nyid cha phra ba'i bdag nyid du snga na yod pa de la ltos nas rkyen rnams la gzhan nyid yod pas de'i phyir kho bo cag gsal bar
translated: therefore, although the effects such as the eyes and so on are not yet evident, in dependence on the prior existence of their nature in the form of subtle parts, the conditions exist as other.

original: spra ba rnams la ni gzhan las skye bar rigs pas ;
analyzed: spra ba rnams la ni gzhan las skye bar rigs pas ;
translated: Therefore, it is logical that the subtle parts arise from other.

original: khyed kyis gzhan las skye ba med par bshad pa de mi gnod kyi /
analyzed: khyed kyis gzhan las skye ba med par bshad pa de mi gnod kyi /
translated: Therefore, your explanation that things do not arise from other is not undermined.

original: 'bras bu med par smra ba gzhan dag la ni gnod do zhes zer ba yin no //ğŸ”½de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: 'bras bu med par smra ba gzhan dag la ni gnod do zhes zer ba yin no // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: But it does undermine the other who propound that effects do not exist.

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: That is not good, etc.

original: 'di ni 'grel pa byed pas gsal bar smra ba dag sun 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'grel pa byed pas gsal bar smra ba dag sun 'byin par byed do //
translated: This is the commentary writerâ€™s refutation of those who speak clearly.

original: 'jig rten na grags pa bum pa la sogs pa dag gi bdag nyid cha phra ba bstan par dka' ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni 'di skad bstan te /ğŸ”½khyod ji ltar 'jim pa dang rgyu spun dang rtsi rkyang la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: 'jig rten na grags pa bum pa la sogs pa dag gi bdag nyid cha phra ba bstan par dka' ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni 'di skad bstan te / khyod ji ltar 'jim pa dang rgyu spun dang rtsi rkyang la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na /
translated: Because it is difficult to demonstrate the subtle nature of such things as pots that are renowned in the world, etc.ğŸ”½This is taught as follows:ğŸ”½How can you demonstrate that the subtle nature of such things as pots, cloth, and blankets exists in the state of clay, yarn, and reeds, etc.,

original: bum pa dang / snam bu dang sab ma la sogs pa dag gi bdag nyid cha phra ba yod pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yang bstan par mi nus na don dam par lta smos kyang ci dgos na /
analyzed: bum pa dang / snam bu dang sab ma la sogs pa dag gi bdag nyid cha phra ba yod pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yang bstan par mi nus na don dam par lta smos kyang ci dgos na /
translated: if you cannot demonstrate it even conventionally? What need is there to mention demonstrating it ultimately?

original: de'i phyir dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ni rkyen rnams la cha phra ba'i bdag nyid du yang med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ni rkyen rnams la cha phra ba'i bdag nyid du yang med pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore the nature of things does not exist in the conditions in the slightest as a subtle nature.

original: gsal ba'i lan yang btab zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir khyod kyi gsal ba ni lan du ma bkag zin na /
analyzed: gsal ba'i lan yang btab zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir khyod kyi gsal ba ni lan du ma bkag zin na /
translated: Since you have already refuted clarity many times,

original: yang ci'i phyir gleng bar byed de /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gleng bar byed de /
translated: why would you bring it up again?

original: de'i phyir phyis gsal bar byed par khas blangs pa de yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyis gsal bar byed par khas blangs pa de yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is also illogical to accept that clarity is later.ğŸ”½Others apart from the Samkhyas,

original: grangs can dag las gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni nus pa smra ba dang / ther zug tu gnas par smra ba dag na re 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //ğŸ”½gal te 'bras @167a * //
analyzed: grangs can dag las gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni nus pa smra ba dang / ther zug tu gnas par smra ba dag na re 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro // gal te 'bras @167a * //
translated: those who assert potency and those who assert permanence, say this.

original: bu'i nus pas stong pa'i rkyen gzhan dag las 'bras bu skye ba med par sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub po zhes bya ba ni nus pa smra ba dag na re /
analyzed: bu'i nus pas stong pa'i rkyen gzhan dag las 'bras bu skye ba med par sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub po zhes bya ba ni nus pa smra ba dag na re /
translated: If you prove that an effect does not arise from conditions that are empty of the potency for the effect, then you are proving what is already established.ğŸ”½Those who assert potency say this.

original: gal te dbu ma pa khyed 'bras bu mig la sogs pa'i skye mched dang myu gu'i nus pas stong pa'i rkyen rgyu spun la sogs pa gzhan dag las 'bras bu mig la sogs pa'i skye mched dang / myu gu skye ba med par sgrub na ni de lta na khyod kyi dam bcas pa de ni grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dbu ma pa khyed 'bras bu mig la sogs pa'i skye mched dang myu gu'i nus pas stong pa'i rkyen rgyu spun la sogs pa gzhan dag las 'bras bu mig la sogs pa'i skye mched dang / myu gu skye ba med par sgrub na ni de lta na khyod kyi dam bcas pa de ni grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: If you Madhyamikas prove that the effect, the sense faculties such as the eye, and the sprout are not produced from other conditions such as the causal factors, the seed, which are empty of the capacity to produce the effect, the sense faculties such as the eye, and the sprout, then your thesis would be a fault of proving what is already established.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu mig la sogs pa'i skye mched dang myu gu'i nus bas stong pa'i rkyen rgyu spun la sogs pa gzhan dag las 'bras bu mig la sogs pa'i skye mched dang myu gu skye ba med par ni 'jig rten thams cad la yang grub pa'i phyir
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu mig la sogs pa'i skye mched dang myu gu'i nus bas stong pa'i rkyen rgyu spun la sogs pa gzhan dag las 'bras bu mig la sogs pa'i skye mched dang myu gu skye ba med par ni 'jig rten thams cad la yang grub pa'i phyir
translated: For the fact that the effect, the sense faculties such as the eye, and the sprout are not produced from other conditions, the causal factors such as the seed, which are empty of the capacity to produce the effect, the sense faculties such as the eye, and the sprout, is established for the entire world.

original: ro zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: ro zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: This is what you say.

original: 'on te skye ba med pa kho na'o zhe na ni /
analyzed: 'on te skye ba med pa kho na'o zhe na ni /
translated: But if you say that they are not produced at all,
