translated: we refute arising in all ways, whether or not things are empty of the capacity for results in the ultimate.ğŸ”½â€œBecause we refute arising in all ways

original: gang gi phyir kho bos dngos po rnams gtso bo dang dus dang gzhan gang las kyang skye ba med par khas blangs pas dngos po ma skyes pa ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang yod pa nyid ma yin pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kho bos dngos po rnams gtso bo dang dus dang gzhan gang las kyang skye ba med par khas blangs pas dngos po ma skyes pa ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang yod pa nyid ma yin pas /
translated: Because we accept that things are not produced from a primal substance, time, or anything else, and because a non-produced thing does not exist even conventionally,

original: de'i phyir ma skyes pa la ni ther zug tu gnas pa @167b med pas des na de yang bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma skyes pa la ni ther zug tu gnas pa @167b med pas des na de yang bzang po ma yin no //
translated: therefore, since a non-produced thing does not endure eternally, that is also not good.

original: gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pa dag nyid lung tsam gyis skye ba ma grub pas de'i phyir brda sprod pa'i tham lag gi rjes su zhugs nas rnam pa gzhan gyis skye ba sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pa dag nyid lung tsam gyis skye ba ma grub pas de'i phyir brda sprod pa'i tham lag gi rjes su zhugs nas rnam pa gzhan gyis skye ba sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Others say that because production is not established by mere scripture, they establish production in another way, following the rules of grammar.

original: rkyen rnams kho na 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di la mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi gnas las skye'o //
analyzed: rkyen rnams kho na 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di la mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi gnas las skye'o //
translated: Conditions do not produce effects. The eye consciousness arises from the eye faculty.

original: gnas yod du zin kyang yul med na mi skye'o //
analyzed: gnas yod du zin kyang yul med na mi skye'o //
translated: Even if the faculty exists, it does not arise if the object does not exist.

original: yul yong du zin kyang mun khrod du mi skye'o //
analyzed: yul yong du zin kyang mun khrod du mi skye'o //
translated: Even if the object is present, the visual consciousness does not arise in the dark.

original: snang ba yod du zin kyang rtsig pa la sogs pas bsgribs pa'i gzugs la mi skye'o //
analyzed: snang ba yod du zin kyang rtsig pa la sogs pas bsgribs pa'i gzugs la mi skye'o //
translated: Even if there is light, the visual consciousness does not arise with respect to a form obscured by a wall, etc.ğŸ”½Even if there is space, the visual consciousness does not arise if there is no desire to see.

original: nam mkha' yod du zin kyang lta 'dod pa med na mi skye bas de'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rkyen ni mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed ba rnams yin mod kyi /
analyzed: nam mkha' yod du zin kyang lta 'dod pa med na mi skye bas de'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rkyen ni mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed ba rnams yin mod kyi /
translated: Thus, the conditions for the arising of the visual consciousness are the eye, form, light, space, and mental attention.

original: 'on kyang rkyen de rnams kho nas 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rkyen de rnams kho nas 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: But the visual consciousness is not produced by those conditions alone.ğŸ”½In this way, the activity of producing consciousness is possessed by the conditions, the eye, form, light, space, and mental attention. It is produced by them, it is said, because it is possessed of the conditions.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyi rkyen dang ldan pas de bskyed par 'dod do zhes bya ba 'di la brda sprod pa las ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen rjod par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyi rkyen dang ldan pas de bskyed par 'dod do zhes bya ba 'di la brda sprod pa las ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen rjod par byed de /
translated: The meaning of possession is expressed by the suffix in the term â€œpossessed of conditions.â€

original: dper na bud med 'di gzugs dang ldan pas de'i phyir gzugs can ma zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba yang mig dang gzugs dang ; snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyi rkyen dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na bud med 'di gzugs dang ldan pas de'i phyir gzugs can ma zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba yang mig dang gzugs dang ; snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyi rkyen dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: That action possessing conditions is the condition of the eye, form, light, space, and attention.

original: bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa des 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa de skyed par 'dod do //
analyzed: bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa des 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa de skyed par 'dod do //
translated: We assert that action possessing conditions generates the effect, eye consciousness.

original: kho bo cag gis de yang yod par smra bar nus te zhes bya ba ni bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa de yang yod par smra bar nus te zhes dam 'cha' ba yin no ;ğŸ”½/ don dam par rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis de yang yod par smra bar nus te zhes bya ba ni bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa de yang yod par smra bar nus te zhes dam 'cha' ba yin no ; / don dam par rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: We can assert that action possessing conditions exists.

original: rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: The action of generating consciousness ultimately generates its effect because it possesses conditions.

original: dper na 'bras chan 'tshed pa'i bya ba phru ba dang / chu dang 'bras thug po che dang / me dang bud shing gi rkyen rnams kyi rkyen dang ldan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na 'bras chan 'tshed pa'i bya ba phru ba dang / chu dang 'bras thug po che dang / me dang bud shing gi rkyen rnams kyi rkyen dang ldan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, the action of cooking rice is endowed with conditions such as the pot, water, rice, fire, and fuel.

original: 'dir yang rnam par shes ba bskyed pa'i bya ba zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: 'dir yang rnam par shes ba bskyed pa'i bya ba zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /
translated: Here, the action of generating consciousness is the subject.

original: rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
analyzed: rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
translated: The predicate of the probandum is â€œit generates its own effect.â€

original: rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /ğŸ”½dper na 'bras chan 'tshed pa'i bya ba phru ba dang chu dang 'bras thug po che dang me dang bud shing gi rkyen rnams kyi rkyen dang ldan pa bzhin no zhes bya @168a * //
analyzed: rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin / dper na 'bras chan 'tshed pa'i bya ba phru ba dang chu dang 'bras thug po che dang me dang bud shing gi rkyen rnams kyi rkyen dang ldan pa bzhin no zhes bya @168a * //
translated: The reason is â€œbecause it is endowed with conditions.â€

original: ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar te /
analyzed: ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar te /
translated: The example is â€œfor example, the action of cooking rice is endowed with conditions such as the pot, water, rice, fire, and fuel.â€

original: dper na 'bras chan 'tshed pa'i bya ba phru ba dang / chu dang / 'bras thug po che dang / me dang / bud shing gi rkyen rnams kyi rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na 'bras chan 'tshed pa'i bya ba phru ba dang / chu dang / 'bras thug po che dang / me dang / bud shing gi rkyen rnams kyi rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, the action of cooking rice is endowed with the conditions of the pot, water, rice, fire, and fuel.

original: rang gi 'bras bu 'bras can skyed par byed pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba yang mig dang / gzugs dang ; snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyi rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir don dam par rang gi 'bras bu rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi 'bras bu 'bras can skyed par byed pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba yang mig dang / gzugs dang ; snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyi rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir don dam par rang gi 'bras bu rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: Because the action of producing consciousness is endowed with the conditions of the eye, form, light, space, and attention, it is ultimately the producer of its effect, consciousness.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa sngar smras pa rnams rtog gi phyi mas gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu pa yin te /ğŸ”½ji skad smras pa'i tshad ma des na dbu ma pas rjes su dpag pa sngar smras pa 'di lta ste /

original: don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med de /
analyzed: don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med de /
translated: Ultimately, the internal sense spheres do not arise from other conditions,

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: because they are other, like a pot.

original: yang na don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod pa mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /

analyzed: de skad ces zer bde'i lan du slob dpon nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /

translated: This is what is taught.

original: 'di ltar bya ba yod pa nyid du 'bras bu rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba skye bas bsgrub par bya ba yin na 'bras bu rnam par shes pa de yod pa'am med pa zhig bya ba rkyen dang ldan pas skyed par byed grang na de yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ba yod pa nyid du 'bras bu rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba skye bas bsgrub par bya ba yin na 'bras bu rnam par shes pa de yod pa'am med pa zhig bya ba rkyen dang ldan pas skyed par byed grang na de yang /
translated: If the existence of the action were established by the arising of the so-called effect, consciousness, then would the existent or nonexistent effect consciousness be generated by the action possessing conditions?ğŸ”½But that is not tenable

original: med dam yod pa'i don la yang //ğŸ”½rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //ğŸ”½med na gang gi rkyen zhes bya //
analyzed: med dam yod pa'i don la yang // rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te // med na gang gi rkyen zhes bya //
translated: For a nonexistent or existent object.ğŸ”½If it is nonexistent, what would be a condition?

original: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
translated: If it is existent, what would a condition do?

original: zhes phyis 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes phyis 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because this will be refuted later.

original: 'bras bu rnam par shes pa yod na ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par shes pa yod na ni /
translated: If the effect, consciousness, exists,

original: bya bas yang bskyed mi dgos la /
analyzed: bya bas yang bskyed mi dgos la /
translated: it need not be generated again by action.

original: 'bras bu rnam par shes pa med pa nam mkha'i me tog lta bu yin na ni gzhi med pa'i phyir bya ba nyid kyang med pas bya ba rnam par shes pa skyes pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par shes pa med pa nam mkha'i me tog lta bu yin na ni gzhi med pa'i phyir bya ba nyid kyang med pas bya ba rnam par shes pa skyes pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
translated: If the effect, consciousness, is like a sky flower, which does not exist, then it has no basis, and since activity itself does not exist, activity is not the condition that gives rise to consciousness.

original: don dam par de skad brjod na ni bya ba ma skyes pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: don dam par de skad brjod na ni bya ba ma skyes pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: If you say that in an ultimate sense, the meaning of the reason is not established because activity has not arisen, this is what is being said:

original: gal te don dam par rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyi rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te don dam par rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyi rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: If you say that in an ultimate sense, the activity that gives rise to consciousness is the condition of the eye, form, light, space, and mental activity, and because of that,

original: rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin no zhes de skad brjod na ni de lta na bya ba ma skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin no zhes de skad brjod na ni de lta na bya ba ma skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: it gives rise to its own effect, then in that case, because activity has not arisen,

original: khyod kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: khyod kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: the meaning of your reason is not established.

original: 'di ltar don dam par rnam par shes pa nyid ma skyes pa'i phyir bya ba'i gzhi med pas bya ba yang ma skyes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam par rnam par shes pa nyid ma skyes pa'i phyir bya ba'i gzhi med pas bya ba yang ma skyes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, ultimately consciousness itself is not produced, and since the basis of action does not exist, action is also not produced.

original: dper na bdag ni khyab bdag yin te thams cad du bde ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de'i bdag ma grub pas /
analyzed: dper na bdag ni khyab bdag yin te thams cad du bde ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de'i bdag ma grub pas /
translated: For example, someone says, â€œI am the lord of all because I am happy everywhere.â€ Since the self is not established,

original: gzhi med pa'i khyab bdag kyang med pas thams cad du bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: gzhi med pa'i khyab bdag kyang med pas thams cad du bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin pa bzhin du /
translated: the lord of all, who is without a basis, does not exist. Therefore, the meaning of the reason, â€œbecause I am happy everywhere,â€ is not established.

original: 'dir yang don dam par rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir yang don dam par rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, here, ultimately consciousness does not exist.

original: gzhi ma grub pas bya ba yang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhi ma grub pas bya ba yang med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the basis is not established, action also does not exist.

original: bya ba rkyen dang ldan pas rang gi 'bras bu bskyed de zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bya ba rkyen dang ldan pas rang gi 'bras bu bskyed de zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason, â€œbecause action that possesses conditions generates its own effect,â€ is not established.

original: spyir de skad brjod na yang 'gal ba'i don de nyid de /
analyzed: spyir de skad brjod na yang 'gal ba'i don de nyid de /
translated: In general, although it is said in that way, the meaning of the contradiction is this.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bdag @169a nyid bskyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa nyid ni kun rdzob kyi shes pa'i yul yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bdag @169a nyid bskyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa nyid ni kun rdzob kyi shes pa'i yul yin te /
translated: The activity of generating the identity of consciousness that possesses conditions is the object of conventional consciousness.ğŸ”½Because it is not the case that it does not arise.

original: med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: gal te pha rol po 'di skad ces dbu ma pa ni rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa kun rdzob tu khas len la /
analyzed: gal te pha rol po 'di skad ces dbu ma pa ni rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa kun rdzob tu khas len la /
translated: If the opponent says, â€œThe Followers of the Middle Way accept the activity of generating consciousness that possesses conditions on the conventional level.

original: kho bo cag ni don dam par khas len pas de'i phyir gnyi ga la gtan tshigs kyi don grub par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni don dam par khas len pas de'i phyir gnyi ga la gtan tshigs kyi don grub par 'gyur bas /
translated: We accept it on the ultimate level. Therefore the meaning of the reason is established for both of us.

original: de'i phyir don dam par rnam par shes ba bskyed pa'i bya ba mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyi rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin no zhes spyir de skad brjod na yang de lta na khyod kyi gtan tshigs kyi don rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de 'gal ba'i don nyid
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par rnam par shes ba bskyed pa'i bya ba mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyi rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin no zhes spyir de skad brjod na yang de lta na khyod kyi gtan tshigs kyi don rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de 'gal ba'i don nyid
translated: Therefore, in the ultimate sense, the eye, form, light, space, and mental activity are conditions that possess the activity of generating consciousness, and they are the causes that produce their own effects.ğŸ”½Although this is generally the way you would express it, in that case your reason, â€œbecause they possess the conditions,â€ is contradictory.

original: yin te / 'di ltar khyed kho bo cag dbu ma pa la grags pa'i gtan tshigs kun rdzob par 'dod pas des na rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid bskyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa nyid ni kun rdzob kyi shes pa'i gzung ba'i yul yin te /
analyzed: yin te / 'di ltar khyed kho bo cag dbu ma pa la grags pa'i gtan tshigs kun rdzob par 'dod pas des na rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid bskyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa nyid ni kun rdzob kyi shes pa'i gzung ba'i yul yin te /
translated: This is because you assert that the reason, which is accepted by us MÄdhyamikas, is conventional. Therefore the activity of generating the nature of consciousness that possesses the conditions is the object apprehended by conventional consciousness.

original: des don dam par rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pas rang gi 'bras bu bskyed par sgrub pa ni 'gal ba'i don nyid yin no //
analyzed: des don dam par rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pas rang gi 'bras bu bskyed par sgrub pa ni 'gal ba'i don nyid yin no //
translated: The statement â€œbecause the activity of producing consciousness is possessed by the conditionsâ€ establishes that the conditions produce their effect. This is contradictory.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is impossible for it not to exist.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid bskyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa nyid ces bya ba dang / kun rdzob kyi shes pa'i yul yin te zhes bya ba de gnyis ni med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid bskyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa nyid ces bya ba dang / kun rdzob kyi shes pa'i yul yin te zhes bya ba de gnyis ni med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel ba'i phyir te /
translated: The statement â€œthe activity of producing the nature of consciousness is possessed by the conditionsâ€ and the statement â€œit is the object of conventional consciousnessâ€ are related by the characteristic of being impossible for it not to exist.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid bskyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa nyid ces bya ba med na yang kun rdzob kyi shes pa'i yul yin te zhes bya ba mi 'byung la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid bskyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa nyid ces bya ba med na yang kun rdzob kyi shes pa'i yul yin te zhes bya ba mi 'byung la /
translated: If the statement â€œthe activity of producing the nature of consciousness is possessed by the conditionsâ€ does not exist, the statement â€œit is the object of conventional consciousnessâ€ does not occur.

original: kun rdzob kyi shes pa'i yul yin te zhes bya ba med na yang rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid bskyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa nyid ces bya ba mi 'byung ste /ğŸ”½dper na me med na du ba mi 'byung la /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi shes pa'i yul yin te zhes bya ba med na yang rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid bskyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa nyid ces bya ba mi 'byung ste / dper na me med na du ba mi 'byung la /
translated: If the object of conventional consciousness did not exist, the activity of generating the nature of consciousness would not be a condition.ğŸ”½For example, if fire does not exist, smoke does not exist.

original: du ba med na yang me mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid lta bus 'brel pa yin pas /
analyzed: du ba med na yang me mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid lta bus 'brel pa yin pas /
translated: And if smoke does not exist, fire does not exist.

original: 'dir yang rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid bskyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa nyid ni kun rdzob kyi shes pa'i yul nyid du sgrub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir yang rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid bskyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa nyid ni kun rdzob kyi shes pa'i yul nyid du sgrub pa yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, the activity of generating the nature of consciousness that is a condition is established as the object of conventional consciousness.

original: don dam pa'i shes pa'i yul nyid du sgrub pa ma yin pas des na khyod don dam par rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin no zhes zer ba'i 'dod pa nyams pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam pa'i shes pa'i yul nyid du sgrub pa ma yin pas des na khyod don dam par rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin no zhes zer ba'i 'dod pa nyams pa'i phyir /
translated: But it is not established as the object of ultimate consciousness. Therefore, since your assertion that ultimately the activity of generating consciousness is a condition and thus it generates its own effect is undermined,

original: 'gal ba'i don nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i don nyid yin no //
translated: it has the meaning of contradiction.

original: 'di la gzhan ni gzhan gyi dngos po rnams bdag @169b dang gzhan la sogs pa las skye skye'o zhes bya ba 'dis kho bo cag la ci bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la gzhan ni gzhan gyi dngos po rnams bdag @169b dang gzhan la sogs pa las skye skye'o zhes bya ba 'dis kho bo cag la ci bya ste /
translated: What can we do if others say that things arise from self, from another, and so on?

original: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i rkyen yin te /
translated: In this regard, the eye and so on are conditions that generate the eye consciousness,ğŸ”½just as a pot and so on are the action of cooking.

original: dper na phru ba la sogs pa 'tshed pa'i bya ba yin pa bzhin no zhes dngos po skye bar bstan pa de dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na phru ba la sogs pa 'tshed pa'i bya ba yin pa bzhin no zhes dngos po skye bar bstan pa de dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: To refute the teaching that things arise in this way, the root text states:

original: bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin //ğŸ”½zhes bya 'di gsungs te ;
analyzed: bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin // zhes bya 'di gsungs te ;
translated: An action does not possess conditions.

original: rnam par shes pa skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / skye ba'i tshe la rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad pa byed do zhes bya ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / skye ba'i tshe la rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad pa byed do zhes bya ni /
translated: The Commentary explains that this is because it is untenable that consciousness that has arisen, has not arisen, or is in the process of arising possesses the action of generating consciousness.

original: bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin //
analyzed: bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin //
translated: An action does not possess conditions.

original: zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba dang po 'di rnam par bshad pa'i skabs 'di la 'grel pa byed pa slob dpon buddha p'a li ta ni 'di skad du rnam par bshad pa byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba dang po 'di rnam par bshad pa'i skabs 'di la 'grel pa byed pa slob dpon buddha p'a li ta ni 'di skad du rnam par bshad pa byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the first verse of the root text, which the commentator BuddhapÄlita explains in this commentary.

original: de la 'di la zhes bya ba ni /ğŸ”½bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin //
analyzed: de la 'di la zhes bya ba ni / bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin //
translated: Here means

original: zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba dang po 'di rnam par bshad pa'i skabs 'di la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba dang po 'di rnam par bshad pa'i skabs 'di la'o //
translated: in this context of explaining the first verse of the root text,ğŸ”½which states, â€œAn action does not possess conditions.â€

original: gzhan ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bstan bcos 'di'i 'grel pa byed pa phal las gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bstan bcos 'di'i 'grel pa byed pa phal las gzhan pa ste /
translated: The word â€œelsewhereâ€ refers to someone other than the majority of commentators on this treatise,

original: gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta dang sbyar ro //
translated: namely the elder BuddhapÄlita.

original: gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba dang po 'di'i rnam par bshad pa byed 'dod pas dang por phyogs snga ma smras pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba dang po 'di'i rnam par bshad pa byed 'dod pas dang por phyogs snga ma smras pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The elder BuddhapÄlita, wishing to explain the first verse of the root text, first states the opponentâ€™s position as follows.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po rnams bdag dang gzhan la sogs pa las skye'o zhes bya ba 'dis kho bo cag la ci bya ste /ğŸ”½'di ltar mig la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po rnams bdag dang gzhan la sogs pa las skye'o zhes bya ba 'dis kho bo cag la ci bya ste / 'di ltar mig la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rkyen yin te /
translated: What is the use of this statement that things are produced from self, from another, and so on?ğŸ”½For we have shown that things are produced, saying that such things as the eye are conditions that produce the eye consciousness,

original: dper na phru ba la sogs pa 'tshed pa'i bya ba yin pa bzhin no zhes dngos po skye bar bstan par bya ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dper na phru ba la sogs pa 'tshed pa'i bya ba yin pa bzhin no zhes dngos po skye bar bstan par bya ba zhes bya'o //
translated: just as such things as the pot are the action of cooking.ğŸ”½Here, â€œby anotherâ€ refers to the elder BuddhapaÌ„lita, who stated the prior

original: de la gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni skye bar smra ba gzhan gyis gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta la dngos po skye bar bstan pa'i phyogs snga ma smras pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni skye bar smra ba gzhan gyis gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta la dngos po skye bar bstan pa'i phyogs snga ma smras pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: position that things are produced.

original: dngos po rnams bdag dang gzhan la sogs pa las skye'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams bdag dang gzhan la sogs pa las skye'o //
translated: â€œWhat is the use of this statement that things are produced from self, from another, and so on?â€

original: bya ba 'dis kho bo cag la ci bya ste zhes bya ba ni skye bar smra ba dag gnas brtan buddha p'a li tas 'di skad ces zer ba yin te /
analyzed: bya ba 'dis kho bo cag la ci bya ste zhes bya ba ni skye bar smra ba dag gnas brtan buddha p'a li tas 'di skad ces zer ba yin te /
translated: This is what the elder BuddhapaÌ„lita, who maintains that things are produced, says.

original: skye bar smra ba gzhan dag gis phyi dang nang gi skye mched kyi dngos po rnams bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis dang rgyu med pa las skye'o zhes bya ba'i dpyad pa 'dis kho bo cag la ci bya ste /ğŸ”½dgos pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skye bar smra ba gzhan dag gis phyi dang nang gi skye mched kyi dngos po rnams bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis dang rgyu med pa las skye'o zhes bya ba'i dpyad pa 'dis kho bo cag la ci bya ste / dgos pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: We do not accept that external and internal bases are produced from self, other, both, or causelessly.

original: kho bo cag ni 'di ltar 'dod de /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni 'di ltar 'dod de /
translated: We accept the following:

original: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rkyen yin te zhes bya ba ni /ğŸ”½rkyen mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa rnams ni 'bras bu mig gi rnam @170a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rkyen yin te zhes bya ba ni / rkyen mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa rnams ni 'bras bu mig gi rnam @170a * //
translated: The eye and so on are conditions for the arising of eye consciousness and so on.

original: par shes par bskyed pa'i bya ba'i rkyen yin par 'dod do /
analyzed: par shes par bskyed pa'i bya ba'i rkyen yin par 'dod do /
translated: The conditions of the eye, form, light, space, and mental attention are asserted to be the active conditions that generate the effect, eye consciousness.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe ba /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe ba /
translated: What is that like?

original: dpe na phru ba sogs pa 'tshed pa'i bya ba yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dpe na phru ba sogs pa 'tshed pa'i bya ba yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is like the activity of cooking, which is like a pot and so on.

original: dper na phru ba dang chu dang 'bras thug po che dang me dang / bud shing dag ni 'bras chan 'tshed pa'i bya pa'i rkyen yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na phru ba dang chu dang 'bras thug po che dang me dang / bud shing dag ni 'bras chan 'tshed pa'i bya pa'i rkyen yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, a pot, water, rice, fire, and fuel are conditions for cooking rice.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyang don dam par mig gi rnam par shes pa bskyed par bya ba'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyang don dam par mig gi rnam par shes pa bskyed par bya ba'i rkyen yin no //
translated: Similarly, the conditions of the eye, etc. are ultimately conditions for the production of visual consciousness.

original: dngos po skye bar bstan pa zhes bya ba ni skye bar smra ba gzhan gyis de ltar dngos po skye bar bstan cing sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po skye bar bstan pa zhes bya ba ni skye bar smra ba gzhan gyis de ltar dngos po skye bar bstan cing sgrub pa'o //
translated: The statement â€œThings are shown to ariseâ€ means that others who advocate arising teach and establish that things arise.

original: de dgag pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin //
analyzed: de dgag pa'i phyir / bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin //
translated: In order to refute that,

original: zhes bya ba 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di gsungs te /
translated: the root text says, â€œAn action does not possess conditions.â€ğŸ”½This is explained as follows: It is untenable that consciousness arises, has already arisen, or is in the process of arising and that it is produced by consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / skye ba'i tshe la rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i ba ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad par byed do zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta nyid kyi phyogs phyi ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / skye ba'i tshe la rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i ba ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad par byed do zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta nyid kyi phyogs phyi ma yin te /
translated: This is the latter position of the elder BuddhapaÌ„lita.

original: de la de dgag pa'i phyir zhes ba ba ni skye bar smra ba gzhan gyis dngos po skye bar bstan pa'i phyogs snga ma de dgag pa'i phyir ro //

original: bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin //

original: zhes bya ba 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di gsungs te /

original: rnam par shes pa skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / skye ba'i tshe la rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / skye ba'i tshe la rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Because it is untenable that consciousness that has arisen, that has not arisen, or that is in the process of arising has an action of producing consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa skyes pa la ni bya ba med de 'bras bu skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyes pa la ni bya ba med de 'bras bu skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is what is demonstrated: Consciousness that has arisen does not have an action because its effect has already arisen.

original: rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa la yang bya ba med de rkyen med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa la yang bya ba med de rkyen med pa'i phyir ro //

original: skye ba'i tshe zhes bya ba ni skye ba la mngon par phyogs pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i tshe zhes bya ba ni skye ba la mngon par phyogs pa ste /
translated: That which is in the process of arising is that which is tending toward arising.

original: de la yang bya ba med de ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang bya ba med de ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That also does not have an action because it has not yet arisen.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical,

original: phyogs snga ma dang phyi ma dang gnyis dam bcas pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: phyogs snga ma dang phyi ma dang gnyis dam bcas pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /

analyzed: gnas brtan buddha p'a li tas rnam par bshad pa de rigs pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is the statement by the commentator himself establishing that the explanation by the elder BuddhapaÌ„lita is not logical.

original: de la de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /

translated: There, â€œthat is not logicalâ€

original: gnas brtan buddha pa'i tas rnam par bshad pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas brtan buddha pa'i tas rnam par bshad pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa yin no //
translated: is the assertion that the explanation by the elder BuddhapaÌ„lita is not logical.

original: ci'i phyir rigs pa ma yin zhe na phyogs snga ma dang phyi ma gnyis dam bcas pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir rigs pa ma yin zhe na phyogs snga ma dang phyi ma gnyis dam bcas pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it not logical? Because the former and latter positions are mere assertions.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: skye bar smra ba gzhan gyis dngos po rnams bdag dang gzhan la sogs pa las skye'o zhes bya ba 'dis kho bo cag la ci bya ste /
analyzed: skye bar smra ba gzhan gyis dngos po rnams bdag dang gzhan la sogs pa las skye'o zhes bya ba 'dis kho bo cag la ci bya ste /

analyzed: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa yin te /
translated: Thus conditions such as the eye are producers of eye consciousness.

original: dper na phru @170b ba la sogs pa ni 'tshed pa'i ba ba yin pa bzhin no zhes dngos po skye bar bstan pa'i phyogs snga ma de dang / gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta nyid kyis de dgag pa'i phyir /

translated: For example, a pot is the product of a potter.ğŸ”½The elder BuddhapaÌ„lita himself refutes this by saying that it is untenable that consciousness that has arisen, has not arisen, or is in the process of arising has the activity of producing consciousness.

analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang skye ba'i tshe la rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad pa'i phyogs phyi ma de gnyis ga yang dam bcas pa'i tshig tsam du zad de 'thad pa'i rigs pa gzhan med pas /

original: gzhan gyi phyogs kyang sun mi phyin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs kyang sun mi phyin la /
translated: Thus, the position of the opponent is not refuted,

original: rang gi phyogs kyang gzhung mi tshugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi phyogs kyang gzhung mi tshugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and oneâ€™s own position is not established.ğŸ”½Here, the phrase â€œhaving exaggerated the meaning of the refutationâ€ means

analyzed: 'dir sun phyung ba'i don sgro btags nas smras pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the following.

original: skye bar smra ba dag gi yang skabs 'dir smras pa ste /
analyzed: skye bar smra ba dag gi yang skabs 'dir smras pa ste /

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / yid la byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyi rkyen dang ldan pas de skyed par 'dod do //

analyzed: kho bo cag gis de yod par smra bar nus te / don dam par rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yin te /

translated: The activity that generates consciousness ultimately generates its effect because it possesses the conditions, just as the activity of cooking rice possesses the conditions of the pot, water, rice, fire, and fuel.

translated: That which is the action of producing consciousness is the nature of consciousness.

analyzed: bskyed pa'i bya ba rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa de mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang nam mkha' dang yid la byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyi rkyen dang ldan pa na skye bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir dngos po skye ba yod do zhes gang gis
translated: Since that action of producing consciousness, which is the nature of consciousness, arises in dependence on the conditions of the eye, form, light, space, and attention, therefore things that arise exist.

original: khas blangs pa de'i phyogs dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khas blangs pa de'i phyogs dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the position of those who assert this,

original: slob dpon gyis /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis /
translated: the master NÄgÄrjuna said:

original: bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: bya ba rkyen dang ldan ma yin // zhes bya ba 'di gsungs so //
translated: An action does not possess conditions.

original: ci'i phyir bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why does an action not possess conditions?

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba ni rnam par shes pa bzhin du med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba ni rnam par shes pa bzhin du med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the action of producing consciousness does not exist like consciousness.

original: med pa la ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen kyang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: med pa la ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen kyang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Because it is illogical for something that does not exist to be a condition in the sense of possessing something.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: gang gi phyogs la rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pa de'i phyogs la ni rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba nyid rnam par shes pa yin pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyogs la rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pa de'i phyogs la ni rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba nyid rnam par shes pa yin pas /
translated: In the context of the activity that produces consciousness, if the activity were to exist in the nature of consciousness, then the activity that produces consciousness would be consciousness.

original: ji srid du rnam par shes pa ma skyes shing med pa de srid du rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba yang ma skyes shing med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji srid du rnam par shes pa ma skyes shing med pa de srid du rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba yang ma skyes shing med pa'i phyir /
translated: But as long as consciousness has not arisen and does not exist, the activity that produces consciousness has not arisen and does not exist.

original: bya ba med pa la ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen kyang mi rigs pa'i phyir bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba med pa la ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen kyang mi rigs pa'i phyir bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is illogical for something that does not exist to be a condition in the sense of possessing something, the activity does not possess conditions.

original: gal te bya ba yod na ni ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te bya ba yod na ni ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen kyang rung ste /
translated: If the activity existed, it would be logical for it to be a condition in the sense of possessing something.

original: dper na lha sbyin yod na nor dang ldan no zhes brjod pa lta bu yin na /
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin yod na nor dang ldan no zhes brjod pa lta bu yin na /
translated: For example, if Devadatta exists, it is said that he possesses wealth.

original: bya ba med pas ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen kyang mi rigs pas rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don de ma grub ste /
analyzed: bya ba med pas ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen kyang mi rigs pas rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don de ma grub ste /
translated: Since there is no activity, it is also illogical to have the object of possession, therefore, since it is not logical to have the condition of possession, the meaning of the reason â€œbecause of having conditionsâ€ is not established.

original: de ni re zhig rtsa ba dang po'i bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig rtsa ba dang po'i bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the first root text.

original: gang gi phyogs la bdag nyid du gyur ba ma yin pa ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa de'i phyir na /
analyzed: gang gi phyogs la bdag nyid du gyur ba ma yin pa ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa de'i phyir na /
translated: For those who have a position that the intrinsic reality of consciousness is not itself consciousness,ğŸ”½it is said:

original: rkyen dang mi ldan bya ba med //
analyzed: rkyen dang mi ldan bya ba med //
translated: â€œThere is no activity without having conditions.â€

original: ces bya ba gsungs te zhes bya ba ni /ğŸ”½'di la slob dpon gu @172a * //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te zhes bya ba ni / 'di la slob dpon gu @172a * //
translated: This is said because

original: na ma ti ni 'di skad du rnam par bshad pa byed de /
analyzed: na ma ti ni 'di skad du rnam par bshad pa byed de /
translated: the master Guá¹‡amati explains this as follows:

original: skye bar smra ba gang gi phyogs la rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skye bar smra ba gang gi phyogs la rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: For those who propound arising, the activity that generates consciousness is not itself consciousness.

original: bskyed pa'i bya ba rnam par shes pa las gzhan du gyur pa ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa rkyen dang mi ldan pa des rnam par shes pa bskyed par byed pas de'i phyir dngos po skye ba yod do zhes gang gis khas blangs pa de'i phyogs dgag pa'i
analyzed: bskyed pa'i bya ba rnam par shes pa las gzhan du gyur pa ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa rkyen dang mi ldan pa des rnam par shes pa bskyed par byed pas de'i phyir dngos po skye ba yod do zhes gang gis khas blangs pa de'i phyogs dgag pa'i
translated: In the context of the opponentâ€™s position, the activity that generates consciousness is not the same as consciousness, it is not established by its own intrinsic reality, and it does not possess conditions. Because it generates consciousness, therefore things that arise exist.ğŸ”½In order to refute that position,

original: phyir ni / slob dpon gyis /
analyzed: phyir ni / slob dpon gyis /
translated: the master said:

original: rkyen dang mi ldan bya ba med //
analyzed: rkyen dang mi ldan bya ba med //
translated: â€œThere is no activity without conditions.â€

original: ces bya ba 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di gsungs so //
translated: This is what he said.

original: ci'i phyir rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i bya ba med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i bya ba med ce na /
translated: Why is there no activity without conditions?

original: de'i phyir rkyen dang mi ldan pas rang nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rkyen dang mi ldan pas rang nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, it was said: â€œBecause it does not exist without conditions.â€

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: gang gi phyogs la rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa rkyen dang ldan pa de'i phyogs la ni rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang mi ldan pas
analyzed: gang gi phyogs la rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa rkyen dang ldan pa de'i phyogs la ni rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba rkyen dang mi ldan pas
translated: In the context of the opponentâ€™s position, the activity that generates consciousness is not the same as consciousness, it is not established by its own intrinsic reality, and it does not possess conditions. Because the activity that generates consciousness does not possess conditions,

original: rang nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not exist by itself.

original: rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i bya ba med de 'di la bya ba'i bdag nyid ni rkyen rnams kyis bya bar 'gyur bas des na bya ba'i bdag nyid rkyen dang ldan pa zhes bya ba yin na //
analyzed: rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i bya ba med de 'di la bya ba'i bdag nyid ni rkyen rnams kyis bya bar 'gyur bas des na bya ba'i bdag nyid rkyen dang ldan pa zhes bya ba yin na //
translated: An action that does not possess conditions does not exist, because the nature of an action is to be produced by conditions. Therefore, it is called â€œthe nature of an action that possesses conditions.â€

original: gang rkyen dang mi ldan pa de ni rang nyid med pa'i phyir rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i bya ba med do //
analyzed: gang rkyen dang mi ldan pa de ni rang nyid med pa'i phyir rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i bya ba med do //
translated: That which does not possess conditions does not exist by itself. Therefore, an action that does not possess conditions does not exist.

original: 'di ltar khyod nyid kyis bya ba 'di'i yod pa nyid bcal te bya ba rkyen dang mi ldan par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod nyid kyis bya ba 'di'i yod pa nyid bcal te bya ba rkyen dang mi ldan par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you yourself have sought the existence of this action and have accepted that an action does not possess conditions.

original: kha cig na re zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis slob dpon gu na ma ti'i rnam par bshad pa de sun 'byin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: kha cig na re zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis slob dpon gu na ma ti'i rnam par bshad pa de sun 'byin par byed pa yin no //
translated: Some say that the author of the commentary himself refutes the explanation of Master Guá¹‡amati.

original: slob dpon gu na ma tis rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba ni rnam par shes pa bzhin du med pa'i phyir zhes rnam par bshad pa de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: slob dpon gu na ma tis rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba ni rnam par shes pa bzhin du med pa'i phyir zhes rnam par bshad pa de ni mi rigs te /
translated: The explanation of Master Guá¹‡amati that â€œthe action that produces consciousness does not exist like consciousnessâ€ is incorrect.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?ğŸ”½Because the conditions mutually benefit each other, and the entity arises in the moment that the action of the ability to generate the effect is obtained in the next moment.

original: 'di ltar rkyen rnams gcig la gcig phan 'dogs pas de ma thag pa'i skad cig la 'bras bu skyed nus pa'i bya ba bdag nyid thob pa'i skad cig gis dngos po skye bar 'dod pa skyed pa tha snyad du ma btang bas med pa nyid ma yin lağŸ”½zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rkyen rnams gcig la gcig phan 'dogs pas de ma thag pa'i skad cig la 'bras bu skyed nus pa'i bya ba bdag nyid thob pa'i skad cig gis dngos po skye bar 'dod pa skyed pa tha snyad du ma btang bas med pa nyid ma yin la zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The arising of the effect is not relinquished conventionally, and thus it is not nonexistent.

original: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba rnam par shes pa bzhin du med pa'i phyir zhes rnam par bshad pa de mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba rnam par shes pa bzhin du med pa'i phyir zhes rnam par bshad pa de mi rung zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is illogical to explain that the action of generating consciousness does not exist like consciousness,

original: dbu ma pas rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya bas dngos po skyed par 'dod pas skyed par 'dod pa kun rdzob tu khas blangs shing ma btang bas med pa nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: dbu ma pas rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya bas dngos po skyed par 'dod pas skyed par 'dod pa kun rdzob tu khas blangs shing ma btang bas med pa nyid ma yin la /
translated: then the Followers of the Middle Way do not relinquish the assertion that entities are produced by the action of generating consciousness. They do not relinquish the assertion that entities are produced by the action of generating consciousness conventionally. Thus entities are not nonexistent.

original: slob dpon gu na ma tis bya ba de kun rdzob tu yod @172b pa don dam par med do zhes bye brag tu ma phye bar spyir med do zhes rnam par bshad pa'i phyir mi rung ngo //
analyzed: slob dpon gu na ma tis bya ba de kun rdzob tu yod @172b pa don dam par med do zhes bye brag tu ma phye bar spyir med do zhes rnam par bshad pa'i phyir mi rung ngo //
translated: Master Guá¹‡amati explains: â€œThat action exists conventionally, but does not exist ultimately.â€ Since he explains that in general it does not exist without distinguishing it, that is incorrect.

original: 'di skad bstan te //
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te //
translated: This is taught:

original: 'di ltar slob dpon gu na ma tis don dam par bya ba bskyed par bya ba ma yin no zhes ma smras par /
analyzed: 'di ltar slob dpon gu na ma tis don dam par bya ba bskyed par bya ba ma yin no zhes ma smras par /
translated: Thus, master Guá¹‡amati did not say, â€œUltimately, action is not to be generated.â€

original: 'di ltar bye brag med pa kho nar bya ba 'gog par byed pa'i phyir mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar bye brag med pa kho nar bya ba 'gog par byed pa'i phyir mi rung ngo //
translated: Since he refutes action without distinction, that is incorrect.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du ni rkyen tshogs pa'i bya ba bdag nyid thob pa'i skad cig gis dngos po skye bar 'dod pa skyed pa med pa nyid ma yin te de'i phyir rkyen rnams gcig la gcig phan 'dogs pas de ma thag pa'i skad cig la 'bras
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du ni rkyen tshogs pa'i bya ba bdag nyid thob pa'i skad cig gis dngos po skye bar 'dod pa skyed pa med pa nyid ma yin te de'i phyir rkyen rnams gcig la gcig phan 'dogs pas de ma thag pa'i skad cig la 'bras
translated: Conventionally, it is asserted that things arise from the assemblage of conditions, and since they are obtained by the action of the instant, they are not nonarisen. Therefore, since the conditions mutually benefit each other, the effect arises in the subsequent instant.

original: bu bskyed nus pa'i bya ba bdag nyid thob pa'i skad cig gis dngos po skyed par 'dod pa skyed pa tha snyad du ma btang bas med pa nyid ma yin la zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bu bskyed nus pa'i bya ba bdag nyid thob pa'i skad cig gis dngos po skyed par 'dod pa skyed pa tha snyad du ma btang bas med pa nyid ma yin la zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The moment a thing obtains the activity of producing a son, it produces the thing. Since it does not abandon the production conventionally, it is not nonexistent.

original: gang gi tshe rkyen mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang nam mkha' dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa yul dang yul can gyi dngos po rnam par gnas par gyur pa de'i tshe na mig gis gzugs mthong bas mig gis gzugs la phan 'dogs par byed la
analyzed: gang gi tshe rkyen mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang nam mkha' dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa yul dang yul can gyi dngos po rnam par gnas par gyur pa de'i tshe na mig gis gzugs mthong bas mig gis gzugs la phan 'dogs par byed la
translated: When the conditionsâ€”the object and subject, such as the eye, form, light, space, mental activity, and so onâ€”are present, at that time the eye sees form and the eye benefits form.

original: / gzugs kyang mig gi mdun na 'dug pas gzugs kyang mig la phan 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: / gzugs kyang mig gi mdun na 'dug pas gzugs kyang mig la phan 'dogs par byed do //
translated: Since form is present in front of the eye, form also benefits the eye.

original: de bzhin du snang ba yang mig dang gzugs la sogs pa la phan 'dogs par byed la /
analyzed: de bzhin du snang ba yang mig dang gzugs la sogs pa la phan 'dogs par byed la /
translated: Likewise, light also benefits the eye, form, and so on.

original: nam mkha' yang de dag la phan 'dogs par byed cing yid la byed pa yang de dag la phan 'dogs par byed pas /
analyzed: nam mkha' yang de dag la phan 'dogs par byed cing yid la byed pa yang de dag la phan 'dogs par byed pas /
translated: Space also benefits them, and mental activity also benefits them.

original: de ltar phan 'dogs pa de'i de ma thag pa'i skad cig la 'bras bu bskyed nus pa gang yin pa de ni bya ba bdag nyid thob pa'i skad cig yin no //
analyzed: de ltar phan 'dogs pa de'i de ma thag pa'i skad cig la 'bras bu bskyed nus pa gang yin pa de ni bya ba bdag nyid thob pa'i skad cig yin no //
translated: The moment that it is able to generate its effect is the moment that it obtains the nature of activity.

original: bya ba des rnam par shes pa'i dngos po skye bar 'dod pa gang gi tshe skyed pa de kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du khas blangs shing ma btang bas /
analyzed: bya ba des rnam par shes pa'i dngos po skye bar 'dod pa gang gi tshe skyed pa de kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du khas blangs shing ma btang bas /
translated: When the consciousness that is asserted to arise from that activity is generated, it is accepted and not relinquished as a conventional designation.

original: de'i phyir bya ba de kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du med pa nyid ma yin pa la ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba rnam par shes pa bzhin du med pa'i phyir zhes rnam par bshad pa byed de de ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir bya ba de kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du med pa nyid ma yin pa la ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba rnam par shes pa bzhin du med pa'i phyir zhes rnam par bshad pa byed de de ni mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, why would the activity that generates consciousness not be a conventional designation? Why would it be explained that it does not exist, like consciousness? That is illogical.

original: slob dpon gu na ma tis med pa la ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen kyang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad pa de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: slob dpon gu na ma tis med pa la ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen kyang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad pa de yang mi rigs te /
translated: Master Guá¹‡amati explains that it is illogical for the term â€œpossessesâ€ to be a condition of a nonexistent. That also is illogical.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na 'di ltar ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen kyang mi rigs pa ma yin pa dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na 'di ltar ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen kyang mi rigs pa ma yin pa dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Why? Because it is not illogical to have the meaning of possession in the case of the condition of the object of action.

original: kun rdzob tu 'tshed pa'i bya ba dang bskyed pa'i bya ba yod pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu 'tshed pa'i bya ba dang bskyed pa'i bya ba yod pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the object of action of cooking and the object of action of arising exist conventionally,

original: de la ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen kyang mi rigs pa ma yin te /ğŸ”½dper na kun rdzob tu bud med yod na de gzugs dang @173a * //
analyzed: de la ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen kyang mi rigs pa ma yin te / dper na kun rdzob tu bud med yod na de gzugs dang @173a * //
translated: then it is not illogical to have the meaning of possession in the case of the condition of the object of action.ğŸ”½For example, if a woman exists conventionally, it is suitable to say she possesses form and is a woman, and if Devadatta exists, it is suitable to say he possesses wealth and is wealthy.

original: ldan pa la gzugs can ma zhes brjod du rung ba dang / lha sbyin yod na de nor dang ldan pa la nor can zhes brjod du rung ba bzhin du kun rdzob tu bya ba yod pa la yang rkyen dang ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen kyang mi rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ldan pa la gzugs can ma zhes brjod du rung ba dang / lha sbyin yod na de nor dang ldan pa la nor can zhes brjod du rung ba bzhin du kun rdzob tu bya ba yod pa la yang rkyen dang ldan pa'i don gyi rkyen kyang mi rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, it is not illogical to have the meaning of possession in the case of the condition of the object of action in the case of the object of action that exists conventionally.

original: de ni re zhig gnas brtan gu na ma ti'i rnam par bshad pa'i phyogs dang po shos sun dbyung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig gnas brtan gu na ma ti'i rnam par bshad pa'i phyogs dang po shos sun dbyung ba yin no //
translated: This is the refutation of the first position explained by the elder Guá¹‡amati.

original: da ni slob dpon gu na ma ti'i rnam par bshad pa'i phyogs gnyis pa las gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa rkyen dang mi ldan pas rang gi
analyzed: da ni slob dpon gu na ma ti'i rnam par bshad pa'i phyogs gnyis pa las gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i bya ba rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa rkyen dang mi ldan pas rang gi
translated: Now, the second position explained by Master Guá¹‡amati is as follows: â€œThe activity that generates other consciousnesses is not of the nature of consciousness, is not established by its own nature, and is not endowed with conditions, yet it generates its own effect.â€

original: 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes gang smras pa de dang slob dpon gu na ma tis rkyen dang mi ldan pas rang nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad pa de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes gang smras pa de dang slob dpon gu na ma tis rkyen dang mi ldan pas rang nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes rnam par bshad pa de yang mi rigs te /
translated: The explanation by Master Guá¹‡amati, â€œBecause it is not endowed with conditions, it does not exist,â€ is also illogical.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar dam bcas pa tsam gyis gzhan gyi phyogs dam bcas pa tsam sun 'byin par byed pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dam bcas pa tsam gyis gzhan gyi phyogs dam bcas pa tsam sun 'byin par byed pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because he says, â€œThe position of others is refuted by mere assertion.â€

original: phyags snga ma dang phyi ma gnyis ka yang gtan tshigs dang dpe brjod pa med pa'i phyir gnyi ga yang dam bcas pa'i tshig tsam du zad pas tshig tsam gyis 'dir ni 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyags snga ma dang phyi ma gnyis ka yang gtan tshigs dang dpe brjod pa med pa'i phyir gnyi ga yang dam bcas pa'i tshig tsam du zad pas tshig tsam gyis 'dir ni 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because neither the former nor the latter has stated a reason and example, both are mere assertions, and mere assertions do not establish the intended meaning here.

original: de ni de na mo ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa tsam gyis gzhan sun mi phyin to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni de na mo ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa tsam gyis gzhan sun mi phyin to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: â€œThat is not soâ€ means that one does not refute others merely by asserting something.

original: skye bar smra ba gzhan dag gzhan gyis phyir zlog par byed de zhes bya ba ni skye bar smra ba gzhan dag bya ba rkyen dang ldan pa yang ma yin pas des kyang dngos po bskyed par ma grub la /

translated: That which is established as non-arising is endowed with non-arising.

original: dngos po nyid bkag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa ldan pa des gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i dngos po nyid tsam kho bo 'gog par byed kyi /
analyzed: dngos po nyid bkag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa ldan pa des gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i dngos po nyid tsam kho bo 'gog par byed kyi /
translated: â€œBecause it negates real thingsâ€ means that by that endowment with non-arising, we refute the mere real things imagined by others.

original: dngos po med pa nyid ni sgrub par mi byed do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa nyid ni sgrub par mi byed do //
translated: We do not establish non-existence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar gang 'dod pa de bsgrub par bya ba yin pas kho bo ni dngos po med par lta ba mi 'dod pas de sgrub par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang 'dod pa de bsgrub par bya ba yin pas kho bo ni dngos po med par lta ba mi 'dod pas de sgrub par mi byed kyi /
translated: Because since that which is asserted is to be established, we do not assert the view of non-existence, so we do not establish that.

original: dngos por lta ba 'gog par 'dod pas kho bos skye ba 'gag pa kho nas skye ba med par grub pa /
analyzed: dngos por lta ba 'gog par 'dod pas kho bos skye ba 'gag pa kho nas skye ba med par grub pa /
translated: Since we assert the negation of the view of real things, we establish non-arising by the mere cessation of arising.

original: skye ba med pa dang ldan pas dngos po nyid bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang ldan pas dngos po nyid bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is endowed with non-arising, we negate real things.

original: kho bos khyed cag la gzugs la sogs pa med par ston mi nus pa ma yin pas dngos po'i mthar ma lhung ba'i phyir skyon mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bos khyed cag la gzugs la sogs pa med par ston mi nus pa ma yin pas dngos po'i mthar ma lhung ba'i phyir skyon mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: We do not say that we cannot show that form and so on do not exist, so we do not fall to the extreme of the existence of things.

original: khyed cag gzugs la sogs pa yod par ston pa de bzhin du kho bo cag dngos po med pa nyid du yang ston par mi byed de /
analyzed: khyed cag gzugs la sogs pa yod par ston pa de bzhin du kho bo cag dngos po med pa nyid du yang ston par mi byed de /
translated: Just as you show that form and so on exist, we do not show that things do not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: de'i phyir dngos po med par lta ba spang par 'dod pa yang ston par mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med par lta ba spang par 'dod pa yang ston par mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, because we do not show that things do not exist, we do not wish to abandon the view that things do not exist.

original: 'dis ni dbu ma pa ni dngos po med par lta ba spang par 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dis ni dbu ma pa ni dngos po med par lta ba spang par 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: This shows that because the Followers of the Middle Way do not wish to abandon the view that things do not exist,

original: dngos po med par lta ba de ston par mi byed pas dngos po med pa'i mthar yang ma lhung ba'i phyir skyon mtshungs pa ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: dngos po med par lta ba de ston par mi byed pas dngos po med pa'i mthar yang ma lhung ba'i phyir skyon mtshungs pa ma yin par ston to //
translated: they do not show that things do not exist. Therefore they do not fall to the extreme of the nonexistence of things.

original: gang gi phyir grangs can dag 'jig rten gsum rab tu 'jig par lta ba de'i phyir ni med par lta ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir grangs can dag 'jig rten gsum rab tu 'jig par lta ba de'i phyir ni med par lta ba yin la /
translated: Because the Enumerators view the destruction of the three worlds, they have the view of nihilism.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gsum 'chags par lta ba de'i phyir ni yod par lta ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gsum 'chags par lta ba de'i phyir ni yod par lta ba yin gyi /
translated: Because of the view that the three worlds are created, one has the view that things exist.

original: dbu ma pas ni skye ba bkag pa kho nas skye ba med pa dang ldan pas dngos po nyid bkag pa de'i phyir ni dngos por lta ba med la /
analyzed: dbu ma pas ni skye ba bkag pa kho nas skye ba med pa dang ldan pas dngos po nyid bkag pa de'i phyir ni dngos por lta ba med la /
translated: But because the Followers of the Middle Way merely refute arising, they do not have the view that things do not arise. Because they refute things, they do not have the view that things exist.

original: dngos po med par lta ba spang bar 'dod pa yang ston par mi byed pa de'i phyir dngos po med par lta ba yang med do //
analyzed: dngos po med par lta ba spang bar 'dod pa yang ston par mi byed pa de'i phyir dngos po med par lta ba yang med do //
translated: Since they do not teach that the view of nonexistence should be rejected, they also do not have the view of nonexistence.

original: 'di ltar dngos po med par sgrub pa @177a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po med par sgrub pa @177a * //
translated: In this way, when the nonexistence of things is established,

original: grub pa na dngos po med pa de la mngon par zhen pa ni dngos po med par lta ba zhes bya na /ğŸ”½gang gi phyir kho bos dngos po med par lta ba spang bar 'dod pa de'i phyir ni dngos po med pa mi sgrub par dngos po med do //
analyzed: grub pa na dngos po med pa de la mngon par zhen pa ni dngos po med par lta ba zhes bya na / gang gi phyir kho bos dngos po med par lta ba spang bar 'dod pa de'i phyir ni dngos po med pa mi sgrub par dngos po med do //
translated: the clinging to that nonexistence is called â€œthe view of nonexistence.â€ğŸ”½Since we do not assert the nonexistence of things, we do not establish nonexistence.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po med pa med pa de'i phyir ni kho bo la dngos po med par lta ba yang med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po med pa med pa de'i phyir ni kho bo la dngos po med par lta ba yang med do //
translated: Since we do not establish nonexistence, we do not have the view of nonexistence.

original: de'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis su ma lhung ba rnams dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis su lhung ba rnams dang mi 'dra bar skyon mtshungs par thal bar ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba smras te /ğŸ”½nged dbu ma pa skye ba bkag pa kho nas skye ba med pa dang ldan bas dngos po nyid bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis su ma lhung ba rnams dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis su lhung ba rnams dang mi 'dra bar skyon mtshungs par thal bar ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba smras te / nged dbu ma pa skye ba bkag pa kho nas skye ba med pa dang ldan bas dngos po nyid bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, how could it be that those who do not fall to the extremes of the views of entity and nonentity are similar to those who fall to the extremes of the views of entity and nonentity?

original: dngos por lta ba'i mthar ma lhung la dngos po med par lta ba spang bar 'dod pa yang ston par mi byed pa'i phyir dngos po med par lta ba'i mthar yang ma lhung ba rnams khyed grangs can dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis
analyzed: dngos por lta ba'i mthar ma lhung la dngos po med par lta ba spang bar 'dod pa yang ston par mi byed pa'i phyir dngos po med par lta ba'i mthar yang ma lhung ba rnams khyed grangs can dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis
translated: We Followers of the Middle Way do not fall to the extreme of the view of entity because we refute arising and possess the view of no arising, and we do not fall to the extreme of the view of nonentity because we do not teach that entities are refuted.ğŸ”½Therefore, how could it be that we are similar to you Enumerators, who fall to the extremes of the views of entity and nonentity?

original: su lhung ba rnams dang mi 'dra bas skyon mtshungs par thal bar ga la 'gyur te mi 'gyur zhes bstan to //
analyzed: su lhung ba rnams dang mi 'dra bas skyon mtshungs par thal bar ga la 'gyur te mi 'gyur zhes bstan to //
translated: We are not similar at all.

original: de la dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po med par 'dzin cing rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de la dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po med par 'dzin cing rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The view of entity and non-entity is the grasping and conceptualization of non-entity.

original: mtha' gnyis su zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i lta ba nyid kyi mtha' gnyis ni dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis so //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis su zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i lta ba nyid kyi mtha' gnyis ni dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis so //
translated: The two extremes is the two extremes of the view of entity and non-entity.

original: der ma lhung ba rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: der ma lhung ba rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those who do not fall into those are

original: gang dag dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis la ma chags pa de dag ni dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis su ma lhung ba rnams te /
analyzed: gang dag dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis la ma chags pa de dag ni dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis su ma lhung ba rnams te /
translated: those who are not attached to the two extremes of the view of entity and non-entity. They are those who do not fall into the two extremes of the view of entity and non-entity.

original: dbu ma pa dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis su ma lhung ba rnams so //
analyzed: dbu ma pa dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis su ma lhung ba rnams so //
translated: They are MÄdhyamikas who do not fall into the two extremes of the view of entity and non-entity.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis su lhung ba rnams dang mi 'dra bas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis su lhung ba rnams dang mi 'dra bas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are not like those who fall into the two extremes of the view of entity and non-entity.

original: grangs can dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis su lhung ba rnams dang dbu ma pa mi 'dra bas so //
analyzed: grangs can dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis su lhung ba rnams dang dbu ma pa mi 'dra bas so //
translated: because the SÄá¹ƒkhya fall into the two extremes of the views of entity and nonentity, but the Madhyamaka is not like that.ğŸ”½How could it follow that the fault is similar?

original: skyon mtshungs par thal bar gal 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa rnams grangs can rnams dang mi 'dra bas skyon mtshungs par thal bar ga la 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyon mtshungs par thal bar gal 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dbu ma pa rnams grangs can rnams dang mi 'dra bas skyon mtshungs par thal bar ga la 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that because the Madhyamaka is not like the SÄá¹ƒkhya, how could it follow that the fault is similar? It could not!

original: gzhan yang dngos po med par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa kho na'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po med par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa kho na'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because there is no inference that demonstrates nonentity,

original: de sgrub par mi 'dod pas @177b kho bo cag gi 'dod pa kho na 'grub par 'gyur gyi rang gi phyogs sgrub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bas brnan te /
analyzed: de sgrub par mi 'dod pas @177b kho bo cag gi 'dod pa kho na 'grub par 'gyur gyi rang gi phyogs sgrub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bas brnan te /
translated: since we do not assert that it is established, only our assertion is established, but not the establishment of our own position.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa kho na'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gal te khyad la dngos po ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa yod na ni des na dngos po 'grub par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa kho na'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gal te khyad la dngos po ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa yod na ni des na dngos po 'grub par 'gyur la /
translated: If you had an inference that reveals an existent object, then an existent object would be established.ğŸ”½If I had an inference that reveals a nonexistent object, then a nonexistent object would be established.

original: gal te kho bo la yang dngos po med par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa yod par gyur na des kyang dngos po med pa 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi phyir khyod la yang dngos po ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med la /
analyzed: gal te kho bo la yang dngos po med par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa yod par gyur na des kyang dngos po med pa 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi phyir khyod la yang dngos po ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med la /
translated: But because you do not have an inference that reveals an existent object,

original: kho bo la yang dngos po med par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: kho bo la yang dngos po med par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa de'i phyir /
translated: and because I do not have an inference that reveals a nonexistent object,ğŸ”½therefore it is said, â€œbecause there is no inference that reveals either an existent or a nonexistent object.â€

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa kho na'i phyir zhes bshad do de sgrub par mi 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni de ltar dngos po med par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa kho na'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa kho na'i phyir zhes bshad do de sgrub par mi 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni de ltar dngos po med par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa kho na'i phyir /
translated: Because we do not assert the establishment of that

original: kho bo cag dbu ma pa ci dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis po de sgrub par mi 'dod pas so //
analyzed: kho bo cag dbu ma pa ci dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis po de sgrub par mi 'dod pas so //
translated: We Madhyamikas do not accept either of the two extremes, the view of existence or the view of nonexistence.

original: kho bo cag gi 'dod pa kho na 'grub par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni de ltar kho bo cag dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis po de sgrub par mi 'dod pas /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi 'dod pa kho na 'grub par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni de ltar kho bo cag dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis po de sgrub par mi 'dod pas /
translated: We Madhyamikas do not accept either of the two extremes, the view of existence or the view of nonexistence.

original: khyed gal te dngos po med par lta ba 'gog par byed na de ni kho bo cag dbu ma pa'i 'dod pa kho na grub par 'gyur ba yin gyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyed gal te dngos po med par lta ba 'gog par byed na de ni kho bo cag dbu ma pa'i 'dod pa kho na grub par 'gyur ba yin gyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If you refute the view of nonexistence, then you will be establishing only the position of the Madhyamikas, namely, that things do not exist.ğŸ”½You do not establish your own position, namely, that things exist.

original: rang gi phyogs sgrub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyed grangs can dag dngos po med pa lta ba 'gog par byed pa de ni kho bo cag dbu ma pa'i 'dod pa kho na 'grub par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi phyogs sgrub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyed grangs can dag dngos po med pa lta ba 'gog par byed pa de ni kho bo cag dbu ma pa'i 'dod pa kho na 'grub par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: If you refute the view of nonexistence, then you will be establishing only the position of the Madhyamikas, namely, that things do not exist.

original: khyed grangs can pa dag gi rang gi phyogs sgrub pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: khyed grangs can pa dag gi rang gi phyogs sgrub pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: You do not establish your own position, namely, that things exist.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: kho bo cag dbu ma pas dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis ka dgag par bya dgos pa las /
