analyzed: kho bo cag dbu ma pas dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis ka dgag par bya dgos pa las /
translated: We Followers of the Middle Way must refute both extremes of the views of entities and nonentities.

original: de ltar grangs can khyed kyis dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' 'gog par byed pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar grangs can khyed kyis dngos po med par lta ba'i mtha' 'gog par byed pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since you Enumerators refute the extreme of the view of nonentities,

original: grangs can gyis kho bo cag gi 'dod pa'i don kho na sgrub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: grangs can gyis kho bo cag gi 'dod pa'i don kho na sgrub pa yin gyi /
translated: you are actually proving exactly what we Followers of the Middle Way assert.

original: grangs can dag khyed rang gi phyogs sgrub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: grangs can dag khyed rang gi phyogs sgrub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: You are not proving your own position, that of the Enumerators.

original: yang na skye bar smra ba dag la dri bar bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na skye bar smra ba dag la dri bar bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or, we may ask the proponents of arising:

original: yang na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam par brtag pa'i don te /ğŸ”½bya dang mi ldan rkyen ma yin //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam par brtag pa'i don te / bya dang mi ldan rkyen ma yin //
translated: The word â€œorâ€ indicates that we are considering another possibility.ğŸ”½A condition that does not possess the action of arisingğŸ”½is not a condition.

original: bya ldan yod dam 'on te na //
analyzed: bya ldan yod dam 'on te na //
translated: Does it possess the action of arising or not?

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig @178a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig @178a * //
translated: The word â€œorâ€ in the root verse indicates that we are considering another possibility.

original: le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba phyed 'og ma gnyis po 'di'i don rnam pa gzhan du yang rnam par bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba phyed 'og ma gnyis po 'di'i don rnam pa gzhan du yang rnam par bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the latter two lines of the verse should be explained in another way.

original: skye bar smra ba dag ces bya ba ni mdo sde pa dang bye brag tu smra ba dag ste /
analyzed: skye bar smra ba dag ces bya ba ni mdo sde pa dang bye brag tu smra ba dag ste /
translated: The Proponents of Arising from Both are the Sautrantikas and Vaibhasikas.

original: de dag la brtag pa'i gal 'di gnyis dri bar bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //ğŸ”½'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol na rkyen rnams bya ba dang mi ldan pa nyid ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sngon rol zhes bya ba ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs na rkyen mig dang gzugs la sogs pa
analyzed: de dag la brtag pa'i gal 'di gnyis dri bar bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro // 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol na rkyen rnams bya ba dang mi ldan pa nyid ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sngon rol zhes bya ba ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs na rkyen mig dang gzugs la sogs pa
translated: The two following analyses should be applied to them.ğŸ”½Arenâ€™t conditions devoid of activity prior to the arising of the effect?

original: rnams bya ba dang mi ldan pa nyid yin par khyed cag khas len tam zhes dri ba yin no //
analyzed: rnams bya ba dang mi ldan pa nyid yin par khyed cag khas len tam zhes dri ba yin no //
translated: Arenâ€™t the conditions, such as the eye and form, devoid of activity prior to the arising of the eye consciousness, that is, in the state of nonarising?

original: bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yin zhes bya ba ni 'on te 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol na rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yin par khyed cag khas len ces dri ba yin no //
analyzed: bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yin zhes bya ba ni 'on te 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol na rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yin par khyed cag khas len ces dri ba yin no //
translated: â€œIf they possess activityâ€ is the question: â€œBut do you accept that conditions possess activity prior to the arising of the effect?â€ğŸ”½If you assert the former alternative,

original: de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na zhes bya ba ni skye bar smra ba dag la brtag pa'i gal gnyis dri ba de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ste /
analyzed: de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na zhes bya ba ni skye bar smra ba dag la brtag pa'i gal gnyis dri ba de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ste /
translated: if you assert the former alternative,

original: 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol na rkyen rnams bya ba dang mi ldan pa nyid yin par 'dod na'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol na rkyen rnams bya ba dang mi ldan pa nyid yin par 'dod na'o //
translated: if you assert that conditions do not possess activity prior to the arising of the effect,

original: gal te de ltar 'dod na slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis de dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'dod na slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis de dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: then the master Ä€ryadeva refutes that as follows:

original: 'dir bshad pa /ğŸ”½bya dang mi ldan rkyen ma yin //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / bya dang mi ldan rkyen ma yin //
translated: Here he explains:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That which does not possess activity is not a condition.

original: 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase â€œthat which generates an effectâ€ is left incomplete.

original: tshig ces bya ba ni gang gi don yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin pas /
analyzed: tshig ces bya ba ni gang gi don yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin pas /
translated: â€œWordâ€ means that which completely fulfills its meaning.

original: bya dang mi ldan rkyen ma yin //
analyzed: bya dang mi ldan rkyen ma yin //
translated: It is not a condition if it does not perform its function.

original: zhes bya ba brjod du zin kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba brjod du zin kyang /
translated: Although this is stated,

original: ji srid du 'bras bu skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshig ma brjod pa de srid kyi bar du skye ba 'gog pa'i don yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji srid du 'bras bu skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshig ma brjod pa de srid kyi bar du skye ba 'gog pa'i don yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
translated: as long as the word â€œthat which generates an effectâ€ is not stated, the meaning of the refutation of arising is not completely fulfilled. Therefore,

original: bya dang mi ldan rkyen ma yin //
analyzed: bya dang mi ldan rkyen ma yin //
translated: it is not a condition if it does not perform its function.

original: zhes brjod pa'i 'og tu 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba smras te /ğŸ”½bya ba dang mi ldan pa gang gi rkyen ma yin zhe na 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i rkyen ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa'i 'og tu 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba smras te / bya ba dang mi ldan pa gang gi rkyen ma yin zhe na 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i rkyen ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: After stating â€œit is not a condition if it does not perform its function,â€ the word â€œthat which generates an effectâ€ is stated as a supplement.ğŸ”½What is it that is not a condition if it does not perform its function? It is not a condition that generates an effect.

original: ci'i phyir bya ba dang mi ldan pa 'bras bu skyed par byed pa rkyen ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bya ba dang mi ldan pa 'bras bu skyed par byed pa rkyen ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that that which does not perform its function, that is, that which generates an effect, is not a condition?

original: de'i phyir bya ba dang mi ldan zhes bya ba ni brjod par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bskyed pa'i bya bas stong pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bya ba dang mi ldan zhes bya ba ni brjod par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bskyed pa'i bya bas stong pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, â€œdevoid of actionâ€ means â€œempty of the action of generating the effect that is desired.â€

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: rkyen bya ba dang mi ldan pa rnams ni brjod par 'dod @178b pa dang bsam par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu so sor nges pa bskyed pa'i bya bas stong zhing 'bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rkyen bya ba dang mi ldan pa rnams ni brjod par 'dod @178b pa dang bsam par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu so sor nges pa bskyed pa'i bya bas stong zhing 'bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: Those conditions that are devoid of action are empty of the action of generating the effect that is desired and intended.

original: 'dir mtshan nyid ni de yin no //
analyzed: 'dir mtshan nyid ni de yin no //
translated: This is the definition of a condition.

original: gang dag ji skad bstan pa de dag ni de skyed par byed pa ma yin te des stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang dag ji skad bstan pa de dag ni de skyed par byed pa ma yin te des stong pa'i phyir /
translated: Those that are not taught to be conditions do not generate that effect, because they are devoid of that action.

original: dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes de skad bstan zin to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes de skad bstan zin to zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, it is like those that are other than that.ğŸ”½This is what has been taught.

original: 'dir yang gang dag ci skad bstan pa de dag ni zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: 'dir yang gang dag ci skad bstan pa de dag ni zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /
translated: Here, â€œthose that are not taught to be conditionsâ€ is the subject.

original: de skyed par byed pa ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yin /
analyzed: de skyed par byed pa ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yin /
translated: â€œDo not generate that effectâ€ is the predicate.

original: des stong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
analyzed: des stong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
translated: The reason is â€œbecause they are empty of that.â€

original: dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di dpe yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di dpe yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The example is â€œlike something else.â€

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rkyen gang dag 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i bya bas stong pa ji skad bstan pa de dag ni 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin te skye ba'i bya ba des stong pa'i phyir
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rkyen gang dag 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i bya bas stong pa ji skad bstan pa de dag ni 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin te skye ba'i bya ba des stong pa'i phyir
translated: Those conditions of form, etc., that are empty of the activity of producing the effect, the visual consciousness, as was explained, do not produce the effect, the visual consciousness, because they are empty of the activity of arising.

original: ro dper na de las gzhan pa'i rkyen rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ro dper na de las gzhan pa'i rkyen rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like something else, such as the conditions of the cause, the thread, etc.

original: de bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni sngar don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni sngar don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams de dag gi rkyen gzhan dag las skye ba med de gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: â€œThat has been explainedâ€ means that previously it was explained that ultimately the internal sense bases are not produced from other conditions, because they are other, like a pot.

original: yang na don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod par mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na don dam par gzhan brjod par 'dod par mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched 'grub par byed pa dag rkyen ma yin par nges te gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, if you assert that they are other ultimately, then the eyes and so on that produce the internal sense sources are definitely not conditions because they are other.

original: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no zhes de dag dgag pa'i rigs pas de bstan zin to //
analyzed: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin no zhes de dag dgag pa'i rigs pas de bstan zin to //
translated: For example, it is like the conditions of thread and so on that are the causes of cloth. The reasoning that refutes that has already been presented.

original: 'on te bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that they possess activity?

original: zhes bya ba ni skye bar smra ba dag la brtag pa'i gal gnyis bris pa de la 'on te brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod do zhe na ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skye bar smra ba dag la brtag pa'i gal gnyis bris pa de la 'on te brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod do zhe na ste /
translated: This is written in response to the assertion of the Proponents of Arising from Other that the two analyses are written in response to the assertion that conditions possess activity prior to the arising of the effect.

original: 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol na rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yin no zhe na'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol na rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yin no zhe na'o //
translated: If you say that prior to the arising of the effect, conditions possess activity,

original: gal te de ltar 'dod na slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis de dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'dod na slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis de dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: then in order to refute that, the master NÄgÄrjuna said:

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: bya ba ldan nam 'on te na //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bya ba ldan nam 'on te na //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Do they possess activity or not?

original: ma yin zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: â€œIt is not soâ€ is the topic.ğŸ”½The word â€œorâ€ has the meaning of an alternative.

original: 'on te na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam par brtag pa'i don to zhes bya ba ni rkyen bya ba dang ldan pa rnams la yang 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa med la /
analyzed: 'on te na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam par brtag pa'i don to zhes bya ba ni rkyen bya ba dang ldan pa rnams la yang 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa med la /
translated: The conditions that possess activity do not have the power to generate an effect,

original: rkyen bya ba dang mi ldan pa rnams la yang 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa med do zhes rnam pa gnyi gar @179a * //
analyzed: rkyen bya ba dang mi ldan pa rnams la yang 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa med do zhes rnam pa gnyi gar @179a * //
translated: and the conditions that do not possess activity also do not have the power to generate an effect.ğŸ”½Both of these alternatives

original: yang skye ba dgag pa brtag pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang skye ba dgag pa brtag pa'i don to //
translated: are the topic of the refutation of arising.

original: de'i phyir 'di la rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du ni 'bras bu skyed pas bstan pa yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du ni 'bras bu skyed pas bstan pa yin na /
translated: Therefore, in this context, the conditions that possess activity are said to generate an effect.

original: de yang 'bras bu skye ba la mngon du phyogs par ma gyur pa la ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu skye ba la mngon du phyogs par ma gyur pa la ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: But since that effect does not exist when it is about to arise, it is not accepted. Therefore the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: â€œIn this contextâ€ means â€œin the explanation.â€

original: rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du ni zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du sgrub pa ni'o //
analyzed: rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du ni zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du sgrub pa ni'o //
translated: â€œThe conditions are established as having activityâ€ means that the conditions such as the eye are established as having activity.

original: 'bras bu bskyed pas zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba skyed pa ni 'bras bu skyed pa ste des so //
analyzed: 'bras bu bskyed pas zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba skyed pa ni 'bras bu skyed pa ste des so //
translated: â€œBy producing an effectâ€ means that the eye consciousness, which is the effect, is produced conventionally.

original: bstan pa yin na zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu skyed pa des bstan cig sgrub pa yin ste /
analyzed: bstan pa yin na zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu skyed pa des bstan cig sgrub pa yin ste /
translated: â€œIf it is taughtâ€ means that it is taught by the production of the effect.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu skyed pa mthong nas rkyen rnams la bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du rjes su dpog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu skyed pa mthong nas rkyen rnams la bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du rjes su dpog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because, having seen the production of the effect, one infers that the conditions have activity.

original: de yang 'bras bu bskyed pa la mngon du phyogs par ma gyur pa la ni mi 'dod pa zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu bskyed pa la mngon du phyogs par ma gyur pa la ni mi 'dod pa zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: â€œAnd that is not accepted if it is not directed toward the production of the effectâ€ means the following.

original: rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du sgrub pa 'bras bu skyed pas bstan cing sgrub pa de yang ji srid du 'bras bu skye ba la mngon du phyogs par ma gyur pa de srid du mig la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams la bya ba dang ldan pağŸ”½nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du sgrub pa 'bras bu skyed pas bstan cing sgrub pa de yang ji srid du 'bras bu skye ba la mngon du phyogs par ma gyur pa de srid du mig la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams la bya ba dang ldan pa nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: The proof that conditions possess activity is indicated by the production of effects. Moreover, as long as the effect has not actually arisen, the conditions such as the eye do not possess activity.ğŸ”½Since you do not assert that conditions possess activity,

original: rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du mi 'dod pas so //
analyzed: rkyen rnams bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du mi 'dod pas so //
translated: the meaning of the reason is not established.ğŸ”½Since the reason is not established, the example is also not established.ğŸ”½The meaning of the example is not established.ğŸ”½The meaning of the example is not established.ğŸ”½The meaning of the example is not established.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pa des na skye bar smra ba dag gi sngar mig la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa kho na yin te /ğŸ”½bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na sa bon dang sa dang chu dang me dang rlung la sogs pas myu gu skyed par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pa des na skye bar smra ba dag gi sngar mig la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa kho na yin te /ğŸ”½bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na sa bon dang sa dang chu dang me dang rlung la sogs pas myu gu skyed par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the example is not established.ğŸ”½The meaning of the example is not established.ğŸ”½The meaning of the example is not established.ğŸ”½The meaning of the example is not established.ğŸ”½The meaning of the example is not established.ğŸ”½The meaning of the example is not established.ğŸ”½The meaning of the example is not established.ğŸ”½The meaning of the example is not established.ğŸ”½The meaning of the example is not established.ğŸ”½The meaning of the example is not established.ğŸ”½The meaning of the example is not established.ğŸ”½The meaning of the example is not established.ğŸ”½The meaning of the example is not established.ğŸ”½The meaning of the example is not established.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa sngar smras pa rnams la rtog ge phyi mas gnod par 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa sngar smras pa rnams la rtog ge phyi mas gnod par 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub pa nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason stated by you, â€œbecause they possess activity,â€ is not established.

original: dper na sgra la ming gis bzung ba nyid med pa de bzhin du rkyen rnams la yang bya ba dang ldan pa nyid med pas de'i phyir khyod kyi gtan tshigs kyi don kyang grub pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: dper na sgra la ming gis bzung ba nyid med pa de bzhin du rkyen rnams la yang bya ba dang ldan pa nyid med pas de'i phyir khyod kyi gtan tshigs kyi don kyang grub pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Just as sound does not exist as apprehended by names, so too conditions do not possess activity. Therefore, the meaning of your reason is not established.

original: kho bo'i rjes su dpag pa sngar smras pa rnams la yang khyod kyi rtog ge phyi mas gnod par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: kho bo'i rjes su dpag pa sngar smras pa rnams la yang khyod kyi rtog ge phyi mas gnod par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: And also, the former inferences stated by us are not undermined by your later arguments.

original: mdo sde pa dag na re /
analyzed: mdo sde pa dag na re /
translated: Sautrantikas say:

original: 'bras bu bskyed pa'i dus kho na rkyen bya ba @179b dang ldan pa rnams gcig la gcig phan 'dogs pas rkyen nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu bskyed pa'i dus kho na rkyen bya ba @179b dang ldan pa rnams gcig la gcig phan 'dogs pas rkyen nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: At the time of generating the effect, conditions that possess activity mutually benefit each other and are accepted as conditions.

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Therefore the meaning of the reason is not unestablished.

original: rtog ge phyi ma med pa yang ma yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir mdo sde pa dag na re /
analyzed: rtog ge phyi ma med pa yang ma yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir mdo sde pa dag na re /
translated: But it is not that the latter mode of analysis does not exist.

original: khyed dbu ma pas bsams pa /
analyzed: khyed dbu ma pas bsams pa /
translated: The Sautrantikas say:

original: gang gis 'bras bu skye ba la mngon du phyogs par ma gyur pa'i rkyen rnams la bya ba dang ldan pa nyid med pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin no zhes smras pa de ni /
analyzed: gang gis 'bras bu skye ba la mngon du phyogs par ma gyur pa'i rkyen rnams la bya ba dang ldan pa nyid med pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin no zhes smras pa de ni /
translated: You Madhyamikas think that since conditions do not possess activity prior to the production of the effect, the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: gang gis de skad khas blangs pa de la skyon der 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gis de skad khas blangs pa de la skyon der 'gyur gyi /
translated: But that fault applies to those who accept that,ğŸ”½but we do not say that conditions possess activity at the time of the production of the effect.

original: kho bos ni 'bras bu skye ba'i dus kho na na rkyen bya ba dang ldan pa yul dang yul can gyi dngos por gnas pa rnams gcig la gcig phan 'dogs pas /
analyzed: kho bos ni 'bras bu skye ba'i dus kho na na rkyen bya ba dang ldan pa yul dang yul can gyi dngos por gnas pa rnams gcig la gcig phan 'dogs pas /
translated: We say that conditions that possess activity exist as the object and subject of the effect at the time of the effect's production, since they mutually benefit each other.

original: des na 'bras bu de skye ba'i gnas skabs kho na na rkyen mig la sogs pa rnams bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yin pas rkyen nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir kho bo cag mdo sde pa dag gi gtan tshigs kyi don bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir
analyzed: des na 'bras bu de skye ba'i gnas skabs kho na na rkyen mig la sogs pa rnams bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yin pas rkyen nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir kho bo cag mdo sde pa dag gi gtan tshigs kyi don bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir
translated: Therefore, the meaning of our reason, â€œbecause they possess activity,â€

original: zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid de yang ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid de yang ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: is not unestablished.

original: 'di ltar de'i tshe na rkyen rnams la bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i tshe na rkyen rnams la bya ba dang ldan pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at that time the conditions possess activity.

original: des na khyed kyi rjes su dpag pa sngar smras pa rnams la kho bo'i rtog ge phyi mas gnod par 'gyur ba med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: des na khyed kyi rjes su dpag pa sngar smras pa rnams la kho bo'i rtog ge phyi mas gnod par 'gyur ba med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the previous inferences that you stated are not unrefuted by our later arguments.

original: 'di ltar kho bo'i sgrub pa mig la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo'i sgrub pa mig la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa kho na yin te /
translated: Because our proof is that the eye and so on are producers of the eye consciousness alone.

original: bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na sa bon dang / sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung la sogs pa myu gu skyed par byed pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de la gnod pa med pas de'i phyir skye ba grub bo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na sa bon dang / sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung la sogs pa myu gu skyed par byed pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de la gnod pa med pas de'i phyir skye ba grub bo zhes zer ro //
translated: Because it possesses activity, like a seed, earth, water, fire, wind, etc. are producers of a sprout.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the master Ä€ryadeva explains here:

original: 'di dag la brten skye bas na //
analyzed: 'di dag la brten skye bas na //
translated: Because it arises in dependence on these,

original: de'i phyir 'di dag rkyen ces grag / ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag rkyen ces grag / ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: therefore they are known as conditions.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa 'dis ni mdo sde pa'i phyogs snga ma de sun 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa 'dis ni mdo sde pa'i phyogs snga ma de sun 'byin par byed do //
translated: This verse refutes the former SautrÄntika position.

original: 'bru la sogs pa 'di dag la brten nas zhes bya ba ni sa bon dang sa chu dang me dang rlung la sogs pa'i rkyen 'di dag la 'di brten cing gnas nas so //
analyzed: 'bru la sogs pa 'di dag la brten nas zhes bya ba ni sa bon dang sa chu dang me dang rlung la sogs pa'i rkyen 'di dag la 'di brten cing gnas nas so //
translated: â€œIn dependence on theseâ€ means that in dependence on these conditions of a seed, earth, water, fire, wind, etc., it arises and endures.

original: 'bras bu skye bas na zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba skye zhing 'byung bas na'o //ğŸ”½de'i phyir 'bru la sogs pa 'di dag khyed don dam par rkyen yin par 'dod ces par grag go zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'bru la @180a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye bas na zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba skye zhing 'byung bas na'o // de'i phyir 'bru la sogs pa 'di dag khyed don dam par rkyen yin par 'dod ces par grag go zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'bru la @180a * //
translated: Because the effect arises means because the effect called the sprout arises and occurs.

original: sogs pa 'di dag la brten nas 'bras bu skye ba de'i phyir 'bru la sogs pa 'di dag khyed mdo sde pa dag don dam par rkyen yin par 'dod ces grag go zhes mdo sde pa dag nyid kyi gzhung bstan pa yin no //ğŸ”½grag ces bya ba'i sgra'i sbyor ba ni 'dir slob dpon mi bzhed par ston pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sogs pa 'di dag la brten nas 'bras bu skye ba de'i phyir 'bru la sogs pa 'di dag khyed mdo sde pa dag don dam par rkyen yin par 'dod ces grag go zhes mdo sde pa dag nyid kyi gzhung bstan pa yin no // grag ces bya ba'i sgra'i sbyor ba ni 'dir slob dpon mi bzhed par ston pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, these seeds, etc., are asserted by you to be conditions ultimately means that because the effect arises in dependence on these seeds, etc., therefore, these seeds, etc., are asserted by you Sautrantikas to be conditions ultimately.ğŸ”½This is the Sautrantika's own position.

original: slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas nyid de ltar mi bzhed par ston pa'i sgra yin te /
analyzed: slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas nyid de ltar mi bzhed par ston pa'i sgra yin te /
translated: The application of the term is said to be not accepted by the master here means that the term is said not to be accepted by the master Nagarjuna himself.

original: grag ces bya ba dang / lo zhes bya ba dang / ce'o zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa rnyed pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grag ces bya ba dang / lo zhes bya ba dang / ce'o zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa rnyed pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words â€œsound,â€ â€œgrain,â€ and â€œthisâ€ are for the purpose of finding the assertion of others.ğŸ”½Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / ji srid mi skye de srid du //
analyzed: de'i phyir / ji srid mi skye de srid du //
translated: As long as it does not arise,

original: 'di dag rkyen min ji ltar min //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di dag rkyen min ji ltar min // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: how could they not be nonconditions?

original: 'bras bu ji srid du 'bru la sogs pa 'di dag rkyen ma yin par yang ji ltar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu ji srid du 'bru la sogs pa 'di dag rkyen ma yin par yang ji ltar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: How could these conditions, such as grain, not be nonconditions as long as the effect does not arise?ğŸ”½Because the effect arises in dependence on these conditions, such as grain, it is well known that you assert that these conditions, such as grain, are ultimately conditions.

original: gang gi phyir rkyen 'bru la sogs pa 'di dag la brten nas 'bras bu skye bas 'bru la sogs pa 'di dag khyed don dam par rkyen yin par 'dod ces grags pa de'i phyir ji srid du rkyen 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba mi skye ba de
analyzed: gang gi phyir rkyen 'bru la sogs pa 'di dag la brten nas 'bras bu skye bas 'bru la sogs pa 'di dag khyed don dam par rkyen yin par 'dod ces grags pa de'i phyir ji srid du rkyen 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba mi skye ba de
translated: Therefore, as long as the effect, such as the sprout, does not arise,

original: srid du / 'bru la sogs pa 'di dag rkyen ma yin par yang ji ltar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: srid du / 'bru la sogs pa 'di dag rkyen ma yin par yang ji ltar mi 'gyur te /
translated: how could these conditions, such as grain, not be nonconditions?

original: rkyen ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: rkyen ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur bas /
translated: They would be nonconditions.

original: don dam par de dag las skye ba med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: don dam par de dag las skye ba med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is that ultimately they do not arise from those conditions.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag la rkyen nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag la rkyen nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the statement â€œThey do not have the nature of conditionsâ€ is as follows.

original: ji srid du 'bras bu mi skye ba de srid du 'bru la sogs pa 'di dag la rkyen nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji srid du 'bras bu mi skye ba de srid du 'bru la sogs pa 'di dag la rkyen nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: As long as the effect does not arise, these conditions such as the seed do not have the nature of conditions.

original: don de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify that meaning,

original: 'jig rten la grags pa'i khungs dper bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten la grags pa'i khungs dper bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: he gives an example that is accepted in the world.

original: dper na ji srid du mi klog ba de srid du mkhas pa ma yin par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na ji srid du mi klog ba de srid du mkhas pa ma yin par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He says, â€œFor example, as long as a person does not read, why would he not be a non-scholar?â€

original: dper na ji srid du khyod nyid klog pa la sogs pa shes pa'i shugs kyis 'du byed skyed par mi byed pa de srid du mkhas pa ma yin pa blun po kho nar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na ji srid du khyod nyid klog pa la sogs pa shes pa'i shugs kyis 'du byed skyed par mi byed pa de srid du mkhas pa ma yin pa blun po kho nar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, as long as you do not generate the formative forces through the power of knowing how to read and so on, you would be a non-scholar, a fool.

original: 'dir yang 'bru la sogs pa rkyen rnams ji srid du 'bras bu myu gu skyed par mi byed pa de srid du rkyen ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur bas de dag la skyen ba med do //
analyzed: 'dir yang 'bru la sogs pa rkyen rnams ji srid du 'bras bu myu gu skyed par mi byed pa de srid du rkyen ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur bas de dag la skyen ba med do //
translated: Here also, as long as the conditions such as the seed do not generate the effect, the sprout, for that long they are not conditions. Therefore they do not generate it.

original: ci ste 'di skad ces kho bo cag 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol na rkyen rnams rkyen nyid du khas mi len pas de'i phyir mi gnod do zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci ste 'di skad ces kho bo cag 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol na rkyen rnams rkyen nyid du khas mi len pas de'i phyir mi gnod do zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: But if you say, â€œWe do not assert that conditions are conditions prior to the generation of the effect, therefore this does not undermine our position,â€

original: ji ste mdo sde pa dag 'di @180b skad ces dbu ma pas ji skad du /
analyzed: ji ste mdo sde pa dag 'di @180b skad ces dbu ma pas ji skad du /
translated: then the SautrÄntikas would say, â€œThe Followers of the Middle Way say:

original: ji srid mi skye de srid du //
analyzed: ji srid mi skye de srid du //
translated: As long as it does not arise,

original: 'di dag rkyen min ji ltar min //
analyzed: 'di dag rkyen min ji ltar min //
translated: how could these not be nonconditions?

original: zhes bya bas 'bras bu ji srid du mi skye ba de srid du 'bru la sogs pa 'di dag rkyen ma yin par yang ji ltar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas 'bras bu ji srid du mi skye ba de srid du 'bru la sogs pa 'di dag rkyen ma yin par yang ji ltar mi 'gyur te /
translated: How could theseâ€”the seed and so onâ€”not be nonconditions for as long as the effect does not arise?

original: 'di dag rkyen nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes gang smras pa des ni kho bo cag la sun phyung ba ci yang med de /
analyzed: 'di dag rkyen nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes gang smras pa des ni kho bo cag la sun phyung ba ci yang med de /
translated: The meaning of the words â€œthese are not conditionsâ€ is that they are not conditions.

original: kho bo cag ni 'bras bu myu gu skye ba'i sngon rol na 'bru la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams rkyen nyid yin par khas mi len gyi /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni 'bras bu myu gu skye ba'i sngon rol na 'bru la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams rkyen nyid yin par khas mi len gyi /
translated: We do not accept that conditions such as a seed are conditions prior to the arising of the effect, the sprout.

original: gang gi tshe 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na de dag rkyen nyid yin par 'dod pas de'i phyir khyod kyi sun 'byin pa de kho bo cag la mi gnod do zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na de dag rkyen nyid yin par 'dod pas de'i phyir khyod kyi sun 'byin pa de kho bo cag la mi gnod do zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: But since we assert that they are conditions at the time the effect arises, therefore your refutation does not undermine us.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis mi gnod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis mi gnod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says, â€œIt is not non-harmful,â€ and so on.

original: mdo sde pa na re sun 'byin pa de kho bo'i phyogs la mi gnod ces zer ba de mi gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mdo sde pa na re sun 'byin pa de kho bo'i phyogs la mi gnod ces zer ba de mi gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: The Sautrantikas say, â€œThat refutation does not undermine our position.â€ That is not non-harmful.

original: dgag pa gnyis yod na skabs kyi don go bar 'gyur bas 'di ltar de ni khyod kyi phyogs la gnod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dgag pa gnyis yod na skabs kyi don go bar 'gyur bas 'di ltar de ni khyod kyi phyogs la gnod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since the meaning of the context is understood when there are two negations, the meaning is that it is only harmful to your position.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gi phyir 'dir rkyen rnams 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol tu rkyen ma yin pa nyid du bstan pas 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na yang rkyen ma yin pa nyid du bstan bcos mdzad pas ston par bzhed do zhes bya ba smras te ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir rkyen rnams 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol tu rkyen ma yin pa nyid du bstan pas 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na yang rkyen ma yin pa nyid du bstan bcos mdzad pas ston par bzhed do zhes bya ba smras te ;
translated: Because here the treatise master wishes to teach that conditions are not conditions even at the time of the arising of the effect, since he has already taught that they are not conditions prior to the arising of the effect.

original: gang gi phyir khyod kyis 'dir 'bru la sogs pa rkyen rnams 'bras bu myu gu skye ba'i sngon rol du rkyen ma yin pa nyid du bstan par byas pas de'i yon tan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyod kyis 'dir 'bru la sogs pa rkyen rnams 'bras bu myu gu skye ba'i sngon rol du rkyen ma yin pa nyid du bstan par byas pas de'i yon tan ni 'di yin te /
translated: Because you have taught here that conditions such as seeds are not conditions prior to the arising of the effect, the sprout, this is its benefit:

original: 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na yang de dag rkyen ma yin pa nyid du ston par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na yang de dag rkyen ma yin pa nyid du ston par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The treatise master wishes to teach that they are not conditions even at the time of the arising of the effect.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas ston par bzhed do zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas ston par bzhed do zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: The phrase â€œthe treatise master wishes to teachâ€ indicates the following.

original: rkyen gang dag la 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol na rkyen nyid med pa de dag la ni 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na yang rkyen med par bstan bcos mdzad pa slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas de ltar ston par bzhed cing de ltar sgrub par
analyzed: rkyen gang dag la 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol na rkyen nyid med pa de dag la ni 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na yang rkyen med par bstan bcos mdzad pa slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas de ltar ston par bzhed cing de ltar sgrub par
translated: The author of the treatise, the venerable NÄgÄrjuna, asserts that he teaches this and he intends to prove this.

original: dgongs so // de'i phyir ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: dgongs so // de'i phyir ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: don dam par 'bru la sogs pa ni myu gu skye ba'i dus na rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te de nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par 'bru la sogs pa ni myu gu skye ba'i dus na rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te de nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Ultimately, at the time of the arising of the sprout, the seed and so on are not by nature conditions because they are not to be expressed as such.ğŸ”½For example, they are like those at the prior moment.

original: dper na skad cig snga ma la de dag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te 'dir yang 'bru la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la //
analyzed: dper na skad cig snga ma la de dag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te 'dir yang 'bru la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la //
translated: Here the subject is â€œthe seed and so on.â€

original: myu gu skye ba'i dus na @181a * //
analyzed: myu gu skye ba'i dus na @181a * //
translated: â€œAt the time of the arising of the sproutâ€

original: rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
analyzed: rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin /
translated: is the predicate.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin /
translated: Because they are not to be described as the same or different.ğŸ”½For example, they are like themselves in the previous moment.

original: dper na skad cig snga ma la de dag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na skad cig snga ma la de dag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar ro //
translated: This is how the example is applied.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: mdo sde pas bsams pa'i 'bru la sogs pa ni myu gu skye ba'i dus na don dam par rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mdo sde pas bsams pa'i 'bru la sogs pa ni myu gu skye ba'i dus na don dam par rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: The barley seed and so on that are intended by the SautrÄntika are not ultimately the nature of conditions at the time of the arising of the sprout.ğŸ”½Because when the barley seed and so on are analyzed, the sprout is not seen, it is not to be described as the same or different.

original: 'di ltar 'bru la sogs pa dag la dpyad na myu gu mi snang bas de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir te myu gu gang yin pa de nyid 'bru la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba lta bur de nyid duğŸ”½yang brjod par bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bru la sogs pa dag la dpyad na myu gu mi snang bas de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir te myu gu gang yin pa de nyid 'bru la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba lta bur de nyid du yang brjod par bya ba ma yin la /
translated: It is not to be described as the same in the sense that the sprout itself is the barley seed and so on.

original: 'bru la sogs pa las myu gu skye bas 'bru la sogs pa las myu gu gzhan ma yin pas gzhan nyid brjod par bya ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bru la sogs pa las myu gu skye bas 'bru la sogs pa las myu gu gzhan ma yin pas gzhan nyid brjod par bya ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is also not to be described as different because the sprout arises from the barley seed and so on, and the sprout is not different from the barley seed and so on.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: Because it is inexpressible in terms of sameness or difference.

original: dper na skad cig snga ma la de dag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ma skyes pa'i skad cig snga ma la 'bru la sogs pa de dag nyid bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na skad cig snga ma la de dag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ma skyes pa'i skad cig snga ma la 'bru la sogs pa de dag nyid bzhin te /
translated: For example, they are like those very same seeds in the previous moment when the effect has not yet arisen.

original: dper na 'bras bu ma skyes pa'i skad cig snga ma la 'bru la sogs pa de dag nyid rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na yang 'bru la sogs pa de dag rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu ma skyes pa'i skad cig snga ma la 'bru la sogs pa de dag nyid rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du 'bras bu skye ba'i dus na yang 'bru la sogs pa de dag rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no
translated: Just as those very same seeds, etc., in the previous moment when the effect has not yet arisen are not conditions by nature, so too those very same seeds, etc., at the time the effect has arisen are not conditions by nature.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /'dis ni dngos po rnams bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis las skye ba med do zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /'dis ni dngos po rnams bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis las skye ba med do zhes bya ba de la /
translated: This means that things do not arise from self, other, or both.

original: gang dag 'di skad ces de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dag 'di skad ces de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: In response to this, some say, â€œThis is the establishment of what is already established.

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu gnyis kyang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu gnyis kyang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the effect and the cause are not to be described as identical or different.ğŸ”½Even though they are not to be described, they are only producers of the effect.

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin du zin kyang de dag 'bras bu skyed par byed pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba de dag kyang de bzhin du dgag par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin du zin kyang de dag 'bras bu skyed par byed pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba de dag kyang de bzhin du dgag par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is what is to be refuted.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang rgyu gnyis de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi sngar bstan pa 'dis ni'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang rgyu gnyis de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi sngar bstan pa 'dis ni'o //
translated: This means that by this reason, which is the characteristic of the effect and the cause not being to be described as identical or different, which was previously taught,

original: 'dis ci zhig dgag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis ci zhig dgag par bya zhe na /
translated: what is to be refuted?

original: dbu ma pas sngar bsgrubs pa de dag la gang dag skye ba sgrub pa'i phyir dbu ma pa'i sgrub pa de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes zer ba de dag kyang de bzhin du dgag par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dbu ma pas sngar bsgrubs pa de dag la gang dag skye ba sgrub pa'i phyir dbu ma pa'i sgrub pa de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes zer ba de dag kyang de bzhin du dgag par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Those who say that the Madhyamakaâ€™s previous proofs are a proof of what is already established because they prove arising, they are to be refuted in the same way.

original: dbu ma pas sngar bsgrubs pa de yang ma yin pa de'i phyir dngos po rnams @181b bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis las skye ba med do zhes bya ba de la zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dbu ma pas sngar bsgrubs pa de yang ma yin pa de'i phyir dngos po rnams @181b bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis las skye ba med do zhes bya ba de la zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since the Madhyamaka has already established that, therefore, it is said that â€œthings do not arise from self, other, or both.â€

original: dbu ma pas sngar dngos po rnams skye ba med par dam bcas pa'i spyi bkod pa'i skabs su dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med pa dang gzhan las skye ba med pa dang / gnyis las skye ba med do zhes bsgrubs pa de la'o ;
analyzed: dbu ma pas sngar dngos po rnams skye ba med par dam bcas pa'i spyi bkod pa'i skabs su dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med pa dang gzhan las skye ba med pa dang / gnyis las skye ba med do zhes bsgrubs pa de la'o ;
translated: When the Madhyamaka previously set forth the general thesis that things do not arise, it established that things do not arise from self, do not arise from other, and do not arise from both.

original: / de la gang dag skye ba sgrub pa dag ji skad zer zhe na /
analyzed: / de la gang dag skye ba sgrub pa dag ji skad zer zhe na /
translated: In that regard, what do those who prove arising say?

original: de'i phyir gang dag 'di skad ces de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang dag 'di skad ces de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, some say, â€œThis is a proof of what has already been established.

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu gnyis kyang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu gnyis kyang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not tenable to say that the effect and the cause are the same or different.

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin du zin kyang de dag 'bras bu skyed par byed pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin du zin kyang de dag 'bras bu skyed par byed pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Even though they are not expressible, they are only producers of effects.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gang dag skye ba sgrub pa'i phyir dbu ma pa la 'di skad ces /
analyzed: gang dag skye ba sgrub pa'i phyir dbu ma pa la 'di skad ces /
translated: In order to establish arising, they say to the MÄdhyamika:

original: gal te 'bras bu mig la sogs pa'am myu gu la sogs pa dang / rgyu mer mer po la sogs pa'am sa bon la sogs pa dag gcig pa nyid yin par 'gyur na ni des na bdag las skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu mig la sogs pa'am myu gu la sogs pa dang / rgyu mer mer po la sogs pa'am sa bon la sogs pa dag gcig pa nyid yin par 'gyur na ni des na bdag las skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: If the effect, such as the eye, and so on, or the sprout, and so on, and the cause, such as the coagulated milk, and so on, or the seed, and so on, were identical, then it would be arising from itself.

original: 'on te gzhan yin par gyur na ni des na gzhan las skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan yin par gyur na ni des na gzhan las skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if they were different, then it would be arising from another.

original: 'on te 'bras bu dang rgyu gnyis gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid yin par gyur na ni nges na gnyis las skye bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med pa dang gzhan las skye ba med pa dang / gnyis las skye ba med do zhes bya ba de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu dang rgyu gnyis gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid yin par gyur na ni nges na gnyis las skye bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir dngos po rnams bdag las skye ba med pa dang gzhan las skye ba med pa dang / gnyis las skye ba med do zhes bya ba de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: But if the effect and cause were both the same and different, then arising from both would be certain. Therefore, â€œThings do not arise from themselves, nor do they arise from another, nor do they arise from both, nor do they arise without a cause.â€ This is an argument that proves what is already established for us.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu gnyis kyang de nyid dang gzhan nyid gnyi gar brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu gnyis kyang de nyid dang gzhan nyid gnyi gar brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect and cause are not described as being the same or different.

original: gang gi phyir de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang gnyi gar brjod par bya ba ma yin du zin kyang rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa dang sa bon la sogs pa de dag gi 'bras bu mig la sogs pa dang / myu gu la sogs pa skyed par byed pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang gnyi gar brjod par bya ba ma yin du zin kyang rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa dang sa bon la sogs pa de dag gi 'bras bu mig la sogs pa dang / myu gu la sogs pa skyed par byed pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Even though they are not described as being the same or different, those conditions such as the embryonic germ disc and so on and the seeds and so on are the causes that generate their effects such as the eye and so on and the sprouts and so on.

original: de dag kyang de bzhin du dgag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di skad bstan te /ğŸ”½mdo sde pa dag rkyen mer mer po dang 'bru la sogs pa dag 'bras bu skye ba'i gnas skabs na rkyen de dag khas len pa de ni don dam par mer mer po la sogs pa dang 'bru la sogs pa ni mig la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin du dgag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di skad bstan te / mdo sde pa dag rkyen mer mer po dang 'bru la sogs pa dag 'bras bu skye ba'i gnas skabs na rkyen de dag khas len pa de ni don dam par mer mer po la sogs pa dang 'bru la sogs pa ni mig la sogs pa dang /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: myu gu skye ba'i dus na rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: myu gu skye ba'i dus na rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: Sautrantikas assert that at the time when the effect arises, the conditions such as the sprout and so on are conditions, but ultimately, the sprout and so on are not the entity of the conditions such as the eye and so on.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they cannot be said to be the same or different,

original: dper na skad cig snga ma la de dag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba 'dis de dag kyang de @182a * //
analyzed: dper na skad cig snga ma la de dag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba 'dis de dag kyang de @182a * //
translated: just like those conditions themselves in the previous moment.

original: bzhin du dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin du dgag par bya'o //
translated: This refutes them in the same way.

original: skye bar smra ba dag la yang phyir zlog par byed de zhes bya ba ni de ltar bkag kyang skye bar smra ba dag kyang skye bar sgrub pa'i phyir rkyen rnams 'bras bu skyed pa kho na yin no zhes phyir rgol ba nyid du gnas par byed pa
analyzed: skye bar smra ba dag la yang phyir zlog par byed de zhes bya ba ni de ltar bkag kyang skye bar smra ba dag kyang skye bar sgrub pa'i phyir rkyen rnams 'bras bu skyed pa kho na yin no zhes phyir rgol ba nyid du gnas par byed pa
translated: Even though it is refuted in this way, those who assert arising still prove arising, and they remain as opponents, saying: â€œConditions are only producers of effects.â€

original: yin no // don dam par de dag gi skye ba rnams ni nang gi skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa kho na yin te rkyen yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yin no // don dam par de dag gi skye ba rnams ni nang gi skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa kho na yin te rkyen yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the ultimate, their arising is only the producer of internal sources, because they are conditions.ğŸ”½For example, it is like barley, etc., being the producer of sprouts.

original: dper na 'bru la sogs pas myu gu skyed par byed pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di la bsam pa gang yin zhe na /ğŸ”½rkyen de dag la bya ba dang ldan pa nyid ma grub pas bya ba dang ldan pa las skye ba med du zin kyang /
analyzed: dper na 'bru la sogs pas myu gu skyed par byed pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di la bsam pa gang yin zhe na / rkyen de dag la bya ba dang ldan pa nyid ma grub pas bya ba dang ldan pa las skye ba med du zin kyang /
translated: What is the intention of this?ğŸ”½Although arising does not exist from that which possesses activity, since those conditions are not established as possessing activity, arising exists from conditions alone, because they are conditions.

original: rkyen nyid yod pas rkyen las skye ba kho nar 'gyur ro snyam nas 'dir yang rnam pa gzhan gyis skye ba sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: rkyen nyid yod pas rkyen las skye ba kho nar 'gyur ro snyam nas 'dir yang rnam pa gzhan gyis skye ba sgrub par byed do //
translated: Thinking in this way, arising is proven in another way.

original: 'dir yang de dag gi rkyen rnams ni zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang de dag gi rkyen rnams ni zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin te /
translated: Here, â€œtheir conditionsâ€ is the subject.

original: mig la sogs pa de dag gi rkyen las dang nyon mongs pa dang mer mer po la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa de dag gi rkyen las dang nyon mongs pa dang mer mer po la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The conditions of those eyes, etc., are karma, afflictions, and the kalala, etc.

original: nang gi skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin te /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin te /
translated: â€œThey generate the internal sense spheresâ€ is the predicate.

original: de dag gi rkyen chos can rnams 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa kho na yin pa'i chos khyad par can bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rkyen chos can rnams 'bras bu mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa kho na yin pa'i chos khyad par can bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The subject, the conditions of those eyes, etc., have the special predicate â€œthey generate the internal sense spheres, the effects, eyes, etc.â€

original: rkyen yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin te ;
analyzed: rkyen yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin te ;
translated: â€œBecause they are conditionsâ€ is the reason.

original: de dag la bya ba dang ldan pa nyid ma grub kyang rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir rkyen las skye ba kho nar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams so //
analyzed: de dag la bya ba dang ldan pa nyid ma grub kyang rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir rkyen las skye ba kho nar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams so //
translated: The thought is that even though the activity of those conditions is not established, because they are conditions, they are generated from conditions.

original: dper na 'bru la sogs pas myu gu skyed par byed pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar te /
analyzed: dper na 'bru la sogs pas myu gu skyed par byed pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe yin par sbyar te /
translated: This is the example.

original: dper na 'bru la sogs pa yang rkyen yin pa'i phyir myu gu skyed par byed pa de bzhin du las dang nyon mongs pa dang mer mer po la sogs pa yang rkyen yin pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa khoğŸ”½na yin no //
analyzed: dper na 'bru la sogs pa yang rkyen yin pa'i phyir myu gu skyed par byed pa de bzhin du las dang nyon mongs pa dang mer mer po la sogs pa yang rkyen yin pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams skyed par byed pa kho na yin no //
translated: For example, just as a seed, etc. is a condition and generates a sprout, so karma, affliction, and the kalala, etc. are conditions and generate the internal sense bases such as the eyes.

original: de ltar re zhig rjes su 'gro ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rjes su 'gro ba bstan nas /
translated: Thus, first the forward order is taught.

original: da ni ldog pa bstan pa'i phyir gang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de la ni rkyen nyid med de /
analyzed: da ni ldog pa bstan pa'i phyir gang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de la ni rkyen nyid med de /
translated: Now, in order to teach the reverse order, he says, â€œThat which is not a generator is not a condition.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: For example, like the horn of a rabbit.â€

original: 'di skad bstan te /ğŸ”½ri bong gi rva ni med pa'i phyir de la rkyen nyid med do //
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / ri bong gi rva ni med pa'i phyir de la rkyen nyid med do //
translated: This is taught.ğŸ”½The horn of a rabbit does not exist, so it is not a condition.

original: rkyen nyid med pa'i phyir skyed par byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rkyen nyid med pa'i phyir skyed par byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not a condition, it is not a generator.

original: mer mer po la sogs pa la ni rkyen nyid med pa ma yin te yod pas de'i phyir de dag nang gi skye mched rnams skyed par @182b byed pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mer mer po la sogs pa la ni rkyen nyid med pa ma yin te yod pas de'i phyir de dag nang gi skye mched rnams skyed par @182b byed pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: But it is not that the conditions for the kalala, etc. do not exist, since they do exist. Therefore, they are only the producers of the internal sense spheres.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis rkyen nyid kyi gtan tshigs de sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis rkyen nyid kyi gtan tshigs de sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: In response to that, here the author of the commentary himself states the following in order to refute the reason of being a condition.

original: 'dir bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Here it is said:

original: 'dis ni tshig le'ur byas pa 'og ma dag sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshig le'ur byas pa 'og ma dag sbyor bar byed do //
translated: This connects with the verses below.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'o ;
translated: Here means in the teaching.

original: / gal te don dam par rkyen zhig yin par gyur na zhes bya ba ni gal te don dam par las dang nyon mongs pa dang mer mer po la sogs pa dag nang gi skye mched rnams kyi rkyen zhig yin par gyur na'o //
analyzed: / gal te don dam par rkyen zhig yin par gyur na zhes bya ba ni gal te don dam par las dang nyon mongs pa dang mer mer po la sogs pa dag nang gi skye mched rnams kyi rkyen zhig yin par gyur na'o //
translated: If it were a condition ultimately means if karma, affliction, and the kalala, etc. were conditions of the internal sense spheres ultimately.

original: yod pa'am med pa zhig gi yin grang na zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod pa'am med pa zhig gi rkyen yin grang na zhes gal gnyis su brtag pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa'am med pa zhig gi yin grang na zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod pa'am med pa zhig gi rkyen yin grang na zhes gal gnyis su brtag pa yin no //
translated: If it is asked whether it is of an existent or nonexistent effect, this is a twofold examination of whether the condition is of an existent or nonexistent effect.ğŸ”½Since it is not tenable for it to be of both,

original: de dag gnyi ga'i yin par yang rigs pas mi rung ste zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga'i yin par yang rigs pas mi rung ste zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: this is explained as follows:

original: 'bras bu yod pa la ni rkyen mi dgos la /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa la ni rkyen mi dgos la /
translated: If the effect is existent, the condition is not necessary.ğŸ”½If the effect is nonexistent, it would not be a condition of anything.

original: 'bras bu med na ni gang gi rkyen du yang mi 'gyur bas rigs pa de nyid kyis brtags na rkyen nyid du brtags pa'i gtan tshigs mi rung bas rkyen las skye ba med do zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'bras bu med na ni gang gi rkyen du yang mi 'gyur bas rigs pa de nyid kyis brtags na rkyen nyid du brtags pa'i gtan tshigs mi rung bas rkyen las skye ba med do zhes ston to //
translated: Since it is not tenable to impute a condition through reasoning in this way, this teaches that arising from conditions does not exist.

original: de'i phyir / med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
analyzed: de'i phyir / med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
analyzed: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
translated: A condition is not tenableğŸ”½For a nonexistent or existent object.ğŸ”½Since it is not tenable for it to be of both,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te zhes bya ba ni de gnyi ga'i yin par yang rigs bas mi rung ba ni bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te zhes bya ba ni de gnyi ga'i yin par yang rigs bas mi rung ba ni bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: this is explained as follows:

original: slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis tshig le'ur byas pa 'di gsungs te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis tshig le'ur byas pa 'di gsungs te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The master Nagarjuna himself states the verse:

original: 'dir ni dam bcas pa gnyis bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba la /ğŸ”½'bras bu med pa'i rkyen nyid du mi rung ba ni dam bcas pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni dam bcas pa gnyis bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba la / 'bras bu med pa'i rkyen nyid du mi rung ba ni dam bcas pa gnyis yin no //
translated: Here, the two theses are stated,ğŸ”½it is not tenable that a nonexistent is a condition.

original: 'bras bu yod pa'i rkyen du mi rung ba ni dam bcas pa gnyis pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa'i rkyen du mi rung ba ni dam bcas pa gnyis pa yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that an existent is a condition.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'dis dam bcas pa de gnyis bstan pa /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'dis dam bcas pa de gnyis bstan pa /
translated: The first half of the verse teaches these two theses.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa phyed 'og mas sgrub par byed pa yin no //ğŸ”½de la med pa'i rkyen du ji ltar mi rung ba de ston pa ni /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa phyed 'og mas sgrub par byed pa yin no // de la med pa'i rkyen du ji ltar mi rung ba de ston pa ni /
translated: The second half of the verse presents the proof.

original: med pa gang gi rkyen ces bya //
analyzed: med pa gang gi rkyen ces bya //
translated: Here, to show why it is not tenable that a nonexistent is a condition,ğŸ”½it says: How could a nonexistent be a condition?

original: zhes bya ba yin te zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba gnyis bstan pa de la 'bras bu med pa'i rkyen du mer mer po la sogs pa ji ltar mi rung ba de ston pa ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba gsum pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba gnyis bstan pa de la 'bras bu med pa'i rkyen du mer mer po la sogs pa ji ltar mi rung ba de ston pa ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba gsum pa 'di yin no //
translated: â€œThisâ€ refers to the two theses. The third line of the root stanza shows why it is not possible for the conditions of the nonexistent effect to be the embryo, etc.ğŸ”½In the world, the conditions of the nonexistentâ€”

original: 'di na nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa med pa gang gi rkyen ma lu ta'i lcug ma dag yin par shes par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di na nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa med pa gang gi rkyen ma lu ta'i lcug ma dag yin par shes par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: such as sky flowersâ€”are known to be mango sprouts, etc.

original: 'jig rten 'di na nam mkha'i me tog dang ri bong gi rva med pa gang gi rkyen shing ma lu ta'i lcug ma dag yin par @183a * //ğŸ”½shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di na nam mkha'i me tog dang ri bong gi rva med pa gang gi rkyen shing ma lu ta'i lcug ma dag yin par @183a * // shes par bya ste /
translated: In the world, the conditions of the nonexistentâ€”such as sky flowers and rabbit hornsâ€”are known to be mango sprouts, etc.

original: gang gi rkyen kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi rkyen kyang ma yin no //
translated: They are not conditions of anything.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the point.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo nyid mthong nas de skye ba la rkyen ces bya na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo nyid mthong nas de skye ba la rkyen ces bya na /
translated: If the conditions of the nonexistent effect are known to be the embryo, etc., it is because the nature of the effect is seen and it is said that it arises from those conditions.

original: gang gi tshe rkyen rnams la 'bras bu rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa de'i tshe na mer mer po la sogs pa dang 'bru la sogs pa dag ji ltar rkyen gyi tha snyad du 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rkyen rnams la 'bras bu rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa de'i tshe na mer mer po la sogs pa dang 'bru la sogs pa dag ji ltar rkyen gyi tha snyad du 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But when the effect does not exist inherently in conditions, then how could the sprout, etc., and the seed, etc., be called conditions?ğŸ”½Therefore, they are like a sky flower or the horn of a donkey, which are not conditions of anything.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni nam mkha'i me tog dang ri bong gi rva gang gi rkyen kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni nam mkha'i me tog dang ri bong gi rva gang gi rkyen kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is the meaning of the words.ğŸ”½The meaning of the root text is that those shoots of barley are not the conditions of anything that does not exist, such as a sky flower or the horn of a donkey.

original: ma lu ta'i lcug ma de dag ni nam mkha'i me tog dang ri bong gi rva med pa gang gi rkyen kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / de ni chos mthun pa'i dpes bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma lu ta'i lcug ma de dag ni nam mkha'i me tog dang ri bong gi rva med pa gang gi rkyen kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / de ni chos mthun pa'i dpes bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the teaching by means of an example that is similar.ğŸ”½The root text says:

original: med na gang gi rkyen zhes bya //
analyzed: med na gang gi rkyen zhes bya //
translated: If it does not exist, of what would it be a condition?

original: zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba des /
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba des /
translated: This is the root text of the verse.

original: dper na 'jig rten 'di na nam mkha' me tog dang ri bong gi rva med pa gang gi rkyen ma lu ta'i lcug ma dag yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten 'di na nam mkha' me tog dang ri bong gi rva med pa gang gi rkyen ma lu ta'i lcug ma dag yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: For example, in the world, the conditions of a sky flower and a rabbitâ€™s horns are known to be the shoots of a mallow plant.

original: de dag ni nam mkha'i me tog dang ri bong gi rva med pa gang gi yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ni nam mkha'i me tog dang ri bong gi rva med pa gang gi yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: They are known to be the conditions of a sky flower and a rabbitâ€™s horns.ğŸ”½But they are not the conditions of a sky flower and a rabbitâ€™s horns.

original: de dag ni nam mkha'i me tog dang ri bong gi rva gang gi rkyen kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes dpe bstan pa de ni 'bras bu mig la sogs pa dang / myu gu med pa gang gi rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa dang 'bru la sogs pa dag yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ni nam mkha'i me tog dang ri bong gi rva gang gi rkyen kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes dpe bstan pa de ni 'bras bu mig la sogs pa dang / myu gu med pa gang gi rkyen mer mer po la sogs pa dang 'bru la sogs pa dag yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the words is that the example demonstrates that the conditions of the nonexistence of the effect, such as the eye, and of the sprout, such as the seed, are known to be the conditions of the nonexistence of the effect, such as the eye, and of the sprout.ğŸ”½But they are not the conditions of the eye, etc., and of the sprout.

original: de dag ni mig la sogs pa dang myu gu med pa gang gi rkyen kyang ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'i don de'i chos mthun pa'i dpe bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni mig la sogs pa dang myu gu med pa gang gi rkyen kyang ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'i don de'i chos mthun pa'i dpe bstan pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is that the example demonstrates the similarity of the meaning of the example to the meaning of the thesis.

original: 'bras bu med na rkyen gyi chos ni 'bras bu med pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu med na rkyen gyi chos ni 'bras bu med pa nyid yin la /
translated: If the effect does not exist, the phenomenon of conditions would be nonexistent.

original: 'bras bu'i chos kyang med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa'i dpes mtshon pa'i don bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos kyang med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa'i dpes mtshon pa'i don bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not the meaning indicated by the example of similarity.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being said:
